loans.name: Talifaia

texts.en:
Talifaia N., 50, married with six children, has three years of experience in the ice-cake and popcorn business, selling to the villagers and public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 370 Tala (~154 USD).

Talifaia received one previous loan from SPBD, her only source of capital since she has never qualified for a loan from the traditional banks. Part of the money will be used to buy ingredients for her business and part to acquire equipment for home improvements.  Talifaia has two working children and one who is overseas, each giving her financial help to support her business and family needs.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as sacks of sugar, foam cups, peanut and corn seeds for her business.

loans.name: Flor Jovina

texts.es:
La señora Flor Jovina M. L. tiene 35 años, vive en el caserío de Milán, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 1ro de secundaria, abandono los estudios debido a que se caso muy joven y tuvo que dedicarse a su hogar, tiene 06 hijos de los cuales 05 aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
Flor tiene una Bodega, al principio se dedicaba con su esposo a la compra- venta de animales, hasta que decidió vender sus animales y abrir una tienda de abarrotes, hace ya 5 años , negocio que abandono por 1 año debido a que se enfermo y que luego empezó nuevamente, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
Con el crédito de 500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de  abarrotes y útiles escolares. 
Flor tiene el gran sueño de ver a sus hijos profesionales
texts.en:
Señora Flor Jovina M. L. is 35 and lives in the town of Milán, in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied through her first year of secondary school and abandoned her studies because she got married very young and had to dedicate herself to her home. She has six children, five of whom still depend on her economically. Flor has a grocery store. At first she helped her husband buy and sell animals until she decided to sell her animals and open a grocery store. She opened it five years ago but later put it on hold for one year because she got sick. She started it again and has her store in her house. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from her communal bank, "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Hard-Working Women), she invested in the purchase of groceries for her store. With this credit of 500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of groceries and school supplies. Flor has the great dream of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and school supplies

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. V. is a simple entrepreneur.  She sells fish balls in her village using her improvised nutria-cart.  She is 38 years old and married to Gilbert, a carpenter.  They resiD. peacefully in the village of Rizal Quirino, Isabela with their two children: Algietfae, 10 years old, is a graD. school student and Janefpypper, 8 years old, is also in graD. school. Alma is thankful that they have a healthy family.  

She wants to improve her business and hopefully put up a small store so she can have additional income.  She now wants a loan of at least PHP 7,000.00 as business capital.  According to Alma, through her good relationship with her customers, she is able to generate a good income.  Someday, she is also planning to engage in vegetable and rice vending.  She hopes that through her business, she can continue to proviD. the school allowance for her children and they can finish their studies.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 47-year-old and a resident of Misom, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a private employee of MOELCI-I and they are blessed with three children. Her eldest daughter is a graduate of education and the other two are still in elementary school. Recently, she applied for her fifth loan cycle in the amount of Php 4,500 for her rice-production business and to purchase fertilizer. Her ambition is to help her two children who are still in elementary school finish college. And for her proposed project, she's hoping that it will be a success and grows bountifully so that it could help support their daily needs.

loans.use: Capital for rice production and fertilizer

loans.name: Jonjib

texts.en:
"I started tilling a 3.5 hectare farm during my high school years. My harvest is what I use to buy my needs. I work so that I would have savings of my own for my future family. I help my siblings too with paying for their school needs and my parents with the household expenses. I dreamed that someday I could have a bigger farm so that I could provide for all the needs of all my loved ones," says Jonjib P., 27-year-old single man from Agusan Del Sur.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase herbicides, 30 liters of crude oil and fertilizers. The loan will truly help him to improve his harvest.

CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, 30 liters of crude oil and fertilizers.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de 2 polygames, 2 monogames et d’une veuve  soit au total 5 femmes  vivant toutes dans le quartier Angoulême de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative du Mali) et ayant  en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants. 
Elles se sont connues à travers de liens de voisinage, de leurs activités commerciales et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle d’entraide.
Elles  font le commerce d’articles divers avec la vente de pagnes wax,  du bois de chauffe, de savons, la préparation et vente des boissons locales et de l’encens. 
Dans le souci de pérenniser leurs activités génératrices de revenus, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 7ème  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter : 6 pièces de pagnes wax, 13 cartons de savons, 50 kg de n’guéni, 3 kg de magnonkissèni, 10 flacons d’eau de Cologne et parfums, 1 sac de sucre, 1 panier d’oseille de Guinée, 40 kg de gingembre, 1 panier de tamarin, 1 carton d’essences, 1 paquet de sachets en plastique pour emballage. Elles se ravitaillent à la foire hebdomadaire du grand marché de Ségou en ces matières premières et revendent toutes leurs marchandises au comptant, en détail et à crédit  à domicile, en ambulant dans les quartiers, dans les foires hebdomadaires de Konodimini, de Zambougou et dans les villages de N’Gara et de Banankoroni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles espèrent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et augmenter le volume de leurs activités. 
Elles  ambitionnent acheter d’autres congélateurs et devenir grossistes dans les activités qu’elles mènent.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of two polygamous women, two monogamous women, and a widow, thus a total of five women living in the Angoulême district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have an average age of 42 and six children. The group members know one another through ties of marriage, community, commercial businesses, and membership in the same traditional mutual-aid association. Their businesses include commerce in various goods with the sale of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), firewood, and soaps. And they make and sell local beverages and incense. Concerned about perpetuating their income-generating businesses, they became organized in order to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their seventh solidarity loan. All the previous loans have been correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy: six bolts of Wax pagnes, thirteen boxes of soap, 50 kg of n’guéni (seeds of a wild plant), 3 kg of magnonkissèni (seeds of another wild plant), ten bottles of eau de cologne and perfumes, a sack of sugar, a basket of dried hibiscus flowers, 40 kg of ginger, a basket of tamarind, a box of flavorings, and a packet of plastic bags for packaging. Supplies of these essential items are gotten at the weekly fair of the grand marketplace of Ségou. Sales of their merchandise are all made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, at the weekly fairs of Konodimini and Zambougou and in the villages of N’Gara and Banankoroni. Their customers are composed of men and women. The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and to increase their business volume. Their ambition is to buy more freezers and to become wholesalers in the businesses they operate.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, soap, and ingredients for making incense and juice drinks

loans.name: Aurelia Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la departamento de León, la señora Aurelia H. se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos los cuales son preparados por ella misma para ofrecerlos en su localidad donde es muy visitada por sus clientes.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos ya que le es necesidad adquirirlos prontamente y así continuar en el mejoramiento de su negocio de venta de alimentos y satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
ln the department of León, Mrs. Aurelia H. prepares food to be sold in her area, and she is visited by many clients.

The reason why she has approched Ceprodel is to request a loan to buy raw material to prepare the dishes which is urgent for her to be able to continue improving her business selling food and keep her clients satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Claudine

texts.fr:
S. Claudine a 30 ans. Elle est mariée à GAGUI Albert Soudeur et est mère d'un enfant qui est au première année a l’école. Elle est née à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin et elle y habite avec sa famille.  Claudine vend de nourriture y compris mais et gari, le nom Béninois de la farine de cassave.  Elle prépare des repas pour ses clients.  

Claudine a un respect scrupuleux de son échéancier de remboursement. Avec un nouveau crédit, elle désire de s’approvisionner afin de mieux faire face aux nombreuses exigences de sa fidèle clientèle.  Elle voudrait acheter plus de mais, de gari, des cartons d'ailerons.
texts.en:
Claudine S. is 30 years old. She is married to Albert Soudeur Gagui and is the mother of a child who is in grade one. She was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin and she lives with her family. Claudine sells food products including corn and gari, the Benin word for cassava flour. She prepares meals for her clients. Claudine has a conscientious respect for her loan repayment schedule. With this new loan she wishes to resupply her products so that she may better meet the high demand of her faithful clientele. She would like to purchase more corn, gari, and cases of fish.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of corn, gari and fish

loans.name: Nehme

texts.en: Nehme is a 36-year-old married woman. She has owned a flower shop called the "Flowers Kingdom" for the past 12 years, and works hard to help her husband support their family. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy new flower stands for her shop and satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: buy new flower stands for her shop

loans.name: Emeterio

texts.en:
Emeterio W. is from the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 68 years old. Emeterio is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emeterio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emeterio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Emeterio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emeterio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Emeterio is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Emeterio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en: Fareed is 22 year old single man. He lives in the city of Jericho in Palestine. Fareed owns a radio station and he is requesting a loan of $2000 USD to purchase a well-functioning computer, which he is lacking in his business, as well as other pieces of equipment needed in running a radio station. He wants to offer high quality service to his clients and the community.He says thanks to all who have made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and other pieces of equipment needed in running a radio station

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 47 años, es una mujer muy laboriosa, vive con su esposo. Su única hija vive y trabaja en otra ciudad. Se dedica a la siembra de papas en sus propias chacras y debido a la experiencia ganada en todos estos años ha logrado el dominio de las técnicas agrícolas. En consecuencia, junto a su pareja han conseguido que sus cultivos le sean muy rentables y con esas ganancias educaron a su hija en Lima (ciudad capital), pagando también su estadía y alimentación mientras estudiaba. Irene comercializa sus productos en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad, donde todos los miércoles por la tarde (en época de cosecha), vende las papas más grandes entre 30 y 50 soles el saco; las medianas, las guarda en su depósito, esperando que los otros compradores de la zona costeña la visiten. A Irene le gusta sembrar este tubérculo porque aunque sea de mucha inversión, siempre recupera y gana, cuyos ahorros viene reuniendo para comprar otros terrenos de su cultivo. 
Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete y aconseja a sus compañeros de grupo a seguir pagando puntualmente sus cuotas, siendo ella la tesorera de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y funguicidas para su próxima siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Irene is 47 years old, she is an industrious woman and lives with her husband. Her only daughter lives and works in another city. Irene works planting potatoes in her own farm and due to the experience gained over the years, she has mastered the necessary agricultural techniques. Consequently, working together with her spouse, they have managed to have profitable crops and have used their earnings to pay for their daughter’s education in Lima (capital city), including room and board. Irene sells her products in the city’s wholesale market, where every Wednesday afternoon (during the crop season) she sells the biggest potatoes for about 30 to 50 soles per sack; she keeps the medium-sized potatoes, hoping to sell them to other buyers visiting from coastal areas. Irene likes to plant this tuber because in spite of the high investment required, she always recoups it and makes a profit; she has been saving to buy more potato fields. This is her fifth loan with MFP, encouraging a personal commitment and advising her fellow group members to continue making payments on time, since she is also the treasurer of the community bank. She is thinking of investing her loan in buying chemical fertilizers and fungicides for her next potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fertilizers

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children.She sells detergent in retail to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She started this business in the year 2000. She uses her experience in the business to atrract and retain her customers.She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more detergent to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more detergent to sell

loans.name: Ndejje A Ntege Dorothy Group

texts.en:
N. Dorothy is a married businesswoman, forty years old, and blessed with six children who are schooling. She also has three dependents of whom two are schooling.

Dorothy has a business dealing in bricks and scrap which she has been operating for over six years. She is using the loan for bricklaying and purchasing scrap for recycling in order to expand her business.

Dorothy is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To use for bricklaying and to purchase more scraps for recycling

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha Lorena tiene 46 años de edad, su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 8 que se dedica a este negocio, el cual dio inicio vendiendo poco a poco y fue a partir de ese momento que fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio para hacerlo más grande, y poder vivir de ese negocio, ya que los trabajos están escasos en nuestro país. El crédito será invertido  en su negocio principalmente. A pesar de no tener una educación completa. Por lo que el deseo de Martha es  seguir con este empeño de salir adelante
Con su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 46-years-old and she works as a pork butcher. She has been in this line of work for more than eight years and she began her business by selling bit by bit. At this moment she is reinvesting in her business to make it larger so she will be able to live solely on this income, as jobs are scarce in her country. The loan will mainly be used to invest in her business. Despite not having completed her education, Martha desires to continue this effort to succeed with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for pork butchering

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида Хучамуродова проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 21 год. Замужем, детей не имеет. Фарида более 3 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает запчасти от велосипеда. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента, т.е. хоз. товаров для расширения бизнеса. Ей в этом также помогает муж.
texts.en:
Farida H. lives in the Shahrituz region. She's twenty-one years old, married and has no children. For more than three years Farida, assisted by her husband, has sold spare bicycle parts on the market. She is requesting a loan in order to buy new household supplies and expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. makes a living primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the city of Linao East, Tuguegarao City. Teresita has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita C. is from the town of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Pacita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita P. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Subhon

texts.ru: Боронов Субхон проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Боронов Субхон  имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Мед. брат".  Продажей лекарств занимается  более 6 лет. Он имеет собственную аптеку. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Subhon B. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. Subhon has a secondary technical education as a nurse. He has been involved in pharmaceutical sales for over 6 years. He has his own pharmacy. Subhon is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Idalia Francisca

texts.es: Idalia Francisca tiene 56 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida por lo que tiene más de 31 años de realizar este pequeño negocio. Ella es una persona muy generosa y trabajadora, por lo que siempre le ha gustado mejorar la vida de su familia. A pesar de los problemas que enfrenta como es problemas de salud, ya que ella elabora las comidas y al mismo tiempo  las vende, pero con la poca  ayuda de sus hijos ha logrado mejorar en el servicio de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, queso, verduras y además frutas para la elaboración de refrescos naturales. Ella sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Idalia Francisca is 56 years old. Her economic activity is selling food. She has been doing this small business for more than 31 years. She is a very generous and hard working person. This is why she has always liked to improve her family's life. Despite the problems she faces, such as health problems, she makes the food and also sells it, and with a lttle help from her children she has been able to improve the service for her clients. The financing she is asking for is for working capital which will be used for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, cheese, vegetables and fruit as well to make natural drinks. She dreams of improving her income and her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma D. is from the village of Manolo, Fortich Bukidnon. She is 46 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a business buying and selling electronic load (prepaid cellular phone credits) in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El Sr. Ronald tiene la actividad de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi actividad que desarrolla con su automovil, esta es su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia que esta compuesta por su esposa y su hijo de tres años el llega a emprender por recomendacion de su compañero de trabajo que tambien es cliente nuestro, el destino del credito  es para reparar y realizar un mantenimiento general de su automovil y asi poder trabajar sin ningun problema. El Sr. Ronald es una persona responsable dinamica, esta muy agradecido con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ronald works for a radio taxi service, which he does with his car. This is the main source of income for him and his family, which is made up of his wife and three year-old son. He came to Emprender [Kiva Field Partner] at the recommendation of a co-worker who is also a client of ours. The loan will be used to make repairs and do general maintenance work on his car so that it will function without problems. Ronald is a responsible and dynamic person and he is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in granting him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs and do general maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 48 years old and single with three children who go to school. She has been running a green grocery for five years. She also rears dairy cattle and sells milk. With the business, she is able to meet her family’s expenses and pay school fees for her children. Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, her living conditions hves improved because she can access loans to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and open outlets in the future. She has requested for a loan from Faulu Kenya to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick O. I. is 50 years of age, married and the father of five children who are dependent on him. He lives in Nambale, Busia District. He runs a brick making business which he started in September 2009 as a source of income generation. Before this he was employed as an electrician in one of the local businesses.

Fredrick makes his stock twice a month and sells it in the surrounding villages. He would like a loan of Kshs. 30,000 which he says he will invest in the brick making business by employing new labor and increasing his production base. His future dream is to buy a vehicle for the business.

loans.use: To expand a brick making business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 44 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella ha sacrificado mucho para mejorar sus ingresos y mantener a sus 4 hijos que están a su cargo, lo que le resulta mucho más difícil es el tiempo que tiene disponible para dedicárselo a sus hijos, ya que algunas veces tiene que estar atendiendo a sus clientes. Esto no la desanima a seguir adelante, pues así podrá esforzarse más para mejorar cada día. Ella solicita este financiamiento para golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos. Su deseo es mantener su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 44 years old and manages a store. She has been in this business for more than seven years and has made sacrifices to improve her income and support her four dependent children. The most difficult part for her is having enough time available to devote to her children since she is always attending to her customers. This has not discouraged her from moving forward because she is determined to do more to improve each day. Maria Elena is requesting this loan to purchase candy, refreshments, bread, detergents, and basic grains. Her wish is to keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, refreshments, bread, detergents, and basic grains

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is a 27-year old single man. He is living on his own. He has owned and run a cafeteria since 2006. He employs one part-time worker. He has completed his education through primary school.

He is requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. to invest in new tools and equipment for his cafeteria. This will be his first loan from Ameen. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profit by 15 percent.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to more than 41,000 borrowers and disbursed more than 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in new tools and equipment for his cafeteria

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli P. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 47 years old. Arceli is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arceli owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Arceli has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP when she sells her raised pigs.

In 2010, Arceli joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arceli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2010 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Arceli from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Tuyom, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by farming and selling rice. Rosemarie’s husband, Nelson, is a farmer and pastor and they have seven children who are between 18 and 36 years old. They have one child who is currently going to school and also helps out with the business as part of their daily chores. Their other six children are already working.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her rice business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities.

Rosemarie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her rice business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 16th loan, in the amount of 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use on her farming activities. Rosemarie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

Rosemarie is shown in the accompanying photo with her stockpile of rice grains that she sells.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem  that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products to incorporate into her current inventory

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan T. Q. N. is 51 years old and lives in Luc Canh village with her husband and her two children.

Mrs Lan not only grows rice but also makes and sells paper clothes and paper furniture (people usually buy them to burn for the dead). She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) and has had this business for fifteen years.

Mrs Lan has participated in SEDA since 2006. For her last loan, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more paper and goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more paper and goods to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 47 años, es un padre de familia muy sincero y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Eugenia de 47 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Cuando era niño, los padres de Carlos le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café y plátano, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plagas de insectos que afectan la producción. Desea comprarse un carro, para que pueda transportar sus productos cosechados. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 47, is a sincere and happy father. He lives with his wife Eugenia, also 47, and their two beloved children, to whom he wants to give a better quality of life. When he was a boy, Carlos' parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming. Over time he took charge of more and more of his parents' land. Now he has a large area under cultivation, where he grows cofee and bananas to sell in the market in the city of La Merced. What he likes most about his work is cultivating the land where he grows food for his family. It has taken him 12 years to get to where he is today. What he considers most difficult is protecting his crops from the insect pests that reduce his harvest. One day he would like to buy himself a car so that he can transport his produce. this is the third loan Carlos has had from MFP. He has always been very punctual with his repayments and hopes to remain so. He is trusted as a member of his communal bank. With the 1500 soles he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Nelida;  Ella tiene 53 años de edad,  es separado y tiene 4 hijos;  se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende ropa,  también vende cobertores de camas, sabanas y trae algunos pedidos especiales. La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Nelida, and she is 53 years old. She is separated and has 4 children. She works in retail trade, buying and selling clothing. She also sells bedspreads and sheets, and she fills some special orders. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. She is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly, she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 63 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia. Hace muchos años tenia una familia muy feliz y tras la muerte de su hijo, su esposa lo abandono. Desde entonces pensó en salir adelante solo, se puso a construir su caca, acondicionando varias habitaciones. Ahora tiene 6 inquilinos que habitan esos cuartos, por lo que cobra mensualmente el alquiler y eso le satisface de sobre manera, es por ello que sigue preocupado  en darles todas las comodidades a sus arrendatarios, ya que le genera buenas ganancias. En vista de ello Rolando se ha empeñado en poner otro lavatorio para lavar ropa. Su proyecto de vida es tener una casa hermosa con muchos cuartos, por lo que se propone realizarlo, para que no tenga problemas en el futuro y poder vivir de sus rentas. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que valora la utilidad del dinero, en la mejora de su casa. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cementos y ladrillos, para que construya el lavatorio.
texts.en:
Rolando, 63, is a very hard working man. He lives alone in his own house. Many years ago he had a very happy family but after the death of his son his wife abandoned him. Since then, he has gotten ahead alone. He started to build his house furnishing several rooms. Now he has six lodgers who live in those rooms. He charges them a monthly rental fee and this is quite satisfactory for him because he earns good profits so he strives to provide his tenants with all the comforts. In light of this, Rolando has seen fit to install another laundry room to do laundry. His life project is to have a beautiful house with many rooms. He intends to accomplish this so that he can live off his rents in the future. This is his 8th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because he values the utility of the money in making improvements to his house. He will use the requested funds to buy cement and bricks to build the laundry room.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and bricks to build a laundry room.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto L. F., tiene 55 años es casado y con la felicidad de tener  4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 32 años, dos de ellos gemelos. Es un hombre que desde hace 20 años aprendió el ofcio de confeccionar ropa para caballeros, como pantalones de hombres, camisas y blusas, en un taller familiar y gradualmente se ha ido dedicando a ello de manera independiente de la mano de sus hermana que ha sido un muy buen apoyo.

En la actualidad Juan Alberto es muy reconocido en el sector de la Playa, donde vive con su cónyuge y tiene un buen número de clientes y contratos por su excelente calidad en las prendas que fabrica. Como Juan Alberto es un hombre de muchas idas desde hace un año adquirió 3 lavadoras producto de las utilidades generadas por su confección, pues observó una nueva oportunidad de ingreso para su familia si respondía a  la necesidad de facilitarle el trabajo doméstico de las amas de casa, mediante el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras. Con este nuevo negocio le ha ido muy bien porque el sector es de poca competencia. En la actualidad requiere su credikiva, tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pues ya vienen las fiestas de fin de año y debe preparase para elaborar la mas elegante ropa para las familias clientes, comprando telas e insumos de confección y también va a comprar 3 lavadoras mas para aumentar la efectividad de su otra idea de negocio.

Juan Alberto ha manifestado cambios en su negocio desde que se vinculó como cliente de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace algo mas de   2 años, ha logrado por ejemplo aumentar sus utilidades y con ellas comprar una motocicleta que le genera otro ingreso pues ofrece el servicio de transporte, crear otro negocio como el de alquiler de lavadoras y también ha podido comprar en un mayor volumen las materias primas e insumos que no hubiera podido lograr él solo. Su sueño ahora se centra en tener una boutique donde su propia ropa se encuentre en exhibición.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto L. F., 55, is married and joyful to have four children between the ages of 26 and 32 years, two of them twins. He is a man who 20 years ago learned how to make men’s clothing like pants, shirts and blouses, in a family workshop. Gradually he has moved into working independently with help from his sister who has been a very good collaborator. Currently he is very well known in his area, La Playa, where he lives with his wife. He has a good number of customers and contracts thanks to the excellent quality of the clothing items he manufactures. Because Juan Alberto is a man with many ideas a year ago he acquired three washing machines with profits from his sewing because he recognized a new way to earn income for his family by providing a service that would make housewives’ work easier: washing machine rentals. He has done quite well with this new business because he has little competition in this area. He needs a Kiva loan, his third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because the end of year festivities are approaching and he must be prepared to make the more elegant items his customer families will require. He needs to buy fabric and sewing supplies as well as to buy three more washing machines for his other business. Juan Alberto has noticed changes in his business since becoming affiliated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a little more than two years ago. For example, his profits have increased and with them he was able to buy a motorcycle that generates still more income because he offers transportation services. He created another business: the washing machine rental services and he has also been able to buy larger amounts of raw materials and supplies he would not have been able to do on his own. His dream now is to have a boutique where his own clothing creations may be displayed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabric and sewing supplies.  He will also buy three washing machines to increase efficiency in his other business.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de San José. Una zona pesquera que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a  veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la preparación y venta al por mayor de papas rellenas y tortas de choclo (platos típicos de la zona usados generalmente como aperitivos). Ella prepara estos productos en su vivienda y luego los distribuye en los restaurantes y puestos de venta de comida en su localidad. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Su esposo es pescador y con los ingresos que ambos perciben se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Carmen Rosa desea adquirir mas insumos para ampliar su producción y percibir un mayor número de ganancias. Asimismo desea adquirir mas cerveza para ampliar su negocio de venta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Carmen es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a mother to her family and is 31-years-old.  She lives with her husband in the San Jose district. They live in a fishing area in the Lambayeque province that is located 20 minutes outside the city of Chiclayo.

She has worked for six years preparing and selling wholesale papas rellenas [stuffed potatoes] and tortas de choclo [a sweet corn cake] which are typical dishes in this area that are generally served as appetizers.  She prepares these products in her home and then distributes them to restaurants and food stands in her area.  Additionally, she works selling beer out of her home.  Her husband is a fisherman and with both of their incomes they are able to support their family.

Carmen Rosa would like to purchase more supplies to expand her production and increase her profits. She would also like to acquire more beer to expand her sales business.  In order to achieve her goal, she has found it convenient to request her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 soles.

Carmen is a very responsible woman and very devoted to her family.  Her greatest desire is to see her family make progress and enjoy a greater quality of life.  Everyone who knows her considers her to be someone who is very friendly and who can be counted on.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to expand her business producing and selling appetizers.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Lolita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and canned goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Edena

texts.en:
Edena T. is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for 5 years and earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP. Edena is 37 years old, married and has 2 school-aged kids. She is from the village of Landing, Baliangao.

In 2004, Edena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Edena is requesting her 12th loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the expansion of her existing business.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the expansion of the business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda G., 53, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is already widowed is working hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses.

Yolanda manages her own farm. She mostly grows seasonal crops which she then sells to the local markets. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php28,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more supplies for the farm like fertilizers, seedlings and other products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Yolanda dreams of being able to buy her own delivery vehicle, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for the farm like fertilizers, seedlings, and other products expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sophia Sopiato

texts.en:
Sophia Sopiato is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband is a businessman.  Sophia runs a retail shop at Bissil market which is a very busy location.  Her customers are both residents of Bissil and livestock traders. 

Sophia has been running her business for four years and her monthly profit is 26,500 KES.  This loan of  30,000 KES is Sophia's first loan with KADET.  She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.  She plans to increase stocks of sugar, rice, flour,cooking oil, and snacks. If this loan increases her business, Sophia plans to buy cattle for trade.

Sophia who describes herself as hardworking and dreams of having a wholesale store or a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, and snacks

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn F. is 34 years old, married, and has two adult children. Marilyn engages in the business of buying and selling pigs in their area in Bocator, Tangub City.  She has been in this business for five years and she earns an average net income of approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Marilyn joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she is very interested in its products and services. She is applying for a loan for 4,000 PHP, which is her first loan.  She will use the loan to purchase more pigs to sell. Marilyn wishes to expand their market to other cities and even to other countries someday. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Mhamad

texts.ar:
محمد عمره 43 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في النقل العام له في عمله حوالي 12 سنة يحب عمله ولكنه يلقى صعوبة
مادية لكثرة المصاريف يحب عائلته ويريد ان يكون لهم مستقبل جيد له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة تلقى دعم كبير من العائلة
عنده حب التطور والتجدد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء سيارة جديدة وتأجيرها لكي يستفيد منها
فهو بحاجة كبيرة الى المساعدة في زيادة المدخول
texts.en: Mhamad is a 43-year-old husband and father of three who is always looking to secure a future for his family and who in turn is greatly supported by them. For the past twelve years, Mhamad has been working as a taxi driver. He loves to always develop. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Mhamad is now asking for another loan to purchase a new taxi cab.

loans.use: To purchase new taxi

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem T. is a 24-year-old husband and father of two daughters. His daughters are one and two years old. He is from Ethna village in Hebron district. Naseem is still working on furnishing his house, as he is an employee and couldn't furnish the whole house when he decided to get married. He is an employee in a trading company. 

Naseem took out a loan from FATEN to furnish the girls' room and paint it. Naseem appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and improve his house

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been practicing mixed farming for six years now in Kitale town, western Kenya. His main products are milk and eggs which are sold locally. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business in the same location.

John has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, having successfully repaid his three previous loans. He has requested this loan of 30,000 Kes to expand his poultry farm. The profits from this investment will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. He plans to acquire a generator and a power-saw in the next five years.

John is 33 years old and married, with three school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula pertenece al Banco comunal “Nueva vida”, perteneciente a la provincia de Molina. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida rápida que consiste en hot dog, papas fritas y bebidas.

Rubro que desempeña desde hace 2 años en un kiosco que acomodó en el patio de su casa. Su esposo le ayuda en la atención de clientes.

Tiene como clientes frecuentes a sus vecinos y conocidos. Ella trabaja de lunes a domingo por las tardes y los fines de semana el horario se extiende hasta las 04ºº de la madrugada.

Con este préstamo, Paula abrirá otro local en el mismo rubro de venta de comida rápida, ya que obtuvo su casa propia y en el patio de ésta acomodará este nuevo local. De esta manera uno de sus sueños se podría concretar. 

Las motivaciones de Paula para seguir con éste negocio son los ingresos generados y el horario flexible que tiene éste, ya que le permite estar tiempo con sus hijas de 9 y 5 años de edad.

Para Paula los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido fundamentales en su negocio, ya que le han permitido aprender a invertir, ahorrar y distribuir mejor sus ingresos. Respecto a su grupo, ella se siente muy cómoda y contenta. 

Molina es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, ubicada en la región del Maule. Se caracteriza principalmente por ser uno de los grandes polos de la industria vitivinícola chilena. Además de las vides, está la industria frutícola, destacando la producción de manzanas, peras y kiwis.
texts.en:
Paula belongs to the "Nueva Vida" ("New Life") Communal Bank in the province of Molina. She works selling fast food like hot dogs, french fries, and drinks. She has been doing this for the last two years from a kiosk located on the patio of her house. Her husband helps her tend to customers.

Her regular customers include her neighbors and acquaintances. She works from Monday to Sunday in the afternoons and on weekends she stays open until 4:00 in the morning. 

With this loan, Paula will open another location for selling fast food, similar to the first. She recently got her own house and the patio there will accommodate her new stand. With this, one of her dreams will be a reality.

Paula is motivated to continue with this business because of the income it generates and the flexible schedule, which allows her to spend time with her 9 and 5 years old children.

For Paula, the loans from Fondo Esperanza have been fundamental to her business, as they have made it possible for her to invest, save, and better distribute her income. In regards to her group, she feels very comfortable and happy.

Molina is a town in Chile's central zone, located in the Maule region. It is characterized mainly for being one of the large winemaking centers of Chile. Aside from wine, there is also the fruit-growing industry, which produces apples, pears, and kiwi fruit.

loans.use: to open a second fast food kiosk

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 39 años. Vive en concubinato con Horacio, con quien tiene 2 hijos a los cuales cuida en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de guacamayo (selva central peruana). Su esfuerzo y dedicación durante estos 10 años, le sirvieron para obtener 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra naranja, cacao y plátanos. Los cuales después de cada cosecha los comercializan en el mercado número 2 de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Asimismo tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde vende bebidas, y frutas por unidad, pero según menciona baja 2 veces a la semana al mercado a vender frutas de temporada por kilos, de esa manera obtiene un dinero extra. Ahora ella se está preparando para su próxima cosecha de plátanos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito  tiene con MFP, donde se compromete a trabajar de manera conjunta por el progreso de su asociación. Margarita, invertirá el crédito en la compra de 200 a 300 kilos de plátanos, los cuales venderá por kilos en el mercado de minoristas de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Margarita is 39 years old and lives in cohabitation with Horacio, with whom she has two children.  They live together in their own house in the community of Guacamayo in the Central Peruvian jungle.  Their efforts and dedication the last ten years has given them four hectares of agricultural land where they plant oranges, cacao, and bananas.  After each harvest, the sell their produce in the number 2 market in the city of Pichanaki.

Margarita also has a grocery store where she sells drinks and fruit by the unit.  Twice a week she goes to the market to sell seasonal fruit by the kilo to gain extra money.  Now she is preparing for their next crop of bananas.  She belongs to the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer Guacamayo," (New Dawn Guacamayo), and this is her first loan with MFP.  She is committed to working together for the progress of their partnership.  

Margarita will use the requested loan to buy 200 to 300 kilos of bananas, which she will sell by the kilo in the retail market of her city.

loans.use: To buy 300 kilos of bananas for retail sale.

loans.name: Nyamirengyere Development Group-Kihihi

texts.en: 35 year old B. William makes common cause with Nyamirengyere Development group-Kihihi. 8 years is the time he has been running his food sales enterprise in Kihihi food market. The happily married father of three is a stickler for diligence and he cites it as the overriding factor as to why he has been able to make significant strides over the course of the last few years. He became involved in this business when he sensed the ready market for staple foods such as Irish potatoes, bananas, cassava, maize, beans, rice, etc in his home area. Before that, William worked in a timber sales business. By his own account, profits from this business enabled him to take root in his current business. Weekly his business generates him shillings 80,000 in profits. William is requesting this loan to purchase more food such as Irish potatoes, bananas, cassava, etc to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more food such as irish potatoes, cassava, bananas, etc to resell

loans.name: Ledegonde

texts.en:
Ledegonde is 24 years old, married and has one child who is one year and one month old. Her husband and she own a shop in which they sell many items that are commonly used at home such as sugar, salt and maize flour.

Ledegonde is requesting a loan to buy sugar, salt and maize. With her earnings she plans to buy more sugar, salt and maize in order to increase her capital and make more in profits.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and maize to sell

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El solicitante es el señor Virgilio González de 47 años de edad, está  casado y tiene casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias, es del Barrio  San Blas  de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene 3 hijos, 2 de edad escolar y uno más pequeño.
El mismo es microempresario, propietario de una despensa y frutería, además de ofrecer servicios de electricidad; cuenta con 8 años de antigüedad  lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.
Está solicitando el crédito para las compras de mercaderías como ser harina, aceite, azúcar yerba y otros productos traídos de  Argentina, pues posee mejores costos allí, lo que le deja un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Virgilio González is 47 years old, married, and owns his own home which has all the basic comforts he needs.  He lives in San Blas neighborhood, in the city of Encarnación.  Virgilio has three children.  Two of his children are school age and one is not yet old enough for school.

Virgilio is a small businessman.  He owns a grocery store and fruit shop and also offers electricity services.  He has been in this line of work for 8 years which means that he has very good customers and income.

Virgilio is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as flour, oil, sugar, yerba mate and other products from Argentina since he gets his goods for a better price there which gives him a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy essentials, flour, oil, yerba mate, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher G. was born in 1978 in the Koti village area of Ijevan, and he still lives in his native village. Mher is married and has two sons (3 and 5 years old).
 
Mher, his wife and his mother are engaged in animal breeding, land cultivation, gardening and beekeeping. They raise cows, calves and chickens; grow wheat, oat, grapes, fruits and vegetables on their farm. With income from farming Mher supports his family and he was able to buy needed furniture for his house.

This is Mher’s seventh loan from Nor Horizon, and he has never delayed his repayments. Now he is seeking an 820,000 AMD loan to buy a cow, four piglets and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy a cow, four piglets and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal, 63, is married and lives with his wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Dornod province of Mongolia. All his children are grown up and live separately. He manages a vegetable trading business at a local market. He plants a variety of vegetables, such as tomato, cucumber, carrots, cabbage, and potatoes, etc. He is a polite man who is planning to continue his business in the future. 

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new truck in order to transport his vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck

loans.name: Rose Marilyn

texts.en:
Rose Marilyn is engaged in the farming business. She plants and harvests rice for sale. Rose Marilyn is generating PHP 30,000 during harvest season. She uses her income for the education of her four school-aged children.

At present, Marilyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her to sustain her business.

In the future, Rose Marilyn hopes to start another business aside from her farming business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor es un padre de familia de 39 años  de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia y no cuenta con  servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

Víctor se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón; una vez que se da la cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona, es un producto muy rentable porque se cosecha semanalmente, con sus ventas podrá brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón y para el pago de mano de obra para el deshierbos.  Víctor es una persona  responsable y trabajadora que lo único que quiere es darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is a 39-year-old father who lives in his own home with his wife and children. He does not receive any basic services. Victor resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This district is known for the businesses of its residents who engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and producing handicrafts.

Victor has been farming for some time. He has his own land on which he grows lemons. When the fruits are ready to be harvested, he sells them at the local market. This type of product is very profitable because it can be harvested on a weekly basis. Through his sales, Victor is able to provide his family a better quality of life.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers to apply on his farmland, which will guarantee a good level of lemon production. In addition, he will be able to pay workers to help with the removal of weeds. Victor is a responsible and hardworking individual. The only thing he wants is to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad, el aprendió el oficio de la siembra hace 20 años, ya que ayudaba a su padre a realizar esta labor, su horario de trabajo es de 4:00am a 11:00am, él alquila terrenos para poder cultivar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprarse abono y fertilizantes para la milpa, con esta inversión tendrá una mejor cosecha, esperando que el clima le ayude para que todo el proceso sea exitoso.
Su objetivo es realizar una buena inversión con el préstamo, que al final del periodo su cultivo sea provechoso y le permita dar a su familia una seguridad alimenticia y con la comercialización de la cosecha también generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio is a farmer and he lives with his wife.  They have two children, 11 and 4 years old.  He learned to sow seed 20 years ago while helping his father do it.  His work hours are from 4:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.  He rents land to farm.
He is currently applying for a loan to purchase manure and fertilizers for corn.  His crop will be better due to this investment as long as the weather is favorable so that the whole process is successful.
His goal is to make a good investment with the loan.  He hopes his crops are profitable and they allow him to provide nourishment for his family and also generate income.

loans.use: purchase manure and fertililzaers for corn.

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.ru:
Eldaniz ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda ,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim mladshim bratom. Elldaniz 24 qoda. 
Uje 3 qoda kak Eldaniz zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca.
texts.en:
Eldaniz is single and has no children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his younger brother.  Elldaniz is 24 years old.  
 
For the last three years, Eldaniz has been working as a herdsman and cattle breeder.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle to expand his herd.  He started this business with his father.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store, like spices, milk, groceries, etc.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 7 years. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara diferentes platos de comida como sopas y segundos, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, carne, pollo y verduras y también para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Santo Domingo” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, single, and has three children. Maria Elena divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business. She prepares different foods, such as soups and entrees. Maria Elena works from 7am to 9pm. Through her business, she is able to help her children move forward. She wants to expand her restaurant, so she is requesting a loan to buy rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, sodas, and beer in bulk.

Maria Elena is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, sodas, and beer in bulk.

loans.name: Chenalyn

texts.en:
Chenalyn is 26 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chenalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Chenalyn has been raising pigs for one year and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar is a married woman living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two school-aged children. She operates a motor transport business to make a living. It has been running for about three years already. She has habal-habal, as the folks call it, [a motorcycle] that carries 2-4 passengers and is advantageous for traveling in remote or rural areas. She earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from this job. In 2007, Pilar joined GDMPC to have a way in to financial services. She borrowed several times from the coop and successfully repaid in full. This year, 2011, she applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP to repair an engine and push through with her daily work routine. After this loan, she anticipates requesting another one for further business enhancement and to materialize her plans for expansion.

loans.use: to repair an engine.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años. El marido trabaja en una gasolinera.
 
Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender comidas rápidas en una carreta que pone todas las tardes cerca de la universidad de Montecristi, allí vende hamburguesas, hot dog, sodas y jugos de frutas. Nos cuenta que este negocio le ha dado mucho y es así como vio la oportunidad de poner otro negocio muy cerca de donde ubica su carreta, ya que al frente de su negocio había un local desocupado y ella lo rento  hace 4 meses y puso allí un negocio de frutas y legumbres,  pasa todo el día atendiendo sus dos negocios y tiene a una señora que le ayuda a la cual le paga un sueldo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres, pan, carne, salchichas, sodas, etc. Lleva 4 ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The December 24th Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts have received national and international recognition. The famous Panama hats are made in this place.

This is where Sra. Gloria lives. She is 30 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a three-year-old son. Her husband works at a gas station.

Gloria is very enterprising woman. For the past four years, she has been selling fast food every afternoon from a cart near the University of Montecristi. She sells hamburgers, hot dogs, sodas, and fruit juices. Gloria says that this business has given her much and saw the opportunity to establish another business near where her cart is located. In front of her business, there is a shop that has been vacant for four months. She used the space to set up a fruit and vegetable business and now she spends all day managing both businesses. Gloria has a woman who she pays a salary in order to help her. She works every day from 6am to 10pm and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy fruits, legumes, bread, meat, sausages, sodas, and other items. She has participated in four loan cycles with the Communal Bank and enjoys the assistance that she has received. Her dream is to continue growing her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fruits, legumes, bread, meat, sausages, sodas, and other items.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 21 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Cheryl has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years.
