Cheryl is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Cheryl has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cheryl hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 53 años D. edad, vive con su compañero D. vida y dos D. sus cuatro hijos.

Ella tiene 26 años D. vender en el mercado toda clase D. mercadería: ropa, verduras, D. todo a lo que ella pueda obtener una ganancia. La señora Rosa compra la mercadera al por mayor a las 5:30 D. la mañana en el mercado y luego ella lo sale a vender D. forma ambulante en canastos al mercado todo el día al menudeo.

La señora solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar un puesto en el mercado, para ya no verse en la necesidad D. andar ambulante y que sus clientes puedan tener un lugar donD. buscarla. Esto le ayudara en gran medida a obtener mejores ganancias, lo cual le servirá para dar una mejor alimentación y nivel D. vida a su familia, además ella esta apoyando a su hija que estudia enfermería y su sueño es que ella termine su estudio y poder ampliar su negocio y tener mas mercaderia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and lives with her life partner and two of her four children.  

She has been selling all types of merchandise at the market for 26 years. She sells clothing, vegetables, and anything else that she can sell for profit. Rosa buys her merchandise at 5:30 in the morning at the market at wholesale prices and she later walks through the markets with baskets selling it at retail.

She is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy a stall in the market. Then she will no longer have to walk about with her merchandise and her customers will know where to find her. This will help her a great deal in that she will earn higher income, which will help her give better food to her family and improve their standard of life. Furthermore, she is supporting her daughter who is studying to be a nurse and her dream is that she finishes her studies and also that she can expand her business and carry more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, vegetables and other items

loans.name: Ma Aurelia

texts.es: María Aurelia es separada y que se  que ha demostrado así misma ser una mujer fuerte y tenaz  que a pesar de la situación económica de cómo esta en este mundo ha sabido salir adelante con sus tres hijos. Desde hace cuatro años inicio un negocio de la venta de gorditas, comenta la señora María Aurelia que empezó con dos kilos de harina y poco a poco fue creciendo el negocio en el que ahora es llamado por los clientes “Gorditas de la Quince” que en realidad no es el nombre oficial, por que se encuentra en una calle de nuestra ciudad con ese nombre. La señora ha ido prosperando tanto que hasta construyo su vivienda y un lugar para usarlo de restaurante, pero en este momento el préstamo lo quiere para comenzar a construir la cocina cerca del negocio ya que la comida la sigue preparando en la cocina de su casa donde prepara los guisos y las gorditas de harina lo cual se dificulta por que tiene que caminar para la carrucha donde su hija es quien las prepara. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena, varilla, y pagar el albañil.
texts.en:
María Aurelia is separated and has shown herself to be a strong and tenacious woman who despite the world economic situation has known how to get ahead with her 3 children. She started her business selling gorditas (stuffed corn cakes) 4 years ago. Señora María Aurelia tells us that she started out with 2 kilos of flour and little by little grew the business into what is now called by customers "Gorditas de la Quince" ("The Fat Ones of Number 15")which in reality is not its offical name, as the business is located on a street of that name. 

She has prospered so much that she has even been able to build her own house and a place to use as a restaurant. However, currently she wants the loan to start building the kitchen close to the restaurant as she is till making the food, stews and the gorditas, in her own kitchen at home which hampers her as she has to walk to the cart where her daughter prepares the food. To realize her project, she needs to buy cement, sand, rods and pay the builder.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build an industrial kitchen.

loans.name: Murere Ole

texts.en:
Murere paid his previous loan well and in good time. He had a very good harvest since he used his loan so well by preparing his land for planting.

This is his third loan, which he plans to use to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also to buy animals for fattening. He intends to use the return from the loan to put back into farming and also to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and to buy animals for fattening.

loans.name: Enrique Avenamar

texts.es:
El señor Enrique esta agradecido por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos, los cuales fueron para invertir en su negocio. 
Don Enrique esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en un nuevo productos que son dulces de tamarindo, ya que tendrá mas ventas y ganancias porque es un producto que se podrá vendar todo el año. 
Entre el señor Enrique y su papa quienes son los que atiende el negocio han decidido que con este producto de ventas de tamarindo su negocio tendrá más ganancias y así podrán ayudar a otras personas en darles trabajo.
texts.en:
Enrique is grateful for the help from the previous loans enabling him to invest in his business.

Enrique is requesting a loan to purchase new products such as tamarind (a tropical fruit) sweets because they will offer him more sales and earnings since they can be sold all year.  He and his father who handle the business have decided that with the sales of new products such as tamarind, they will earn more and be able to give work to others.

loans.use: to buy supplies to produce a new product

loans.name: Melarda

texts.en:
Melarda is 37 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a seaweed farmer, a sari-sari store owner and also makes rice cakes and other delicacies to sell in her community. She works hard to support her family.

Melarda has applied for a 3,000 PHP loan to buy more items to sell in her shop such as sausages and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sausages and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia sigue trabajando en la discoteca.  

La socia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el gasto familiar. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer mejoramiento de la casa. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The client continues participating in the Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank, of the mircrofinance unit of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She continues working in the discotheque.

The previous loan went very well for this client and she managed to benefit.  For this reason she wants another loan since it helps her a lot with family expenses.

The client needs the loan to make improvements to her house.

She is grateful for the opportunity this loan offers and so she is committed to making her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhang is 32 and is married with three children, all of whom are under her care and attending school. She lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Mrs. Chhang is a farmer and rice farming is her sole source of income. 

Mrs. Chhang is requesting a loan from Kiva funders to buy stocks of rice at a low price during the harvesting season. She hopes to resell her rice at a profit when there is increased market demand. Mrs. Chhang plans to save money to provide for her children’s education after they finish high school. She is very happy and grateful for help.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, aged 59, is a single mother of three children. She owns rental houses that have been giving her a monthly income of Kes.5,500 for three years.

This is her second loan with KADET and she has successfully repaid the previous loan. She will use the funds to renovate the houses and paint them. Elizabeth hopes to build more houses in future.

loans.use: To renovate houses and buy paint

loans.name: Akuewegnigbeto Group

texts.fr: AKUEWEGNIGBETO est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Djidjoho(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Djidjoho est mariée à un certain Clément. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Djidjoho vit ensemble avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Djidjoho a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Djidjoho vend depuis huit ans des poissons frais dans un marché du Bénin. Djidjoho s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d'élargir son activité, Djidjoho sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe AKUEWEGNIGBETO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: AKUEWEGNIGBETO is a group of five people, who all live in the same region of Bénin. The group representative, Djidjoho (who has her hand raised in the photo) is 34 years old. Djidjoho is married to a man named Clément. They have three children, all in school - two of whom are still living at home. Djidjoho lives together with her husband and those two children. The couple cover the various living expenses of the household together. Djidjoho stopped school after primary education. In order to cover her various outgoings, Djidjoho has sold fresh fish in a Bénin market for the last eight years. She buys her supplies at a market in Bénin. With a view to satisfying her customers, and in order to grow her business, Djidjoho is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDé, together with the other members of the AKUEWEGNIGBETO group. This loan will be used to better meet their customer's needs, and to help them increase their profits. The first three loans are all repaid.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Alice est une femme mariée qui vit avec deux enfants à charge à Adidogomé. Alice est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Alice sollicite ce crédit pour commander des mètres de tissus pour femmes en vue mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.

loans.use: Acheter 50 mètres de tissus pour femmes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Freshiah would like to invest in the shares market.

loans.name: Concepción Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs. Concepcion, or Conchis as her neighbors call her is a very hard working and active person. She is always busy with her family. She tries to help her husband cover family expenses because he recieves a very small salary as an assistant bricklayer. Conchis has four children that are currently studying and she would like them to be able to complete their studies. For this reason, she decided to start selling frituras outside of her house. This business has been growing little by little over the years.

Conchis needs a $200 loan in order to obtain a greater quantity and variety of goods in order to increase sales and help her family more. Today is the moment this family in needs it. They you thank for it sincerely.

La señora Concepción, o Conchis como le dicen los vecinos, ha sido una persona muy activa y trabajadora, siempre se ha preocupado por su familia y trata de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares como le sea posible, porque el salario que recibe su esposo como ayudante de albañil es muy poco, ella tiene cuatro hijos que continúan estudiando, y Conchis quiere que puedan llegar a consumarlos, por lo que ella decidió poner un puesto de venta de frituras afuera de su casa, que poco a poco ha ido mejorando desde hace un año que inició.

Conchis necesita de un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía para vender en su puesto, ampliar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes para incrementar sus ventas y obtener un mayor beneficio para ayudar a su familia. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo dudes más y decídete a ayudar a esta familia. Ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use:
Purchase merchandise
compra de mercancía

loans.name: Davlatbibi

texts.en:
For more than 8 years, S. Davlatbibi has been engaged in trade. During this time she reached a good level in her activity and she takes a firm place amongst entrepreneurs of a similar level. In spite of the fact that she does not have higher education – her experience gained through her trade, allows her to know all answers to all changes in the market.

Business also allows her to provide for her family, which consists of 4 persons – her husband and three children. Her junior daughter is left in the home – she studies in a specialized school to clothing. After study her mother intends to provide her with a job in order to be financial independent from her new family and earn her way. Her main goal is to create conditions to obtain higher education for daughter.

loans.use: Increase of goods assortment

loans.name: Kim-Earn

texts.en: Kim-earn was married in 1992 and has 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter. She has been in the business of sewing clothes since 1994. She did not finish primary school. Her husband is a police officer in Resey Chroy commune. He sometimes assists his wife in bringing the clothes to the markets or to clients. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA twice and the current loan amount is for $200. She will use this loan to repair the house. With the business of sewing clothes they can send all of their children to school. There will be no problem for her to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Ilda Clara Salvador

texts.pt:
Ilda is a widow. She lives with her 3 children, in a neighborhood near the city of Xaixai. She joined the Women's fund for development in 2006, she started her business of raising and selling chickens. Ilda is now in the 3rd cycle of the program. She is requesting this loan to buy more chicken feed and vaccines.

If the business continues to grow she plans on buying more chicken and more chicken coops. Her children are all in school, the 2 oldest are in pre-university preparations school. Ilda's in-laws live in another city and cannot help her supporting the family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Ilda e viuva. Vive com os seus tres filhos num bairro periferico da cidade de Xai-Xai e e trabalhadora. Ela entrou para o programa de credito do FDM em 2006, altura em que iniciou o negocio de criacao e venda de frangos. Ela agora esta no terceiro ciclo. Com o valor que pretende tomar ela quer comprar racao e vacinas para os pintos que acaba de meter na capoeira.

Se o negocio continuar a correr-lhe bem como tem sido ate entao , ela pretende aumentar as suas capoeiras para poder meter uma maior quantidade de pintos relativamente aos que tem metido ate entao. Isto porque a demanda esta a crescer. Os seus filhos todos estao a estudar estando os dois mais velhos no ensino Pre-universitario. Os sogros de Ilda vivem numa outra Provincia e nao tem condicoes de apoia-lo no sustento dos filhos.

loans.use: Buy chicken feed and vaccines

loans.name: Hawima

texts.en:
Hawima has a beauty salon where she also sells cosmetics and clothes. Although her clients have little money, it is still very important to look and feel good. This is a small but very important luxury to the people of her village in Kayunga. She tries to offer her products at very reasonable prices. She has owned her business for 5 years and has a very established client base. She has also been a member of her lending group for the past five years, and has had no problem repaying any of her loans. With her loan, she plans to expand her business by increasing her inventory of clothes and cosmetics, lotions, shampoos, etc.

Hawima is 43, married, with 6 children. From the sales of her goods she has been able to pay school fees and meet her family’s basic needs. One day she hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a home for her family.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding more clothing, cosmetics, lotions, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs Chin P., age 38, works with her husband as a laborer, making together on average about $5 per day. They have three children, two who are laborers and one who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase yams from the growers to resell for a profit to help improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase yams from the growers to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Emboy

texts.en: Emboy, 25, is a mother of 2 children. Her husband, M., sells steel and earns USD3 a day. To help her husband provide income for the family, she sells fruits and beverages at her food stall and earns USD3 a day. She requests a loan of USD75 to expand her business and, as a member of MBK, agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Yemisi O., 40-years-old, is a mother of two children and hails from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells soft drinks wholesale and has been in business since 1990. Her loan request of $450 will be used to purchase additional inventory.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea lives in San Cristobal where she owns and operates a small store.  She sells a collection of chic products such as perfumes, beauty products, pants and shoes.  Andrea has received from FSMA a loan with which she made the purchase of a lot of products to add to her stock.  As an experienced entrepreneur, Andrea managed to sell off the products and increase significantly her income. She repaid the loan successfully. Currently, Andrea wants to replenish her store because many products are running out there. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of those products. That will allow her satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her revenue. Andrea hopes that her business’s continuous success will help her buy her own house.

loans.use: To restock a small business of selling beauty products and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase stock and utensils in her food cooking business.

loans.name: Holmahmad

texts.ru:
Holmahmad B. lives in the Khuroson region. He lives in one of the isolated villages of this region. He lives with his family and owns a small store where he sells food and other products. Holmahmad would like to increase his product assortment by getting a loan and purchasing new products. He will pay back the loan over a 5 month period. By increasing his inventory Holmahmad will be able to help local residents to purchase products without leaving their region.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобокалонов Холмахмад житель Хуросонского района. Проживает в одном из отдаленных кишлаков данного района. Живет со своей семьей. Занимается торговлей. Имеет свой минимагазин, где торгует продуктами питания и другими промышленными товарами. Хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, путем получения кредита и ввоза нового товара. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 5 месяцев.Увеличив тварооборот , он сможет помочь населению покупать товар не выезжая за приделы района.

loans.use: Increase Product Assortment

loans.name: Laura Lila

texts.es:
Aura Lila O. is a woman that for 10 long years has been a teacher in a small school in the municipality of Somotillo, where she lives. She has always worried about providing the best conditions for her small son, who is the reason for her great efforts in her work. Nowadays she has the need to invest money in the reconstruction of her house. The house has suffered a lot of damage from natural weather events and as a result she has started the reconstruction.

Currently she is requesting a loan at Ceprodel in order to continue with the aforementioned work because shortly winter will begin and she needs to have everything finished so that she or her son not become ill from the weather conditions. With the loan she will buy the construction materials for her house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Aura Lila O. es una dama que desde hace 10 largos años se ha dedicado al negocio de la docencia en un pequeño colegio del municipio de Somotillo donde reside. Siempre se ha preocupado por brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su pequeño hijo el cual es la razón de sus grandes esfuerzos en su trabajo. Hoy en día es de necesidad destacar que tiene la necesidad de invertir para la reconstrucción de su vivienda por lo que ha sufrido muchos daños por motivos de los fenómenos naturales y a raíz de esto ella ha iniciado en la reconstrucción de su casa.

Actualmente ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para continuar con dicha obra por el hecho de que en pocos momentos inicia el invierno y para este tiempo ella debe de estar preparada para evitar que tanto ella o sus hijos adopten una enfermedad. Con el crédito ella comprará los materiales de construcción para su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in a large variety of fruits and vegetables to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie G., age 49, is a widow and the mother of 4 adult and married children. She's been a member of the Alwar village bank for 7 years. Her business consists in buying and reselling palm oil and lemons. She purchases her goods in Guinea and sells them in Dakar. To improve her living conditions, she wants to strengthen her business, after the latter experienced some decline due to her husband's illness, followed by her becoming a window. Marie is seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie G., 49 ans est veuve et mère de 04enfants adultes et mariés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Alwar depuis7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme et du citron. Elle s’approvisionne en Guinée et vend à Dakar. Elle veut renforcer son commerce qui a connu une baisse avec la maladie de son mari suivi du veuvage pour améliorer ses conditions de vie. Marie sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase and resell palm oil and lemons

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
Ingrid tiene 38 años, actualmente vive  con su esposo y dos hijos.
Desde hace 8 años trabaja en su propio tienda, la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio fue a raíz de no querer trabajar fuera de casa, para atender a sus pequeños hijos que necesitan del calor de una madre, por tal motivo instaló la bodega en su mismo domicilio, aprovechando que se encuentra en una zona céntrica de su localidad, además le permite estar al tanto de los quehaceres de su hogar, todo el día es la atención de su bodega, en la cual vende todo tipo de mercadería, desde gaseosas, golosinas hasta abarrotes, Ingrid disfruta de realizar esta actividad cada día y no considera dificultades que pueda mencionar.
El motivo de su esfuerzo es por ver crecer a sus hijos con una estabilidad económica para educarlos.
Ingrid solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería y de esa manera aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two sons. For 8 years she has worked in her own store, the necessity of launching her own business began when she didn’t want to work outside the home so she could care for her small children who needed their mother. So she opened a store in her own home, taking advantage that she is located centrally in her area. In addition this enabled her to get the household chores done and attend to her store all day, where she sells all kinds of merchandise, from soda pop, candy to groceries. Ingrid enjoys working every day and doesn’t consider herself to have any particular difficulties that she can mention. The motive behind her efforts is to see her children grow in a economically stable home and provide them an education. Ingrid asks for this loan to invest in purchasing merchandise and in this way increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of merchandise in her store

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: S. Saodat is 27 years old and lives in the Spitamen region. She is married and has 3 children. She trades in the local bazaar and works with wholesale suppliers. She has repeat customers and a good assortment of items. She has been working in this business for 5 years. Mrs. S. Saodat first applied to MicroInvest in 2008. She is a reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. She applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 2800 STJ (USD $825) for 4 months to import new goods. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To import new goods

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid A. is a 25-year-old man who sells different type of goods, such as laundry powders, soaps, shampoos, and perfumes, in his shop. He started his business in 1999 when his father invited him to join his family business. Now, Vahid is owner of this shop and is the main financial source for his parents, his wife, and their child. 

Vahid is a repeat client of AqroInvest who has successfully completed his first loan. Vahid is now applying for $1200 to increase his stock and generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his inventory

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
Maria siempre le ha gustado tejer y decidió sacarle provecho a esta habilidad, así que en temporada de invierno principalmente se dedica a vender gorros tejidos, bufandas, guantes, etc. Inició el negocio ya que  es una persona mayor,  y no la contratan en alguna empresa tan fácilmente  por eso decidió dedicarse a las ventas tener un ingreso extra para completar con el gasto familiar.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material para apoyar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria has always enjoyed knitting and decided to take advantage of her ability. She sells knitted hats, scarves, gloves, etc., primarily during the winter season. She began her business because she is an older woman and cannot easily find work with a company. For this reason, she decided to sell her items and earn an extra income to aid with the family expenses.

She needs a loan of MXN $4,000, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy materials to support her business.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for work

loans.name: Peniel Group

texts.es: El grupo "Peniel " esta conformado por 15 miembros los cuales están precedidos por la señora Nelva Mery. En su Mayoría las socias se dedican al comercio D. diferentes productos como a la venta D. ropa, artesanías, comida, material escolar, mantas tejidas a mano y otros dependiendo D. la época del año. Las Socias saben que existe la competencia desleal ene el mercado pero ellas tienen experiencia en sus rubros y saben como enfrentarla, son personas muy honradas, responsables y cumplidas como lo han demostrado en anteriores financiamiento. El crédito esta destinado al mejoramiento D. la mercadería a la venta así como para el aumento D. sus insumos y materiales. Las socias tienen experiencia en financiamientos grupales por lo que saben el sistema D. trabajo y la responsabilidad que se requiere para obtener cumplir con los pagos y no fallar ni a la institución ni a los miembros D. su grupo.
texts.en:
The "Peniel" group is composed by 15 members managed by Nelva Mery L. P.. Most of their members are business men and women who sell clothes, handicrafts, food, school supplies, hand-maD. mats and others depending on the time of the year. Members are alert for dishonest competitors but they have experience in their fields and know how to face the hard times. They are very hard working, honest and responsible people as they have proven to be in their previous financing projects. The loan will be used to purchase more products for sale, as well as supplies and material. Members have group financing experience so they are familiar with the system and they are aware of the responsibility required to make timely payments not to let down the institution or the other members of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena L., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operative Capital

loans.name: Abd Allah

texts.en:
Abd Allah is a 33-year-old man who lives in Bourj el Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abd Allah has been working with handicrafts for twelve years. He makes the frames for photographs and paintings.

Abd Allah has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase frames for his work. Abd Allah has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans have influenced his life in a good way; thanks to the loans, he has been able to improve his work and his family situation. Abd Allah is special in his work because he is talented and he does very nice work. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networks. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided on doing this business because he studied graphic design.

loans.use: Abd Allah will use the loan to purchase frames for his work.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Justa es separada, tiene 50 años,  tres hijos 32, 30 y 27 años todos trabajan. 
Justa trabajo desde los diez años, no vivió con sus padres por que se separaron,  hace tres años  trabajaba con una sobrina en comas, atendiendo una librería, después de un tiempo, ella abrió su propia librería-bazar en el mercado modelo, se llama librería- bazar “ALEXA” su hija la ayuda con la administración del negocio.
Justa necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de útiles escolares, cuadernos, colores, pápelo grafos.   
El sueño de Justa es que su negocio de librería crezca y abrir en su casa  una librería.
texts.en:
Justa is a member of the San Judas Tadeo community bank. Justa is separated. She is 50 years old and has three children aged 32, 30 and 27 who are all working. Justa has been working since she was 10 years old. She did not live with her parents because they separated. Three years ago she was working with a niece in Coma: she ran a bookstore. In time she opened her own bookstore-bazaar in the Modelo market. Her business is called "Librería-Bazar ALEXA". Her daughter helps her manage the store. Justa needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy school supplies, notebooks, crayons, easel pads. Justa's dream is to grow her business and open a bookstore in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies, crayons, notebooks, easel pads for resale

loans.name: Paulo Mauricio

texts.es: Paulo Mauricio S. Campo tiene 42 años. la actividad económica de don Paulo es la venta de electrodomésticos como televisores, radios, grabadoras y  refrigeradoras y dice que esta es su única fuente de trabajo y ayuda. Hace más de diez años que se dedica a este negocio la venta de estos equipos la realiza de manera ambulante ya que los prestamos son la ayuda que el necesita para que su negocio pueda salir adelante. Los propósitos de Don Paulo son de poseer un lugar propio donde pueda ofertar sus electrodomésticos. Sus desafíos son de mantener su negocio ya que la situación en el país es muy difícil. La cantidad necesaria es de C$ 24.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Paulo Mauricio S. Campo is 42 years old and works selling household appliances like televisions, radios, tape recorders and refrigerators. This is his only source of income and support. He has worked in this job for the past 10 years and he sells the appliances as a street vendor. The loan is the help he needs for his business to get ahead. Paulo would like to own his own space to sell his appliances from. His challenge is to maintain his business even though the situation in his country is very difficult. The amount he needs is C$ 24.000 córdobas to be repaid in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 52 años, convive con su pareja José, quien es mecánico y sus 2 hijos; Jhony de 28 y Khaty de 22, en su casa propia, ya que su hija mayor, Jessica de 27 conformó su propia familia. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la atención de su bodega, la cual puso en su propia casa, abre a las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche, tiempo en el cual cosecha muy buenos ingresos, ya que siempre trata de abastecer su tienda con las necesidades de su clientela. En muchas ocasiones cuando sale a comprar mercadería o por alguna urgencia, su hija Jessica la ayuda con la atención, ya que no puede cerrar su bodega porque es muy concurrida, lo que le produce buenos ingresos económicos, es por eso que Rosa está pensando en ampliar, y para esta época escolar vender materiales de librería en una parte de su tienda y así hacer que en el futuro sea una gran tienda muy bien surtida. Rosa es la presidenta de su banco comunal llamado “Cristo Morado”, y siempre ha organizado muy bien a su grupo, siendo más que un grupo, una gran familia. Con el dinero que solicita comprará arroz, azúcar y diez cajas de bebidas, además de comprar útiles escolares para este periodo de inicio escolar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 22 years old. She lives in her own home with her partner, José, a mechanic. Their 2 children, Jhony who is 28, and Khaty who is 22 live with them; their grown daughter Jessica, 27, has started her own family. For the last 12 years Rosa has taken care of her grocery store which she set up in her own home. The store is open from 6 in the morning until 8 or 9 at night. She gets a very good income from the store. She always tries to stock her store with what her customers need. Many times when she leaves to buy merchandise or for another urgent matter, her daughter, Jessica, helps her with the store. She cannot close the store because it is very busy, and that’s why she has a good income. Because of the good business, Rosa would like to expand her store by selling bookstore type of merchandise during this school season. In the future she will have a great, well stocked store. Rosa is the president of her community bank, Cristo Morado. She has always well organized her group which is more like a big family than a group. With the loan she will buy rice, sugar, 10 boxes of drinks, in addition to buying school supplies for the start of school this season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Jamyansuren

texts.en: Jamyansuren D. lives with his wife and infant daughter in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Jamyansuren got married in 2007 and now lives with his family on the land owned by his father-in-law. Since his marriage, he has been running a small shop that sells Buddhist antiques and souvenirs. His shop is located inside the popular Buddhist monastery in the town. Since 2007, his business capital has increased from 600,000 MNT to 1,000,000 MNT. His wife helps him in his business by working as a saleswoman. In the future, he hopes to have his own piece of land and live there with his family. He requests a loan to purchase more antiques and souvenirs for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase more antiques and souvenirs for his shop.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena O. is a rice farmer. She is 52 years old, married and has no children. Her business is doing well. She and her husband manage a small hectare of land which they use to earn a bigger income for their needs. Magdalena is also helping her siblings who have their own family. She also has a sari-sari store. She is doing multiple businesses to supplement their income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The loan will really help the couple achieve maximum yield from their farm. The loan will help increase their income.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. CEVI gives not just credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz O. is from the town of Cambong, Tuguegarao. She is 48 years old. Beatriz is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Beatriz raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.

Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She also plans to renovate the pens of her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer micro-finance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Akuvi Dzidzo

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme exerçait comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits de première nécessité mais cette activité ne lui réussissait pas, elle s’est alors lancée dans le commerce de pagnes. cette nouvelle activité marche bien pour elle,sa clientèle est grandissante, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes de qualité «HI Target » 10 pagnes « phoénix » et 5 pagnes « WAX »
texts.en:
This young woman had been selling staple goods but that business was not very successful, so she began to sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly printed African cloth). This second business is going well; her clientele is growing and she wants to refurbish her stock, so she has come to WAGES to request her first loan to buy 20 "pagnes" (HI Target brand), 10 "pagnes" (Phoenix brand) and 5 "pagnes" (Wax brand).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for resale

loans.name: Mariela De Concepción

texts.es:
Mariela O. es una dama que a sus 34 años de edad se dedica arduamente a laborar en el departamento de León por medio de la venta de productos plásticos como vasos, platos, cucharas, tenedores, bolsas, entre otros.

Es importante destacar que también ella vende especies como lo son salsas de tomate y mostaza. El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos plásticos y las especies a sus proveedores y así ofertarlas en su localidad para mejorar sus condiciones y salir adelante en el negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Mariela O. is a 34-year-old woman who works very hard in the department of León selling plastic items like cups, plates, spoons, forks, bags, etc. It's important to point out that she sells spices like those used for tomato sauces and mustard. The reason she has turned to Ceprodel is to be benefitted with a credit to purchase plastic products and spices from her providers so she can offer these items in her area to improve her living conditions and to get ahead with her business that needs an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plastic plates and cups as well as spices.

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Perseverantes” (Persevering Women) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Tania has a business selling Avon and Esika beauty products from her home. Tania plans to use this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles to augment her stock of products.

Prior to her first loan from Manuela Ramos about two-and-a-half years ago, Tania had never worked. Thanks to her loans and the income generated from her business, Tania has been able to fix up her home with new wood panels for the interior. Eventually, she would like to purchase a glass show cabinet for her products.

Tania lives with her partner and their three children, a 15-year-old son and two daughters, aged 13 and 4. Tania’s partner has a job at the airport selling airline tickets. In this short video clip, Tania talks about her goal of moving forward with her business in order to ensure that her children can go to university.

loans.use: To buy additional stock.

loans.name: Santiago Apostol Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “SANTIAGO APOSTOL”, están situados en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia y departamento del Cusco. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades tanto del hogar como particulares; con la venta de artesanía, tres socias tienen sus stand en el centro comercial confraternidad, ellas traen mercadería de Bolivia (ropas, juguetes, artefactos, entre otros), otros socios venden libros en el mismo centro comercial, otros tiene su stand de venta de desayunos y 2 restaurantes de dos socios, y 2 socios más venden útiles escolares, una de nuestras   socias está ausente por motivos de salud, su nombre es la Sra. Modesta E., estos socios son gente muy trabajadora y desean seguir adelante y para esto requieren un préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Nuestros socios valoran y agradecen el apoyo brindado y el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank, “SANTIAGO APOSTOL”, are located in the district of Santiago in the province and department of Cusco.

Our members alternate their different activities, from housework to specific tasks. With the sale of handicrafts, three members have their stand in the collective shopping center. The women bring merchandise from Bolivia (clothing, games, and gadgets, among other things). At the same shopping center, other members sell books, others have a kiosk for breakfast food, two members run two restaurants, and two more members sell school supplies. One of our members, Sra. Modesta E., is absent from the group for health reasons. These members are very hardworking people and want to keep moving ahead, and for that they require a loan to be able to reinvest in their different businesses.

Our members both value and thank you for your support by providing a loan through this organization. They are committed to repaying this loan within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sahadatou

texts.fr: Sahadatou est née en 1961 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Sahadatou est mariée à Sadikou Salam . Sahadatou et Sadikou Salam ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Sahadatou qui assure les dépenses de la famille. C’est des draps de lit, les taies d’oreillers, les foulards et chapeaux de femme et des rideaux que Sahadatou vend à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Sahadatou est dans cette activité depuis dix ans. Et c’est au Nigeria, État frontalier au Bénin que  Sahadatou achète ses articles. Sahadatou veut renforcer son fonds de roulement ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sahadatou was born in 1961 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Sahadatou is married to Sadikou Salam. Sahadatou and Sadikou have four children all of whom go to school. The family lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Sahadatou’s husband looks after the family’s finances. Sahadatou sells bed linen, pillowcases, scarves, women’s hats and curtains in Dantokpa, the large international market in Benin. Sahadatou has been selling these items for ten years. Sahadatou buys her stock in Nigeria, Benin’s border state. Sahadatou wants to increase her working capital which is why she is asking for her first loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed linen, pillowcases, scarves, women's hats and curtains

loans.name: Abdukhalil

texts.en:
M. Abdukhalil is married and has three children who he is very proud of since they are fighting to get ahead. With the faith that his children would go to college to get ahead he started a business of processing and selling the dried apricot to be able to make enough money to pay for their schooling. This is why he started this business two years ago. He is experienced in this kind of business that allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now Abdukhalil requests $ 600 USD for purchasing dried apricot further to process it and to sell. With your help, Abdukhalil will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and are honorable people. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried apricot for expanding his business

loans.name: Jacquelo

texts.en:
Jacquelo S. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old. Jacquelo is married and has 1 infant child. Jacquelo owns & operates a specialized seafood products retail store. Jacquelo has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jacquelo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Jacquelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jacquelo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP. She will purchase new items for her shop in order to expand the product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jacquelo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase new items and expand the seafood product offering.

loans.name: Marget

texts.en: Marget is 50 years old and married with 6 children.  She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells books and stationary. Marget hopes for the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more books and stationary to sell. she says thanks to all kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more books and stationary to sell

loans.name: Jessica Xiomara

texts.es: Jessica Xiomara C. P. reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Jessica tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera vive con sus abuelos maternos. Jessica es una joven ejemplar, a pesar de ser tan joven lleva consigo grandes responsabilidades como el cuido de sus abuelitos hasta la administración del hogar. Jessica curso hasta bachillerato, luego monto su negocio hace un año, una sala de belleza y venta de productos cosméticos, por la cual hoy solicita este crédito con el fin de surtir su inventario de productos de belleza .
texts.en:
Jessica Xiomara C. P. lives in the department of La Libertad. She is 22 years old, single, and lives with her maternal grandparents. Jessica is an exemplary young woman. Despite being so young, she already assumes great responsibilities ranging from looking after her grandparents to managing the household. Jessica completed high school and then started this business a year ago. She manages a beauty salon and sells cosmetics.

Today she is requesting a loan to restock her inventory of beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Souzane

texts.fr: Cette femme a ouvert une boutique de vente de mèches et divers articles comme les biscuits et les bonbons. Elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 1999 dans le quartier de Gbégnédji à Lomé. En ce moment elle a besoin d’acheter 25 mèches Curly, 15 mèches Nina et 10 mèches Ondulées. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite urgemment un crédit de WAGES. Le prêt lui permettra également d'acheter des articles manquants dans sa boutique comme des bonbons et des biscuits.
texts.en:
This woman opened a shop selling hair extensions and various goods, such as cookies and candy.  She is married and the mother of three children.  This business enables her to do her financial part in managing the home.  She started this business in 1999 in the Gbégnédji district in Lomé.  At this time, she needs to buy 25 Curly hair extensions, 15 Nina hair extensions, and 10 Ondulées hair extensions.  For this reason, she has an urgent request for a WAGES loan.  The loan will also allow her to buy items lacking in her shop, such as candy and cookies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and various goods to sell

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es: Santos Alexander H. P. de 35 años de edad, originario del departamento de Morazán, vive con su familia que la compone, su esposa y sus tres hijos, Joanna de 9 años, Wilber de 4 años y Jennifer de 12 meses. El departamento de Morazán se caracteriza mucho por su clima caliente y por la variedad de sitios turísticos que se pueden encontrar, Santos aprovecha al máximo de su entorno ya que se dedica a la venta de artesanías la cuales el fabrica desde su casa, las artesanías de Santos las vende de manera ambulante y son compradas por muchos turistas extranjeros o nacionales, la demanda en las artesanías de Santos ha ido incrementando, es por esa razón que ahora el solicita de un crédito con el cual, pueda adquirir mayor cantidad de insumos y así aumentar la producción de sus artículos.
texts.en:
Santos Alexander H. P. is 35 years old and a native of the department of Morazán. His family consists of his wife and three children: Joanna (age 9), Wilber (age 4), and Jennifer (age 12 months). Morazán is known for its warm climate and numerous tourists sites. Santos takes advantage of these conditions by selling handicrafts he produces at home. He sells his goods as a street merchant to tourists, both foreign and domestic. Demand for his work is increasing, so he is requesting a loan in order to acquire supplies in bulk and increase production of these items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies needed for making handicrafts

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria I. is from Binuangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products such as canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, rice, soft drinks, etc. She has been engaged in this kind of business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP and this will be her 5th loan taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Samet

texts.en: Mrs. Samet S. is a villager in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Nuon Mos, is a construction worker who only makes a small income to support the family. Although they try to hard they still don't earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Samet S. decided to ask for a loan to buy eight piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business. Mrs. Samet S. is a mother of a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy eight piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda J. is from the village of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 41 years old. Imelda is separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a tailoring business providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
Meralyn C. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 35 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Meralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Meralyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Meralyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Edilberto Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Edilberto R. M. tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia en el disrtrito de Ocucaje junto a su esposa y un hijo de dos años y una hija en edad escolar. Cliente realiza la actividad de taxista en la ruta Ica - La Venta u Ocucaje desde hace 08 años apróximadamente para la empresa de transportes Virgen del Carmen en la ciudad de Ica, el vehículo que posee es propiedad de su hermano el cual es policía y vive en el centro de la ciudad, su esposa realiza labores de campo por temporadas actualmente no está laborando ya que está al cuidado de su pequeño hijo. No cuenta con endeudamiento en ninguna institución financiera. Actualmente está construyendo un módulo de vivienda para damnificados del terremoto por lo cual requiere de préstamo para solventar gastos de mano de obra y concluir con dicha construcción. Son personas muy trabajadoras las cuales brindan educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretenden tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con construcción de su casa. Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Edilberto R. M. is 36 years old and lives with his common-law wife in his home in the Ocucaje district, along with a son who is 2 years old and a daughter who is school-aged. He has worked as a taxi driver on routes from Ica to La Venta or Ocucaje for about 8 years for the transport company Virgen del Carmen in the city of Ica. The vehicle he has belongs to his brother, who is a policeman and lives in the center of the city. His wife does seasonal work in agriculture; she is currently not working since she must care for her small son. Edilberto is not indebted to any financial institution. Currently they are building a room on their house for people displaced by the earthquake. For this they need a loan to take care of the expenses for labor and to finish the construction of the room. They are hard-working people who provide for the education of their children with great effort, and aim to have a better quality of life. Their dream is to finish the construction on their home. They both are grateful for the assistance offered to help them fulfill their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for construction expenses

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Vat S., age 43, is married and resides with her children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has one child. She raises pigs at home, earning an income of US $5 per day. Her husband grows sugar cane for sale, earning the same amount of income. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. She has been doing this job since 2008. S. is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a machine to squeeze sugar cane and more pigs to raise. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a machine to squeeze sugar canes and more pigs to raise

loans.name: Carlos Adán

texts.es: El señor C. N. es dueño de una Jardinería en la que ofrece diferentes variedades de plantas así como árboles frutales, con este negocio el mantiene a su familia que consta de su esposa y 3 hijos, los cuales están en la escuela, en esta visitando las oficinas de  Ceprodel para comprar plantas de cocos, palmeras grandes, frutales injertos, cactus, araucarias, plátanos de jardín y juanitas, esto para poder tener mas variedad y ofrecerles a sus clientes y de esta forma poder cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. C. N. is the owner of a nursery that sells different kinds of plants, such as fruit trees. With this business he supports his family, which is made up of his wife and 3 children. His children are in school. He visited the offices of CEPRODEL for a loan to buy coconut trees, large palm trees, grafted fruit trees, cacti, monkey-puzzle trees, garden-type banana trees, and juanitas [type of plant]. He wants to have more variety to offer to his clients so that he will be able to cover his family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coconut trees, large palm trees, grafted fruit trees, cacti, monkey-puzzle trees, garden-type banana trees, and juanitas [type of plant]

loans.name: Grpo Las Mujeres Trunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de personas residen en Caserío Santa Rita Pachipá, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, y solicitaron  
un crédito en la Asociación ASDIR, ya que cada una emprendió una venta y dos de ellas venden lo que son 
cocos el cual lo comercializan en Quetzaltenango y las otras tienen venta de tortillas y pollos que lo comercializan en el municipio de San Antonio. A través de estas ventas se ha visto el mejoramiento económico
de estas familias, gracias al apoyo crediticio que la Asociación les ha brindado y al buen manejo del mismo
que estas personas le han dado al crédito ya que sus ingresos ha venido a cambiar la condición de vida de 
sus hogares.
texts.en:
This group of people live in en Caserío Santa Rita Pachipá, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. They are seeking a loan with ASDIR. Each of them has a sales business. Two sell coconuts in Quetzaltenango, and the others sell tortillas and chickens in the town of San Antonio. By means of their businesses, these women have improved the economic conditions of their families. This is thanks to the loans provided by ASDIR and their good management of these funds. Their increased earnings have changed the quality of life in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more coconuts and chickens to sell and enlarge tortilla shop in San Antonio

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a 30-year-old single lady who runs a hairdressing and beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has three employees. She has a good customer base due to her good customer-care skills.

Aileen saves her money with her group in Faulu Kenya called diamond which guarantees loans to its members. She hopes to grow her business and venture into many other businesses in the future.

Aileen has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of braids and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To add stock of braids and hair chemicals

loans.name: Prudencia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Prudencia del Carmen Martínez Velazques una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y esforzada. Está señora de 56 años en un inicio se dedicaba al comercio de frutas en el mercado luego comenzó a realizar frescos de cacao, melón, piña, licuados, ensalada de frutas, guayaba, naranja, limón, linaza etc. Los cuales se vendían con mucha facilidad. 

Ella con el préstamo compra mercadería para su negocio especialmente las frutas para realizar estos deliciosos y refrescantes frescos.
texts.en:
Prudencia del Carmen Martínez Velazquez is 56 years old and a strong, hardworking, and enterprising woman. She started selling fruit at the market, but later she began selling refreshments made of cacao, melon, pineapple, fruit juice, fruit cocktail, guava, oranges, lemon, flaxseed, and other ingredients. These drinks sell very easily.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her business, especially fruits that make her beverages delicious and refreshingly cool.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits for making beverages

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa , de 66 años, vive con su esposo Pastor que tiene la misma edad , y su hija  Lidia y su pequeña bebé. Juntos  viven en su casa que es  propia.Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de joyas, que primero su hija compra de catálogos y revistas a su precio de oferta y posteriormente Rosa los comercializa al precio original. La ventaja de vender de esta manera , es que le permite lograr buenos ingresos económicos por la calidad de las joyas . A pesar de las largas caminatas y cobranzas que debe realizar para captar clientes (que  usualmente son sus vecinas y familiares), gusta mucho de su trabajo pues es tranquilo y comodo  realizarlo en los horarios que tiene disponible , ya que  también debe cuidar a su nieto , pues su hija trabaja . En el  futuro quisiera aumentar su mercadería para así lograr mejores ventas ,pues estas joyas cambian por temporadas y cada vez  salen modelos más novedosos.Es el sexto préstamo de Rosa con  MFP y siempre ha sido muy responsable con los pagos de todas sus cuotas.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de  joyas para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 66 years old, lives with her husband Pastor (who is also 66), and their daughter Lidia and her little baby. Together they live in their own home. For several years she has been selling jewelry, which her daughter buys first from catalogs at sale prices, and Rosa then sells at the normal price. The advantage of this type of sales is that it allows her to earn good income because of the quality of her jewelry. Despite the amount of walking and the collections she must do to find clients (who are usually her family and neighbors), she enjoys her work very much, since it’s nice and comfortable to do it during the extra time she has available, because she also has to care for her grandchild since her daughter is working. In the future she would like to increase her merchandise to achieve better sales, since the jewelry changes by the season, and there are always newer models available. This is the sixth loan for Rosa from MPF, and she has always been very responsible with her payments. She is thinking of investing the money in the purchase of a larger quantity of jewelry to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry to increase her sales

loans.name: Kirera Twebeisho Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
M. Godfrey, a hardworking and reserved 31-year-old married father of three children, has been operating a butchery business in Kigoma Trading Centre in Bushenyi district for over eleven years. He buys cows and goats which he slaughters and prepares the meat ready for selling to his genuine customers who have supported him this long.

Godfrey’s business has grown to the extent that he has been able to educate all his three children. In a month, he reveals he makes close to 200,000 Ugandan shillings. He also sells matooke (plantain) as a source of side income and makes some additional income through his retail shop.

Godfrey’s drawback is having only a small amount of stock in his businesses. Therefore, he would like to use this loan to restock his retail shop and also buy more animals.

Godfrey’s future plans are to expand his business and improve his sales revenue.

loans.use: To restock his store and to buy more animals for his butchery business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 43 years old. He is married with eight children between the ages of 3 and 20. All the children except one are attending school.

He is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for 20 years and has three employees. His main product is milk which he sells to the local market. He is also a cash crop farmer and sells his tea to Kapset Tea Factory in the same area. He solely depends on the income from his farming activities to meet his family's needs.

His major challenges have been the lack of a proper market for his milk and a poor transport network.

Christopher recently completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES and has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. Through this loan, his income will increase and he will be able to meet the family's needs and be able to repay the loan.

In the future, he would like to improve his dairy farming by purchasing an extra piece of land and improving the quality of the dairy animals to high yielding cows.

He is grateful to Juhudi for their good work.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
This five person group loan, led by Mrs. Tom S., is based in Leuk D. village, Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan in different ways to improve their current living standards. 


Mrs. Tom S. is 38 years old and is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Khlok Srun, is a construction worker and also a fisherman who earns some money to support his family. This couple has a problem in that their fishing supplies are too old to use. Mrs. Tom S. is requesting a loan to buy new fishing supplies to improve their business. 


They support two children who both study at the local public school and also support their father’s business.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.ru: Ахатова Файзинисо проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 50 лет. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Дочь занимается шитьем. Сама Файзинисо имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует мужской одеждой. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Fayziniso A. lives the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 50 years old, married, and has one child. Her daughter works as a seamstress. Fayziniso has a high school education. She has been selling at the market for more than five years. She primarily sells men’s wear. She is taking out a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Temtemneh Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them better. 

Mariama L. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka and she is now thirty-two years of age. Mariama is married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending secondary and primary schools. 

Mariama sells batteries, toothpaste, bars of soap, rice, etc. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. With the help of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale.

loans.use: Buy batteries, toothpaste, bars of soap, rice, etc.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio B. F.   es un señor de 41  años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Lucio siempre se ha conocido por  señor muy  valiente y trabajador. El se ha  dedicado a la agricultura toda su vida, produciendo todo tipo de cultivos. Esto le ha permitido tener una fuente de ingresos, con lo que  ha logrado  darle a su familia lo que ellos necesitan.

Para seguir con su negocio Don Lucio necesita un préstamo de ¢604.000 (seiscientos Cuatro mil colones), para la compra de los insumos para el mantenimiento de 2 hectáreas de tierra donde cosecha diferentes productos como yuca, malanga, frijoles y maíz.

Don Lucio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo,  y con él espera crecer seguir creciendo para forjar un mejor futuro para su hijo.
texts.en:
Lucio B. F. is a 41-year-old who lives with his wife and 4 children in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles, in the Alajuela province. This community is known for being a mountainous area that is very close to the northern border of this country. Its main economic activities are stockbreeding and agriculture, particularly staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Mr. Lucio has always been known as a courageous and hard-working man. He has been in agriculture his entire life, growing all types of crops. This has allowed him to gain a source of income with which he has been able to provide for his family.

In order to continue with his business, Mr. Lucio needs a ¢604.000 CRC loan so that he can purchase the supplies he needs to maintain his 2 hectares of farmland on which he grows cassava, malanga (a yam-like root vegetable), beans, and corn.

Mr. Lucio is a member of the Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe company, one of the 100 organizations that have a partnership with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan, and with it, he hopes to keep expanding so that he can provide his son with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desde hace dos años, pertenece al distrito, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.
Sonia tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta.
Se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno, a la vez lleva mercadería 2 veces al mes a Lima, como: ropas, champús que distribuye al por mayor. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó en su capital de trabajo.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar ropas en Desaguadero.
Su visión es tener una tienda de artefactos eléctricos. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Sonia has been a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” communal bank for two years. She is from the Yunguyo district and province, in the Puno department; is 33 years old, and the single mother of two children. She has a junior high school education, but did not complete her studies. She raises cattle and also takes merchandise, such as clothing, and shampoos that she sells in bulk, to Lima twice a month. She used the money from first her loan of 300 PEN from “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” to increase her working capital. She is asking for a new loan of 3,000 PEN ($1,075) so that she can buy clothing from an outlet. Her vision is to have an electronics store. The things she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Yuri Antonio

texts.es: Yuri Antonio tiene 28 años, hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio que es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. Pues él es un padre responsable tiene 1 hijo menor de 5 años a su cargo, anteriormente el alquilaba un triciclo pues con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio fue así que con los financiamientos ha logrado obtener uno propio para ponerlo a la disposición de los diferentes clientes que en su mayoría son vecinos entre otros.
