Este financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, asientos, pedales, forros de asientos, cadena entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yuri Antonio, 28, has provided Tricitaxi (pedicab) services for over five years because he is a responsible father; he has a five year old son in his care. He used to lease the pedicab but after much effort and sacrifice with help from the loans he was able to acquire his own to put at his customers disposal. Most of them are his neighbors, among others. The financing is to buy tires, seats, pedals, seat covers and a chain, among other things. He dreams with improving his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires, seats, pedals, seat covers and a chain, among other things.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Carolina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Carolina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal use products such as perfumes, lotions, talc powder, and make up set to the local community. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carolina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Carolina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores B. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Dolores is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Dolores owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling products such as shampoo, soap , toothpaste, canned goods and fast foods in the local community. Dolores has run her business for more than one year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dolores joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and increase her working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dolores from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her shop. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gwendolyn

texts.en:
Gwendolyn A. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old and married and with six adult children. To make a living, Gwendolyn owns a retail store selling fish such as milk fish, mackerel, and sardines. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Gwendolyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Gwendolyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: working capital to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Nea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nea P. is a loan group leader She is 23 years old and has been selected by four members who will each use their portion of the loan to support their family's located in Sameakki village, in Takeo province. 

She and her husband, Mr. SE. Chan, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell and support their family and. Mr. SE. Chan is also a fisherman. This is the time to plant rice so she needs a lot to support. So to improve this purpose, Mrs. Nea P. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed. She is a mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly L. is from the city of Bañadero Ozamiz City. He is 39 years old. Rolly is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rolly owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating transportation services. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rolly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rolly is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rolly from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Margaret Mumbe

texts.en:
Margaret Mumbe M. is 47 years old business lady who owns and teaches in her private school in Kilifi. She is a single mother of four children. Margaret has been in the education sector for one year and her business is doing well and she has been able see the number of her pupils grow for that one year.


This marks Margaret's first loan from KADET and she plans to purchase desks for her pupils. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to build a new classroom.


She has dreams of expanding the school to an academy that she hopes will be a centre of excellence in future.

loans.use: purchase desks for the students

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
This borrower, Samer, is from Iraq. He is 23 years old and lives with four other members of his family.

In 2008, Samer decided to open his own barber shop after accumulating good experience in this field. He is well known in his local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to redecorate his shop and to buy two air conditioners. He aims to improve his business and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: redecorate his shop and buy two air conditioners

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: Kahindo K.  est entrepreneur, vice présidente du groupe Tosheka, âgée de 52 ans, veuve, mère de 9 enfants.  Son mari fut décédé suite à une  maladie inopinée. La cliente Kahindo K.  est vendeuse des braises (charbon de bois). En  l’an 2000, elle  commença son business  avec un fonds  reçu de son ami sous forme d’une assistance non remboursable de 35$. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Elle installe ses produits au marché sectoriel Alanine - Katindo. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  9 sacs des braises  pour augmenter son stock en volume et en valeurs.  En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire confortablement pour ses enfants.  La cliente Kahindo K.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Tosheka est constitué de 30 membres.
texts.en: Kahindo K. is an entrepreneur and the vice-president of the group named Tosheka. She is 52 years old and she is the mother of 9 children. Her husband passed away from a sudden illness. Kahindo K. sells charcoal (wood coal). In 2000, she started her business with money she received from her husband, a $35 allowance. She later approached IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of $50. She displays her products in the neighborhood market of Alanine-Katindo. The new loan will help her purchase 9 sacks of charcoal to increase the volume of her inventory and its value. Additionally, she hopes to purchase a parcel of land to build a comfortable dwelling for her children. Kahindo K. is grateful to Hekima for their actions towards the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The Tosheka group is made up of 30 members.

loans.use: To purchase 9 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
"Adelfa is 65-year-old married woman. She supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store coffee shop and a fishing business. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store coffee shop and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6000. Adelfa is borrowing PHP 18500 so that she may purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her eighteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Adelfa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Martha Ryder

texts.es: Martha Ryder tiene 37 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Tiene su negocio que es una pulpería y brindar el servicio de costura. Tiene más 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio cuando estaba soltera y no tenía los medios suficientes para sacar adelante a su familia. Para Martha no fue fácil realizar este trabajo ya que no tenía suficiente experiencia al ofrecer sus productos a los clientes esto es algo que ella ha logrado aprender con el tiempo, lo más difícil es que también es Madre y tiene que atender a sus hijos. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas y telas pues se acerca la temporada de clases.
texts.en: Martha Ryder is 37 years old and has two children in her charge.  She has a convenience store and also provides sewing services.  She has had this business for more than 4 years.  She started when she was single and did not have sufficient resources to move her family forward.  For Martha, it was not easy to do this work, since she did not have enough experience in offering her products to customers.  This is something that she has succeeded in learning over time.  The most difficult thing is that she is also a mother and has to look after her children.  This loan is for the purchase of candy and fabric, since school season is coming.

loans.use: Candy and fabric for her convenience store and sewing business

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Ou O. is a 43-year-old married woman who resides in the province of Kompong Cham. She can make around $1.50 in profit each day from her farming business. She has a life partner in her husband, who also works in the same business. 

The couple is blessed with five children; four are single and the other one is married and now lives in their own home. Two of their kids are working in the garment factory on a formal monthly salary. 

Because it is the harvesting season, Ou O. needs capital while prices are low to purchase many sacks of rice to store for later resale. With the rest of the funds, she will buy a new ladder in order to replace a broken one.

loans.use: To stock up on rice while prices are low

loans.name: Numon

texts.en:
Numon uses his small van as a taxi, transporting passengers around his hometown. He started driving a taxi 15 years ago. He makes around $10-$15 per day, which is enough to support himself, his wife and their two children. Numon is a positive influence on those around him and demonstrates responsibility and a good work ethic. He has requested a loan for $3,000 USD to replace his minivan with a bigger one. We are grateful for this opportunity to assist Numon with his business and to help keep him out on the road earning a living.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new minivan.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita S. is 53 years old, married and has eight children. She farms rice and raises hogs. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. She also helps him plant the rice while managing their small backyard piggery. She makes sure the pigs are healthy.

Jelita's loan will be used to purchase pig feed, fertilizer and other farming necessities. She hopes her family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed, fertilizer and other farming necessities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks, batteries and sweets

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 24 years old and single. He owns a shop where he sells many items such as soap,Omo,shoes and traditional fabric known as bitenge. Eugene is very hard working and has been having this business for the past year.Since starting his business he has been able to buy a piece of land. 

Eugene is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes and increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open up a bar in addition to his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.en:
Davlatbek is a small business entrepreneur. He owns a grocery store and has much experience working in this sphere of trade. His business is known for its reasonable pricing policy and free delivery service. 

Davlatbek is always on the go. He is very determined and knows how to achieve his goals.   Davlatbek is seeking a loan of 6800 Somoni to purchase foodstuffs to expand his inventory. He is hoping to use the generated profit to finish remodeling his apartment, which he has not been able to complete due to financial constraints. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff for his grocery store

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pendano est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « la Victoire », âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Son mari est un mécanicien. La cliente est vendeuse de légumes (spécialement du Sombé) au long de la rue ambiante.  Il ya 6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  20$ issus de ses revenus de tricotage. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  20 tas de Sombé frais et le reste sera affecté aux mini projets de ménage.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et  acheter une parcelle pour y construire sa maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « la Victoire » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Pendano is an entrepreneur and the leader of the business group "La Victoire" (Victory). She is 37, married, and a mother of 3. Her husband is a mechanic. She sells vegetables, especially Sombé (cassava leaves), on the street, which she has been doing for 6 years. She started her business with 20$, which she got from knitting. She will use this new loan to buy 20 piles of fresh Sombé and use the rest of the money for other household-related mini-projects. In addition to that, she plans on expanding her business, sending her children to school, and buying a piece of land to build a house. Pendano thanks Hekima for what it does to help those who have been rejected by traditional banks. It should be noted that "La Victoire" is a business group which consists of female members mainly.

loans.use: buy 20 piles of fresh Sombé (cassava leaves)

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Doña Norma tiene su propio negocio, iniciando hace seis años, con pequeña ventas, de ropa y joyas. Durante estos años ha logrado captar clientes, en donde tiene muchos pedidos.
Sus dos hijos siguen en la educación primaria, siendo su esposo el apoyo de la familia. 
Con su negocio se ha ayudado mucho, logrando suplir otros gastos de su familia, lo que esta satisfecha con su ventas. y con la institución por ser el medio que ha hecho posible esta mejora económica.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de: ropa de dama y varón, zapatos, y cosméticos de la zermat, para seguir aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Norma has her own business, which she started six years ago with a few sales of clothes and jewelry. Over the years, she has been gaining customers who bring her a lot of orders.

Her two children are working on their elementary education; her husband supports the family.

This business has helped her greatly, allowing her to meet other household expenses. She is happy with her sales, and this organization has been the means through which she has been able to improve financially.

With this new loan, she will purchase clothes for women and men, shoes, and Zermat cosmetics so that she can continue growing her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for women and men, shoes, and cosmetics, allowing her to have better sales and revenue

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Revendeur de boissons et des produits d’alimentation, Kodzo a crée sa boutique (ETS BIEN) en 2005. Sa conjointe est également revendeuse et ils ont 02 enfants. Il est à son second prêt il sera lui servira à acheter des marchandises.
texts.en: A retailer of drinks and food products, Kodzo started his store (ETS BIEN) in 2005. His wife is also a retailer and they have two children. He is on his second loan, which will serve to buy merchandise for the store.

loans.use: To buy canned drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Beug Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de  solidarité Beug Diam du Banc Villageois de Baralé est composé de 29 femmes; il est créé le 17 mai 2010. Les femmes habitent le même village et font toutes du petit commerce.


Madame Khady la responsable est âgée de 25 ans, mariée sans enfant mais elle a en charge ses deux nièces; sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en robe rose bleu avec un foulard vert attaché sur sa tête.

Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de beignets à l'école du village,et de légumes dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle capitalise une expérience de 10 ans. 

Son prêt lui permettra de varier ses légumes (carottes,aubergines, choux,navets,poivrons...) afin de satisfaire la clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus.

Elle souhaite augmenter son épargne pour pouvoir obtenir un crédit élevé, mais aussi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille surtout de sa mère.
texts.en:
The Beug Diam solidarity group belonging to the Banc Villageois in Baralé is made up of 29 women; it was set up on 17th May 2010. The women live in the same village and all have small businesses.

Khady, who is in charge of the group, is married, but although she has no children she does take care of her two nieces; she is standing on the right in the photo and is dressed in a pink and blue dress with a green scarf on her head.

She has a small business selling fritters at the village school and vegetables at the weekly markets. She has 10 years experience.

Her loan will allow her to vary her vegetables (carrots, egg plants, cabbages, turnips, peppers..) in order to satisfy customer demand and make more money.

She would like to increase her savings in order to be able to get a significant loan, but also to be able to improve her small family's living conditions, and above all her mother's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale at weekly markets

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Josephine has a retail shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of firewood to sell.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stickers, posters, toys, bracelets, and necklaces.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, 59 years old, is selling groceries with her husband. Their income is $15 per day. They have one child staying with them and helping to sell the grocery goods. He is 21 years old.  Every month, Saran has to spend $38 on food, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy more goods to sell.  She wants to save profits in order to repair her house for her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jonard

texts.en:
Jonard is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. The family is residing in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. It's been Jonard's dream to own a motorcycle for subsistence, which was brought into reality through hard work and determination. From that time on, he actively drives and sends passengers to designated areas safely.  It allows him to earn PHP 10,000 a month, considering other sources of irregular income, too.

A loan of PHP 50,000 from GDMPC will absolutely help Jonard to repair his motorcycle. The availability of this fund is a channel to facilitate operations immediately. With this loan, Jonard is expecting to pursue his job with a motor vehicle in good running condition to provide satisfactory service to customers. He hopes to sustain the daily needs and improve further service capacity.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 55 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 03 menores hijos y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. El arduo trabajo que Justina realiza en su chacra, ha hecho que sus cultivos sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus plantas de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar sus plantaciones. Lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, porque que el transporte de vehículos es muy escaso por esta parte de la ciudad y por ello solicita el crédito para poder comprar triciclos y carretillas para trasladar sus productos.  Espera contar con la misma fuerza posteriormente ya que desea que sus hijos sean profesionales. Este será su crédito número 04 con MFP y en sus anteriores créditos fue muy puntual en la devolución del dinero y por ello espera de su colaboración para seguir progresando y agradece a los financistas por apoyarle en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará carretillas y triciclos para trasladar sus productos recolectados.
texts.en:
Justina, 55, is a simple and hardworking woman who lives in her house with her husband and their three children, and what she most desires is to have a peaceful old age.  Justina has worked very hard on her farm and therefore her crops have been abundant and productive.  She takes them to sell in San Francisco where she gets the best prices for her cacao plants, coffee and citrus fruit since she has loyal customers who buy all wholesale.  What she most likes about her work is protecting her plantings from the insect infestations that can affect the crops.  
She has been farming for 35 years and what she considers the most difficult is transporting the products because transport vehicles are few and far between in this part of the city. That is why she is requesting a loan so that she can buy cargo tricycles and carts so that she can move the products.  She plans on working with the same effort in the future since she wants her children to become professionals.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP and she made her previous payments punctually so as to pay off the loans.  She hopes that you will help so that she may continue progressing and she thanks the lenders for supporting her in her work.  She will use the 1,000 new sols to buy carts and cargo tricycles so that she can transport her harvest.

loans.use: to buy carts and cargo tricycles to transport her harvested crops

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, two of whom go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells fresh milk in a shop on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years.

Alex has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy a refrigerator and jerry cans (a type of container for liquid) for milk. Her major challenge is seasonality. Her inspiration goal is to to see her business grow big so that she can buy milk cans instead of using jerry cans for milk. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and jerry cans to improve her business.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar is married with three children. She has been running a grocery business for 8 years. Gulnar is a very open, enthusiastic and responsible person. She sells different food stuffs as well as home products in the central market of Agsu city. Her monthly profit is 250 USD and she is on the way to increasing it. Gulnar takes care of her elderly parents and helps them with what they need. She would like to obtain a loan of 800 AZN to increase her inventory. She hopes to sell more and generate additional income.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to increase income

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
When Diana moved to San Francisco from Mexico, she dreamed of opening her own jewelry shop as a way to earn a living. She was scared to go into business alone, “But then I realized: Times are changing and now women do have the opportunity to run their own businesses. I knew it would be hard but I knew I could do it,” recalls Diana. 

And Diana did not have to go it alone. Propelled by the help of Women’s Initiative (a San Francisco-based training center for women entrepreneurs) and MISBA (a network of small businesses in the Mission neighborhood), she launched a small jewelry and repair shop in San Francisco’s Mission District neighborhood. Diana affectionately named it “Diju,” after a combination of her name and her husband’s name, Juan. Diana’s friends and family gathered together and helped furnish her shop. Together they built countertops and cabinets out of beautiful, dark wood and filled the cabinets with delicate silver and beaded necklaces, rings and earrings. “I feel so grateful to have had so much help and support. I was never alone in this,” she beamed. 

Diju Jewelry gained recognition in the community and business flourished. “I feel so proud to own my own successful business outside of my home country.” By 2010, Diana’s business had grown to the point that she needed to purchase more merchandise. She knew she could increase her profits if she had more merchandise to sell, but she didn’t have the money to purchase the inventory up front—a plight common to many small businesses.

A loan officer from Opportunity Fund was venturing through the Mission, catching up with local shopkeepers and getting to know new local business owners. When she passed through Diju Jewelry, Diana explained her business’s needs and together they came to the conclusion that a microloan would do just the trick.  “Opportunity Fund made everything so easy. Anytime I was confused or had a question, I just asked my loan officer and she helped me so much,” said Diana. 

Diana repaid her first loan in no time and raised her FICO score from 633 to 654! When she applied for a second loan this fall, Opportunity Fund was delighted to continue building a relationship with her and approved her for another loan. With $5,000, Diana will buy a new security system and increase her inventory. 

The future of Diju Jewelry is bright. Diana hopes to attend an artisanal school and expand her expertise about jewelry design and repair. She also feels a strong desire to master her English skills. “If I could improve my English, I could sell much more jewelry… Maybe even to the President some day!” she laughs.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Diana from  United States

loans.use: to buy a security system.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is married with 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Meriam is 37 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Meriam requested a PHP 14,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment.

Meriam has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Meriam would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria es una persona separada que mantiene ella sola a su familia que cuenta  de tres niñas, esta familia humilde se encuentra en la zona del Plan 3000,  a 1 hora del centro del la ciudad, la señora se dedica a la venta de comida para sacar adelante a sus hijas que se encuentran entrando a la adolescencia por lo que la tarea se le hace mas dificil a la señora, las niñas colaboran con su mama porque ella no tiene los recusros para contratar personal, ademas ella solicito el credito para la compra de mesas y sillas de su negocio puesto que las que tiene actualmente estan deterioradas y eso le esta alejando a su clientela y eso es lo peor que le podria pasarle en este momento de necesidad. Lo que la solicitante quiere es sacar adelante a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is separated from her husband and supports her family (three daughters) on her own.  This humble family lives in Plan 3000 district, one hour from the city center.  Ana Maria sells food in order to provide for her daughters.  Her daughters are becoming adolescents which makes her job more difficult.  The girls help their mom because she doesn't have enough money to hire staff.  

Ana Maria requested this loan to buy tables and chairs for her business because those which she has right now are worn and this is losing her customers which is the worst that could happen to her during this moment of need.  What she would like is to get her daughters ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her food stall business

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto was born in the village of Villa Luz, in Isabela province. He is a farmer. He is married  and they have two children. 

For the past 20 years, he has been living in the town of Ilagan and working in agriculture. He has a five parcel of land which was granted to him by his father. Currently, his lands have been cleared. He will use the funds from the loan to buy seeds to plant corn, and also to carry out the necessary work to prepare the soil. 

He is the sole support of his household, since his wife is a housewife. He is a longstanding client, and he is very grateful to the institution for the support given to him so he can continue improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Faafili

texts.en:
Faafili is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Papa Sataua. She is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Faafili owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not her only means of generating revenue, selling fried foods in the local community is her main source of income. Faafili has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 400 WST per month from these activities.

In 2011, Faafili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Faafili is requesting her first loan from SPBD in the amount of 1000 WST. She will use the loan to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products.  Faafili plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Jane Wangari

texts.en:
Jane is a 29-year-old single woman with two children who are 10 and 14. For the past three years, she has run a business where she sells paraffin. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are local community members. Jane describes herself as hardworking. Her biggest business challenges are insufficient funds and the fluctuating price of paraffin.

Jane is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase paraffin. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy paraffin

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Jenifer has a food store, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Jenifer has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs Leng, 57, is a single mother who has a married child, living in Dongkor commune, not far away from Phnom Penh city.  Everyday Leng sells fish porridge to the people in the commune for their breakfast and she is able to generate income approximately $1.33 per day.  However, the family’s main source of income is from her daughter who works as a garment worker and her son-in-law, who provides a Tuk Tuk service. 

Leng wants to acquire her first loan from HKL and Kiva to fix her house and cover the ground with concrete.  Leng hopes to get a comfortable living after her house is fixed.  She is very happy and grateful for the support from our lenders.

loans.use: to fix her house and cover the ground with concrete.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FIGURACORO, un des villages de KANGABA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est   l’arachide et riz  avec   FADIMA, 1ère personne assise de la  droite vers la   gauche de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KANGARE, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es: Omaira es una mujer de 54 años, casada y madre de dos hijos, que aprovechó la amplitud de su vivienda ubicada en un barrio de la capital del país para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y esperar su vejez con un ingreso seguro al construir en su predio tres apartamentos para dar en arriendo.  Hace 15 años Omaira y su familia perciben ingresos a razón del canon de arrendamiento que cancelan sus inquilinos, sin embargo su compromiso es mantener en perfecto estado los apartamentos por eso constantemente les debe realizar mantenimientos. Omaira realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar materiales de construcción yeso, cemento y pintura para realizar reparaciones de paredes, cielo raso y tuberías. Omaira espera que sus hijos continúen con la tradición y ella pueda disfrutar en compañía de su cónyuge de una vejez tranquila.

loans.use: comprar materiales de construcción yeso, cemento y pintura para realizar reparaciones de paredes, cielo raso y tuberías.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with grown up children. She is a strong Christian and a member of ACK Church in Mihuti. She is a member of Mathioya Womens Group. She is a farmer and grows tea, coffee and rears a dairy cow. Jane has benefitted from her group. She gets small loans from her group that has enabled her to improve the management of her livestock business. She is able to buy animal feed and get modern veterinary services for her cow. She generates most of her income from milk sales. Jane has applied a loan of USD 150 that will enable her to buy shares from Kenya Reinsurance Company. The shares will be floated on the market in January 2007. The group has approved the purchase of the shares through their new rule passed in their December 2006 meeting. Jane will repay the money in 12 monthly installments.

loans.use: Jane would like to invest in shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Shahrukh

texts.en: Shahrukh, son of Amanullah, is 29. He was born in Kabul, Afghanistan and currently lives in District 7 of Kabul. He is single and has the responsibility for 8 family members. To honour his responsibility he has a wood shop where he sells wood and earns income to fulfill the requirements of his family. He is in his 5th loan cycle and wants to buy more wood for his shop with the loan money.

loans.use: To buy wood for his shop

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline was born in 1965. She is happily married with four children. She likes business, but it was difficult for her to raise her take-off capital and her husband was unable to give it to her. She became more frustrated when her sister died and left behind children. It was not easy to provide food for her own children and those of her sister. She joined GHAPE in 2001 and received a loan of $30 and started her firewood business and gave part of the money to the children to trade. With the training received from GHAPE, she was able to sell the firewood and repay her loan. After this experience she decided to take another loan of $80 to continue the same business. She was now buying in greater quantity. She has taken loans up to $280. This business has made people call her “Mami Firewood.” The people in the community are happy with her business because she is the only one doing this business and she supplies them with local fuel for cooking and at a cheaper cost.

With this loan of $1000, she plans to continue her firewood business, which she will be buying in bulk and supplying to other people who have also entered into this business. She also intends to buy food items like rice, corn, groundnut, koki beans, Egusi, maggi and salt which she can retail alongside the firewood in her community.

She promised to repay her loan during the term, and repayment will begin on the fourth month from the date she receives her loan.

loans.use: Pauline, also known as "Mami Firewood" would like to buy more firewood and food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married. She lives in the town of Vinogradovo located in western Ukraine. Nadezhda sells shoes in the central mall in Vinogradovo. Her little store is well-known for having a big assortment of inventory. Nadezhda has been in business for five years and has rich experience working as a sales manager. She is very communicative, honest and responsible. 

Nadezhda is hoping to use this loan of $800 to purchase more footwear from wholesalers to sell in her store. She hopes that one day her business will expand enough to allow her to invest her profits and purchase her own vending facility. Nadezhda has demonstrated responsibility and integrity in her relationships with her suppliers and customers as well as when she has used lending services from Nadiya Ukraine. Prompt loan repayments and the stability of her business demonstrate her trustworthiness and capability of further loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase shoe inventory

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is the young mother of three. She has sold general goods since she was a girl. She now keeps a stall at La Hoyada market where two of her children help her. The third child is in school and takes care of himself. Isabel's husband helps to support the family by selling goods on the Ucayali River. They work together to provide a good life for their children and dream of seeing them complete their education and becoming successful professionals. They also hope some day to buy their own stall in the market. Isabel is asking for a loan of $975 to buy the merchandise her customers ask her for daily and to finance her husband's river trading. The whole family is grateful for your generosity and eagerly awaits your answer.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Isabel es una joven madre de tres hijos, la actividad que realiza desde muy temprano es la venta de productos de pasamanería, con la ayuda de dos de sus hijos en el mercado de “La Hoyada” ya que uno de ellos estudia y se mantiene por sí mismo. De manera adicional para contribuir con los gastos familiares su esposo se dedica a la venta de mercaderías y artículos diversos durante los viajes que realiza por el río Ucayali, de esa manera los dos colaboran con la educación de sus hijos y tratan de incrementar su calidad de vida.Isabel contempla como uno de sus planes más importantes para el futuro hacer que sus dos menores hijas lleguen a ser profesionales y además poder comprar un espacio propio dentro D. mercado donde actualmente ofrece estos productos.Isabel solicita 975 dólares para poder comprar la mercadería que le hace falta para cumplir satisfactoriamente con cada uno de los requerimientos que a diario le comunican sus clientes y para incrementar el capital D. negocio que administra su esposo cuando viaja por tan majestuoso río.Todos y cada uno de los miembros de esta familia agradecen tu generosidad y esperan tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: To stock a general store.

loans.name: Thi Loi

texts.vi:
Ms Lợi is 25 years old, she is married and has a daughter who attends 1st grade. She and her husband have a shop fabricating wooden furniture. They are in this business for 5 years. She's requesting a loan to buy wood to augment the production. This business helps to provide a steady income for her family. They have 4 employees working for them. She hopes to expand her shop in the future.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lợi năm nay 25 tuổi, chị đã có 1 bé gái học lớp 1.Hai vợ chồng chị làm đồ gỗ, chuyên làm tủ, và bàn ghế. Anh chị đã làm nghề này được 5 năm. Chị vay vốn đểmua gỗ, làm nghề này giúp gia đình chị có thu nhập ổn định và ngày mở rộng sản xuất được hơn nữa. Xưởng sản xuất của chị phải thuê thêm 4 nhân công nữa. Chị hi vọng trong tương lai sẽ mở rộng thêm sản xuất hơn nữa.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Mrs. Ky S., age 24, runs a small stand at a market selling vegetables, earning around $4 each day of profit. Her husband would like to be a moto-taxi driver to earn extra income for the family. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Thi Kieu Anh Ha

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hà, 23 years old, is married and has one child. The husband and wife tend a shoe shop at home. The shop caries footwear which targets young customers. Two year ago, prior to the shoe shop she had a music store. The reason for her to change was there are fewer shoe stores in town. She invests quite a bit and had to borrow 10 millions VND (~625USD) from her relatives. She would like to take out a loan from Binh Minh because it allows her to pay in small installments. Her daily income is about 100,000VND (~6.25USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hà, 23 tuổi, đã có chồng và một con nhỏ. Hai vợ chồng chị mở cửa hàng bán giầy dép tại nhà. Cửa hàng của chị khá nhiều mẫu mã, chủ yếu là phục vụ giới trẻ. Trước kia chị mở cửa hàng bán băng đĩa nhưng mới chuyển sang mặt hàng này được 2 năm vì tại thị trấn rất ít cửa hàng bán. Chị đầu tư vốn khá nhiều và phải vay mượn bà con họ hàng hơn 10 triệu đồng. Chị thích vay vốn theo Chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh minh vì chị được trả góp dần hàng tuần, chị đầu tư mua thêm một số mẫu dép mới. Mỗi ngày thu nhập gia đình chị từ bán hàng cũng lãi gần 100.000đ nên chị thấy việc trả theo tuần khá hợp lý.

loans.use: Buy footwear

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Mrs. Griselda C. lives in the Alpacoma section of the city of La Paz, along with her husband and their two children. She runs a neighborhood store out of her home, and her husband works as a driver of a small truck transporting construction supplies.

The rooms they occupy are rented and their plot of land still has a foundation for an additional room. Their loan would be earmarked to building two rooms so they can move to a place of their own.

This is the third occasion that she seeks a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis conducted indicates they qualify favorably for access to credit. This will be the second time that Griselda solicits credit through Kiva. Her prior loan was paid in its entirety and without any delays.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Griselda C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Alpacoma ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Francisco Cacasaca y sus dos hijos. La señora Griselda tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como chofer de una volqueta, transportando material de construcción. Las habitaciones que ocupan son de alquiler y su lote de terreno aun tiene amurallado y cimiento corrido para una habitación. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones para así poder trasladarse a su vivienda propia. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Esta será la segunda vez que Griselda solicita crédito a través de Kiva. El crédito anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad sin ninguna demora.

loans.use: Construction of two rooms on their own land.

loans.name: Zainabu's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is a 32 year-old married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 12. She owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. She works everyday from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $400 to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in bites sales and banana sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Elbia Patricia

texts.es:
With much effort, Elbia R. has excelled in her business. She runs a general store in the municipality of South San Rafael of the city of Managua. She’s a married mother of 2 school-aged children of whom she’s very proud for being good students at their school.

Elbia finds herself in a situation where she is in urgent need of acquiring merchandise to sell. This is why she has looked for support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will allow her to buy merchandise she can sell, in order to continue taking care of her children and the house.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elbia R. con mucho esfuerzo se ha destacado en su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur de la ciudad de Managua. Es una madre casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar el cual se siente orgullosa por ser muy bueno alumnos en su colegio.

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa la señora Elbia es la urgencia de la adquisición de la mercadería para la venta, es por este motivo que ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito oportuno que le permita adquirir sus productos para así comercializarlos y de esta manera continuar con la manutención de su hogar y de sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Mr. Ratana C., 44, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Un, 41, were married in 1989 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of their children have full time employment in Phnom Penh and another one is in school . The two youngest stay at home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ratana has been a weaver since 1985. It’s skill he learned from his parents. He also taugt  his wife to be come a weaver in 1998. The couple sells their finished products to the middle man in the village who sells them in Phnom Penh. 

Ratana is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk material for weaving and tor fill in the land round his house because it floods in the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and fill in the land around the house.

loans.name: Maria Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba has always been a very hard-working woman, and has been selling clothes for the last ten years. She became a single mother 19 years ago, and she started her own business to give her son a better quality of life and a better education. She sells clothing and shoes.

Rosalba requests a loan of $250 to be paid back in 6 months to purchase summer clothes, and to offer a wider variety of items to her customers. With your support, Rosalba will be able to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer.

Rosalba siempre ha sido muy trabajadora y desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa ella es madre soltera desde hace 19 años, razon por la que incio su negocio para darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida asi como educacion. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para la compra de ropa de temporada de verano la cual esta proxima y desea tener variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Rosalba podra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza is a 35-year old woman who dedicates herself to farming, her primary activity being the harvest of pineapple. She was able to start the business thanks to a family member who sold her some land at very affordable prices and she wanted to take the opportunity to start up in agriculture.

On her land, she plants pineapple which is a sought-after product both for export and import. Ticuantepe is a municipality that is, almost in its entirety, cultivated with pineapple crops. The plantings need careful maintance to yield healthy pineapples, and with the loan she would purchase products to apply to her crop so she can have a successful harvest to distribute to her primary purchasers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Esperanza es una mujer de 35 años de edad que se dedica a la agricultura, su actividad es la cosecha de piña, pudo inicarse en este negocio gracias a que un familiar le vendió unas tierras a precios módicos y ella quiso aprovechar la oportunidad para comenzar a cosechar. En sus tierras ella siembra piña producto muy solicitdao tanto para la exportación como para la importación. Ticuantepe es un municipio que casi en su totalidad se encuentra sembrado de piña. Estos siembros necesitan de un mantenimiento cuidadoso para que la piña pueda salir completamente sana, y con el crédito adquirirá insumos agrícolas para aplicárselos a los productos y así poder tener una cosecha muy exitosa y distribuir las piñas a sus principales compradores.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies to maintain her pineapple crops.

loans.name: Deyinatou

texts.fr:
Deyinatou M. is 40 years old, married and the mother of six children. She sells grains in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometres from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this second FECECAV loan, she wishes to increase her stock by purchasing corn, millet, rice and beans. The income from her business will allow her to contribute to the expenses of her household. In this photo, Deynatou is being helped by her daughter.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Deyinatou M. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire par ce second crédit de FECECAV augmenter le stock de ses marchandises en achetant du maïs, du mil, du riz et du haricot. Les fruits de son activité lui permettront d’intervenir dans la prise en charge des dépenses du foyer. Dans la photo, Deyinatou est aidée dans sa tâche par sa fille.

loans.use: The purchase of corn, millet, rice and beans

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
Magali tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y su pequeño de 6 años, en casa de su suegro y cuñados. Ella y su esposo se dedicaron por varios años al transporte público en microbús, su esposo era el chofer y ella la cobradora, pasaron así los años, y sus ahorros le permitieron adquirir un auto de segunda mano, para trabajar haciendo taxi todos los días, los años de experiencia en esta actividad, ya suman 6, les permite tener bases sólidas en su economía.Adicionalmente, Magali es niñera, esto es un ingreso extra para ella y su familia. 
Esta pareja de esposos se esfuerza porque desean tener un hogar estable y su casa propia.
Magali solicita este préstamo el cual invertirá en la reparación del motor de su carro, para que de esa manera tenga una larga vida  su motor.
texts.en:
Magali is 26 years old and lives with her husband and little 6-year-old in her in-laws´ house. She and her husband worked in public transportation for several years; her husband was the driver of a minibus and she was the fare collector. Their savings enabled them to buy a second-hand auto which they work as a taxi service every day. The years spent in this activity, which now number 6, have enabled them to solidify their economy. In addition, Magali is a nanny; this is extra inome for her and her family. This couple works very hard because they want to have a stable home and their own house. Magali requests this loan, which will be used to fix their taxi´s motor so that this way the motor will last for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair vehicle used for taxi service.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is a widow of A. G.. She lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 40 years.

She is the mother of two sons. Both sons are involved in a scrap metal business. They buy iron from different factories and sell those pieces to other people. Suraiya baji works in a school as a maid. She is applying for a loan to buy iron for her sons' scrap metal business.

loans.use: To buy more iron to resell

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy Y. is a villager in Trapaing Sdouk village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Vann Ny, is a worker and he receives a small salary but he does not earn enough money to support his family. Thus, Mrs. Thy Y. decided to ask for loan to buy a cow to breed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 42 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres. Desde muy jovencita se ha dedicado a L. agricultura, siembra plátanos y cítricos en varias hectáreas de terreno que usa de forma alternada, cuando es tiempo de cosechar almacena el producto en su casa para ser encajonado y enviarlo al mercado de L. ciudad. También siembra café, esta temporadas le es rentable, en cambio el plátano, aunque cuesta barato nunca deja de producir buenos ingresos y le es muy rentable porque cada 15 días cosecha de una o de otra chacra, permitiéndole enviar semanalmente plátano al mercado, a elL. le agrada su actividad, le tiene mucho cariño a su chacra porque es L. fuente para generarse una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero piensa comprar insecticidas para sus plantas de plátanos de seda.
texts.en:
Magaly is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young, growing bananas and citrus fruits on a few hectares of land which she farms in rotation. When she harvests the fruit, she stores it in her house, packages it, and sends it to market in the city. She also grows coffee, which is seasonally very profitable. Bananas, on the other hand, are always inexpensive but never fail to provide good income. They are very profitable for her because every 15 days she can harvest from one farm or another, allowing her to send bananas to market each week. She enjoys her lifestyle and cares a great deal about her farm as it allows her to create a better life for herself. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she plans to buy insecticide for her banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de insecticidas para sus plátanos

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Shum Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. is the village bank president for eight people who all live in Svay Ming village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chan S. is 48 years old and is a widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Since her children's workplace is far from their house, they pay a lot of money for a motorbike taxi. Thus, Mrs. Chan S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to use to go to work and she hopes to reduce her family expenses in this way.

loans.use: to add her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to use to go to work

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 20-year-old young man, who lives in Adloun, Southern Lebanon. Ahmad worked in his father's shop for eight years, and then he opened his own aluminum shop a couple of years ago. Because he is dedicated to his work, his clientele has grown rapidly in the past year. Today, Ahmad wants to borrow $1200 in order to buy a new machine to cut aluminum sheets with better accuracy.

loans.use: Buy a new machine

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar B. is a single mother whose husband died five years ago. She has four children. Three of them go to elementary school and one is a university student. Six years ago, her family moved to UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia, from Uvs province, which is 2,000 kilometers away. Since she moved, she has been running a meat stall business, buying a whole cow or sheep and selling it off cut by cut, to feed her children and survive in the big city.

As a country woman, she has experience butchering goat and sheep meat. All her children help with their mother's business after school. Otgonbayar lives in a "ger" -- the traditional nomadic housing used on the Mongolian steppe -- sharing her relatives' yard and paying rent. She is taking her fifth loan with XacBank, Kiva's partner MFI in Mongolia. Her dream is to see all her children graduate from the university. (In the picture, Otgonbayar is on the left.)

loans.use: to buy more cow and sheep meat for sale during the Lunar New Year period

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima P. is 41 years old and is married with five children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells her products to the public two days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

She has never borrowed money from SPBD before. SPBD loans are Iemaima’s only access to capital because she can't qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. Iemaima will use her loan to buy farming equipment and sacks of fertilizer to improve her plantation business.

loans.use: Buy farming equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Abduraufu

texts.ru: Абдурауфу 51 год, женат и имеет 2 детей. Постоянной работы не имеет и работает на различных частных работах. Кроме этого занимается куплей продажей сухофруктов по базарным дням. Ему помогает его старший сын. Но основной доход Абдурауфу приносит его занятие электросварочными работами. Абдурауф выезжает к клиентам на дом если есть необходимость в электросварке, или изготавливает заказ дома если клиенты привозят ему сырье. Абдурауф подал заявку на получение займа и собирается обновить свой сварочный аппарат и купить металл для изготовления различных металлических решеток.
texts.en:
Abduraufu is 51 years old, he is married and has 2 children. He does not have a permanent job and works at a variety of private jobs. In addition, he purchases and sells dried fruits on market days. His eldest son helps him. But the main income Abduraufu makes is from his welding jobs. Abduraufu travels to clients’ homes if the are in need of welding or he makes their orders at home if the clients bring him the raw materials. Abduraufu applied for a loan and plans to update his welding equipment and to purchase metal to make a variety of metal lattices.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase welding equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Selesitina

texts.en: Selesetina T. is thirty-nine years old and married with three children.  She has four years experience in the sewing business. She sells to the public four days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva field partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $26.  SPBD loans are Selesetina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy secondhand sewing machine, fabric & sewing supplies

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan L., 37, is a divorced mother of five children who are single and living in the family home. Presently, she uses the raw materials that she obtains from the forest to braid mats for sale. That generates an income of $2.50 per day to feed her five children.

Mrs. L. has been widely known for a long time as skilled in raising pigs. Because of financial problems, she could not afford to raise pigs since her income is just enough for the basic needs of her family. Hence, Mrs. L. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva as capital to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Melonie

texts.en:
Melonie wants to borrow PHP 6, 000 from Kiva lenders to maintain her vending business. She is 34 years old and married to Efren E., 35 years old. He assists her in the business by planting different kinds of vegetables in their backyard garden. They are blessed with four children namely: Cherry - 18, Monette - 12, Perang - 11 and Efren - 6. All of them are attending school in different levels. The couple strives hard for the improvement of their poor living situation.

Melonie chooses to roam houses in their village to sell her vegetables instead of waiting for customers to buy the product at her home.

Having a poor living situation really turns Melonie to work harder for the future of her children. Currently, her family lives in the poor and remote village of St. Teresa Lallo, Cagayan. Melonie is hoping that, someday, despite their poor living conditions they will be able to support their children’s education through their small business that she strives to develop.

loans.use: To maintain her vending business

loans.name: Trương Thị

texts.en:
O. Trương Thị (525980636) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has two adult children.

O. owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,200,000 VND a month.

In 1999, O. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

O. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 10th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe C. Q. de 54 años de edad reside en el municipio de Ciudad Arce. Ella es una mujer soltera la cual vive junto a sus tres nietos, por los cuales vela día y noche. María Guadalupe posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual esta establecida desde hace 7 años. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con productos como granos básicos, lácteos, cereales, pan y bebidas, María desea mucho poder mejorar sus negocios y así también sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Guadelupe C. Q. is 54 years old and lives in the municipality of Ciudad Arce. She is a single woman who lives with her three grandchildren, whom she looks after full time. María has a store in her home that she established 7 years ago. She is requesting a loan so that she can supply her business with products such as basic grains, dairy products, cereals, bread, and beverages. María really wants to improve her business as well as her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more products to supply her store

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing corn

loans.name: Las Bratz Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Bratz está conformado por Yuly Adely Hernández W., Martha S., y Nubia Fátima Martínez H.. Las integrantes de este grupo viven en la entrada a  Piedra Menuda una comarca de Nindirí lo que le permite tener mayor accesibilidad para moverse a sus puntos de compra y venta. 

La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Yuly Hernández W. de 19 años edad  que es de muy bajo recursos económicos pero por sus deseos de seguir estudiando y poder acudir a una universidad ideo junto con su papá el poner un negocio. Es así que comenzó con su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa las cuales distribuye en su comunidad y la universidad; y en un futuro no muy lejano ella desea tener su propio establecimiento.

Pero por el momento esta joven necesita reinvertir en la compra de ropa para adulto ya que en este negocio se necesita estar al tanto de las nuevas líneas de la moda en camisas, blusas, pantalones, chores, calcetas y hasta ropa interior. 
 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son la joven Martha Isabel S. Sánchez de 24 años de edad  quien está casada con Darío García  y tiene un pequeño negocio de  venta de ropa y Nubia Fátima Martínez H. de 23 años de edad y está casada con Bladimir Manzanares que trabaja como mesero. Ella actualmente trabaja como docente y vende cosméticos para poder sobre vivir ya que en Nicaragua el salario de un profesor es uno de los menos remunerados.

Este grupo ya tuvo su primer préstamo en Adim lo que les ayudo a incrementar su inventario en productos y obtener mayores ganancias. En la actualidad ellas necesitan de ingresos para adquirir nuevas mercaderías y así  ir creciendo poco a poco sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Bratz Group is made up of Yuly Adely Hernández W., Martha S., and Nubia Fátima Martínez H.. The members of this group live at the entrance of Piedra Menuda, an area of Nindirí, which allows them to have greater accessibility to move from their buying and selling locations. The group leader is the young Yuly Hernández W., who is 19 years old and has very low economic resources, but because of her dreams of continuing her education and being able to attend university, she decided to open a business with her father. As a result, she started selling clothes, which she distributes within her community and at the university. In the near future, she wants to have her own store. At the moment, this young woman needs to reinvest to buy clothing for adults, because in her business, she needs to have many new lines of fashion in shirts, blouses, pants, stocking, and underwear. One of the other members is the young Martha Isabel S. Sánchez, who is 24 years old, is married to Darío García, and has a small business selling clothes. The other member, Nubia Fátima Martínez H., is 23 years old and is married to Bladimir Manzanares, who is a waiter. At present, she works as a teacher and sells cosmetics to be able to survive, because in Nicaragua a teacher’s salary is one of the lowest. This group has already had its first loan with Adim, and that loan helped them increase their inventory and make higher earnings. At present, they need income to buy new merchandise and, in this way, grow their business little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fashion clothing

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne was born in Adjohoun, a small town near Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. In Porto-Novo, she runs a small restaurant near a main road, where she sells rice, beans, noodles, and spicy Beninese sauce. Suzanne has been running this activity for at least fifteen years. Suzanne is very busy during the middle of the day, when Beninese people take their main meal.  

Suzanne is seeking her second loan from Alide, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin. She would like to restock her supplies of beans, rice, and noodles. Suzanne hopes to increase her profits enough to one day be able to buy a piece of land of her own. Suzanne has four children, all of whom are already grown.

loans.use: Rice, beans, and noodles

loans.name: Jane Musangi

texts.en:
Jane is forty four years old and married to Titus Kitonyo, who is forty nine years old. They have two children, named Alex and Susan, who are 18 and 15, respectively.

Jane has been in the business of tailoring and motorcycle transport for nine years. She has no previous loans from other microfinance institutions, and was introduced to KADET through existing borrowers.

Janet will use this loan to open a separate tailoring shop, as she now works from home. Jane works in a semi-slum area and her main clients are residents of the slum. Jane plans to use the extra profit she anticipates as a result of this loan to save and buy another motorcycle. Jane believes she is focused and her hopes and dreams are to own several motorbikes for her business. ABOUT KADET Kadet Ltd is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya that was formed in 2000 to offer access to financial services to the rural communities through the microfinance model. Kadet is the only microfinance in Kenya with a strong rural presence and a genuine concern for the welfare of children and the communities we serve. As a member of the Association of Microfinance Institutions in Kenya, Kadet has continued to empower communities by providing access to easy-to-pay loans. Loan products available at the MFI are designed to offer solutions to challenges facing communities in these rural habitations. Obtain more information on Kadet from the press section of the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To expand a tailoring business by opening a new shop.

loans.name: Mov

texts.en: Mov V., 42, sells yams with her husband in the local market of her Prey Veng province. She is married with four children, who two are construction workers; one is a student and one is too young to attend. She typically makes a combine about US$2 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$ to purchase more yams to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase more yams.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Life for the family of Dionisia C. is not easy. At her age which is 66 she really work hard to support their daily needs. She is already a widowed, her son Wilfredo help her improve their lives. He work as a factory worker to earn income for her family and her mother. But his salary from his more is not enough for their daily expenses and other expenses, so her mother help him earning incomes for them though her business which is making of bamboo basket.

Dionisia always use the loan that she received from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) in her business like today she will use her loan in buying things needed by her business so that her business continue to run and continue to help to lessen their burden in their expenses.

Dionisia’s dream is to make her business become successful so that she can give her son as well as the family of her son a better life and also to give others opportunity to have a job.

loans.use: For additional capital in her making of bamboo basket business

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie C. is 24 years old and operates a general store. Her 28-year-old husband, Crisante C., operates his own motorcycle business and works as a farmer.
