Margie does her best to fulfill her dreams and to make her business grow.  She works to have bigger profits to build their own house. At present, Margie, her husband, and their children live with her parents. 

Margie is not losing her hopes that some day she will fulfill her dreams. She wants to improve her business but she cannot make it because of insufficient capital. Therefore, Margie has joined the program and wants to borrow the amount of PHP 15,000 for additional capital to buy more items to sell.  She is hoping the KIVA lenders will give her consideration for her borrowing amount.

loans.use: To increase store inventory.

loans.name: Menana

texts.en: Menana Y. sells smoked fresh fish at Elmina near Mpoble.  She has no educational background.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a fisherman. Menana has been selling fresh fish since 2002. She helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to sell. She also processes fish by smoking them and sells them at the market. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell and fish to smoke for sale at the market.

loans.name: Shaiym's Group

texts.en:
Shaiym is the leader of this group. Shaiym lives in a rural town. Together with her husband, she has raised four children. Her husband is engaged in trading at the market. As for the children, the elder sons, who are 34 and 29, make their living by working as taxi drivers. A daughter, 26, is a seamstress. The youngest son, 22, is a welder. 

About 10 years ago, Shaiym got an idea to start raising cattle. She consulted with her husband and children and they decided to give this idea a try and purchased some sheep and a cow. After a short period of time, they understood that this was an excellent business as it was profitable and economical. Since that time, Shaiym has received a lot of profit as she has been selling milk daily and selling sheep when needed. 

Having these children, Shaiym is already a happy mother and could easily spare herself from any kind of concerns or problems. However, she has been the one who has brought these children up to be hardworking young people. Now Shaiym is 56 years old. She is actively occupied with increasing the total population of her cattle and sells 15 liters of milk per day. This brings her around $105 per month. Moreover, all her children strive to help their mother after work to take care of cattle. Shaiym does not have any difficulties dealing with her livestock. Shaiym needs a loan to buy one more cow. 

Shaiym’s partners are: 

Asel, 22, is married. Her husband is a welder. Asel raises livestock and sells milk. She needs this loan to buy two or three sheep.

Aigul, 40, has three children. Her husband works at a construction site. Aigul tailors woolen shoes and sells them at a fair. Aigul hopes to buy some sheep with this loan.

Rapat, 30, is the wife of a taxi driver. Rapat works as a seamstress. She has applied for this loan to buy one calf. 

Shaiym and her partners have some savings to add to the loans to be able to make their purchases.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a 29-year-old mother with two young children, ages 4 and 7. She works hard to help her husband meet the needs of their children, especially their education, and to improve their family's living conditions. Dolores lives in the village of Brgy Paraiso, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Walter, works as a laborer in a Hacienda (sugarcane plantation). The money he earns is not enough to sustain the needs of their family, especially their children.

Because Dolores has knowledge about running a business, she would think of ways to begin and what kind of business she could invest in. This also encouraged her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in the year 2002 in order to have start-up capital for her proposed business.

With the capital to invest in a general store, she bought different items to sell. Loans continued, and she was able to add a food-vending business and a pig-fattening business. She knows that this can help her earn money and realize her dreams. She was able to earn a minimum of $43 a month and saved most of it for her children.

Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP was used as working capital for her business. That amount was returned to NWTF-PD in full and on-time without any delay. She is currently on her 13th cycle loan, requesting 19,000 PHP, which will be used to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: René

texts.es:
René, de 19 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es tener una buena vida.
Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de quesos. Todas las mañanas, muy temprano, sale de su casa en busca de leche con la cual pueda elaborar sus deliciosos quesos. Él es un joven muy vivaz, motivo por el cual tiene muy clara la idea de que tiene que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer los quesos y los hace con mucho esmero, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es levantarse temprano a recolectar la leche. 
Para más adelante, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de René con MFP y está muy decidido a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participativo y solidario con sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más leche para poder incrementar su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
René is a 19-year-old young man who is very cheerful and hard-working. His lives in his parents' house and his dream is to have a good life. His occupation is the production and sale of cheeses. Very early each morning, he leaves the house in search of milk from which he will make his delicious cheese. He is a vivacious young man who understands well the need to work to help his parents with household expenses. What he likes most about his job is making the cheeses, and he makes them with great care. He has 4 years' experience in the business, and the most difficult part for him is getting up early to purchase the milk. Going forward, he hopes that his business will grow and provide him with a larger income. This is René's first loan with MFP and he is very determined to make his payments on time, since he wants to take out more loans in the future. He participates in many activities at his communal bank and is very supportive of his fellow members. With the five hundred nuevos soles requested, he will purchase more milk to increase his cheese production.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: Bunthy

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthy V. (pictured here), 37, and his wife, Mrs. Chhay-i Brak, 35, are living about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1991 and have two daughters. 

Bunthy has been driving a Tuk Tuk taxi in Phnom Penh for over a year. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. His motorbike is old and doesn’t work properly, so he is requesting his first loan of $300 to add to his own money to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one. He will be able to continue the business more easily, because the main source of income is from his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio M. G. de 30 años de edad, reside en Jayaque, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su padre y su madre. Luis Antonio posee un taller de venta y reparación de celulares, negocio el cual en los últimos años ha ido tomando fuerzas. Debido a la difícil situación que Luis Antonio atravesaba al no encontrar un empleo fijo, el decidió iniciar su propio negocio, en el cual repara todo tipo de celulares, así mismo vende accesorios para estos. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar celulares y repuestos, así mismo comprar cargadores, carcasas y chips de manera que pueda ir creciendo en su negocio y poder ofrecer más a sus clientes. Esto lo hace con el deseo de poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan brindarle mayor ayuda a sus padres y así mismo contar con una mejor estabilidad económica para su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio M. G., 30, lives in Jayaque, La Libertad department, with his mother and father. Luis Antonio has a cellular phone repair shop which has gathered strength in the last few years. Because of the difficult situation Luis Antonio was facing not being able to find a stable job, he decided to start his own business consisting in cellular phone repair; he also sells accessories for the phones. He is requesting funding to buy cell phones and replacement parts as well as chargers, cases, memory chips, etc. so that his business will grow and he will have more to offer his customers. He does this aiming to provide more support for his parents and have better economic stability for his family and home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cellular phone replacement parts and accessories.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es una alegre y simpática mujer de 36 años, vive con su esposo Moisés, de 40 años, y con 3 de los 4 hijos que tiene. 
A treinta minutos de camino desde la zona donde vive se encuentran sus sembríos,  donde cada mañana llega con sus herramientas de trabajo; sus toros, con las cuales ara las chacras y los asnos que trasladan los insumos agrícolas; mientras que los cerdos que cría los deja amaniatados al costado de su vivienda. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a sembrar papa, maíz y arveja junto a su esposo, pues lo que más le gusta es ver florecer los productos que le dan vida y belleza a los campos, además porque gracias a este oficio tiene bienes y animales que comercializa cuando tiene apuros económicos, pero lo más importante es que puede vivir cómodamente, sin apuro alguno.
Con el tiempo, anhela seguir luchando para conseguir nuevas oportunidades mediante la compra de terrenos agrícolas que le brinden excelentes cosechas.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y gracias a la organización de su banco comunal que trabaja entusiastamente. Como sus siembras de papa están para ser fumigados y abonados, solicita este crédito para comprar sacos de fertilizantes e insecticidas, en aras de asegurar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Flor is a happy and friendly 36 year old woman. She lives with her husband Moisés, age 40, and with 3 of their 4 children. Thirty minutes by road from the area she lives are located her planted fields where, each morning, she arrives with her work tools, the oxen with which she plows, and the donkeys that transport her raw materials. Meanwhile, the pigs she raises are left tied up next to her house.

For 20 years, Flor and her husband have been engaged in planting potatoes, corn, and peas. What she likes most is seeing the products she’s given life to flourish and the beauty of the countryside. In addition, thanks to her occupation she has possessions and animals that she can put up for sale when she has economic difficulties, but the most important thing is that she can live comfortably without hardship. For the future, she hopes to continue striving to obtain opportunities for purchasing agricultural land that provides her with excellent harvests.

This is the sixth loan that she has with MFP, thanks to the organization of her communal bank, which works enthusiastically. Since her potato crops have to be fumigated and fertilized she is applying for this loan in order to buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticide to assure the productivity of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth  Primitiva

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth esta divorsiada y tiene un hijo pequeño, cuenta que la separacion fue muy dificil para ella y su pequeño hijo pero supo salir adelante por el bienestar de su hijo,  tiene como actividad por el momento la venta de ropa y joyas por catalogo venta que realiza en diferentes lugares y oficinas, ella solicita un credito para la compra de muebles y enseres de salon de peluqueria, porque ella abrira proximamente un salon, donde ella atendera el mismo ya que ella es peluquera y asi aumentar sus ingresos de ella y su familia ya que ella sola mantiene el hogar y desea mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su hijo, es una persona trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is divorced and has one small child. She tells us that the separation was very difficult for her and her son, but she forged ahead for her child’s sake. Currently, she is selling clothing and catalog jewelry throughout different locales and offices. She is seeking a loan to buy furniture and supplies because she would like to open a beauty salon next. She would run the business herself, as she is a hairstylist. This activity would help her to augment her family’s income, given she is the sole provider and wants to improve her son’s standard of living. She is a very hard-working person, and is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they demonstrate by granting her credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Elourdes Maribel

texts.es:
La señora  Elourdes Z. es socia del Banco Comunal  Sol Naciente, vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay,  está situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera de los Andes Ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Nuestra socia se dedica  a la venta de bisutería en un puesto propio en el mercado de la feria libre (Mercado de Cuenca), labora de 6 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. solo tres días a la semana y el resto de días se dedica a su hogar pero ya se encuentra en la posibilidad de trabajar todos los días.

Elourdes es oriunda de la provincia del Guayas se encuentra cuatro años en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 35 años  casada hace varios años  y ha concebido tres  hijos quienes se encuentran de 20, 19 y 6 años, sus dos primeros hijos pasan en casa y  su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuela de la urbe, su esposo es comerciante de pollos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el dinero que reciba del nuevo préstamo va a  comprar  diademas, moños, vinchas, aretes y mas bisutería para su negocio. Su sueño es de llegar a comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Elourdes Z. is a member of the "Sol Naciente" ("Rising Sun") communal bank. She lives in the urban area of the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay province. The city lies in the central valley of the Ecuadorian Andes; it is Ecuador's third leading city and is well-known for maintaining the beauty and tranquility of an older city. Its historic center was declared a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site in 1999. Elourdes works selling costume jewelry from her own stand in the open market (Cuenca Market). She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., only three days a week, and on the other days she dedicates herself to her household tasks. However, she is considering the possibility of working every day. Elourdes is a native of Guayas province who has lived in Cuenca for four years. She is 35 years old and has been married for some years. She has three children who are now aged 20, 19 and 6. Her two older children stay at home, and her youngest child goes to school in the city. Her husband works selling chickens. They do not have their own house, so they live in rented quarters. She is currently in her third loan cycle, and the loans have benefited her business. With the funds she receives from the new loan, she will buy diadems, bows, headbands, earrings and more costume jewelry for her business. Her dream is to be able to buy herself a car.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying diadems, bows, headbands, earrings and more costume jewelry to stock her business

loans.name: Fe Estacoja's Group

texts.en:
Fe E., from the village of Tubod, Aloran Misamis Occidental, is the 35-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fe E.'s Group.

Fe , who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2005, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from PMPC, Fe is requesting a new loan, her 12th, of 14999 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: El Hadj

texts.fr: Monsieur EL Hadj V. est un yoffois  de 37 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Mbenguene. Il est marie et père d’un enfant d’un an. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis seulement février  2010. Monsieur V. s’adonne à la vente de chapelets depuis 1999. Mais depuis 2009 il cumule son activité  avec le métier  de gardiennage dans  une école du quartier. C’est son marabout qui l’a ordonne  de  choisir la vente de chapelets comme activité  après qu’il ait termine  l’apprentissage  a faire des chapelets. Il sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de fils de différentes couleurs et de perles pour augmenter son stock de chapelets et diversifier son offre a la clientèle. Son objectif reste d’augmenter ses profits afin d’d’aider son père et son frère a gérer  le quotidien. Il souhaite aussi assister sa famille sur le plan sanitaire et nutritionnel.
texts.en:
Mr El Hadj V. is a 37 year-old resident of Mbenguene, Yoff. He is married and has a one year-old child and has only been a member of the Yoff credit association since February 2010. Mr V. has sold rosaries for a living since 1999; but in 2009 he accompanied this activity by becoming a caretaker at a local school. His holy teacher suggested he choose this business activity once he had finished his rosary-making apprenticeship. He is seeking a 50 000 FRS loan to purchase different colour thread and beads in order to enlarge his inventory of rosaries and widen the choice for his customers. His aim is to increase his profits in order to help his father and brother to meet everyday costs and to help with his family's health and nutritional needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: boost stock levels

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca tiene como actividad la venta de pan y de productos de primera necesidad, por mas de 10 años en la zona de El Tejar lugar comercial que queda a dos cuadras del cementerio de la ciudad de La Paz, la comercializacion de pan es su unica fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia ya que con esta actividad pudo brindarles una educacion buena a sus hijos.
El destino del credito  es para ayudar a uno de su hijo con la apertura y equipamiento (muebles y mercaderia)de una tienda en la casa donde el vive, de esta manera la Sra. continua ayudando a su familia en este nuevo emprendimiento, es una señora trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Blanca has been selling bread and basic needs products for over ten years. She sells in the El Tejar area. This is a commercial place, which is located two blocks from the cemetery in the city of La Paz. Selling bread is the only source of income for her and her family. Through this activity she was able to give her children a good education. The loan is to help one of her children open and equip (furniture and merchandise) a store in their house. That way she will continue helping her family with this new enterprise. She is a hard-working woman, and she is always thinking of her family’s well-being. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a neighborhood store and buy merchandise

loans.name: Saven

texts.en: Mrs. Saven V., 48 years old, lives in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. She is a cake seller while her husband, Mr. Mao Sam, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables. Mrs. Saven V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her husband's farming. Besides working on his own farm, Mr. Mao Sam is a farm laborer so that he can receive a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children, who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
En la foto se encuentra María U., Ana María C., Dielka T. y Consuelo Gaitán. La foto de rostro es de Alba G..   

El grupo las Azucenas lo integran cinco integrantes féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y  con iniciativa una de ellas es María del Socorro U. C., coordinadora del grupo. Esta joven de 23 años inicio vendiendo tortillas bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses hoy en día comercializa carne y hueso.

Sus compañeras de grupo son la señora Consuelo Gaitán de 52 años quien tiene una tortillería desde hace dos años,  Dielka María T.  quien tiene una panadería y tortillería, Ana María C. quien también se gana el sustento se cada día realizando tortillas bastimento de preferencia en los hogares nicaragüenses y  Alba Lidia G. Gaitán de 25 años tiene dos años de vender comida en la zona franca de Masaya.

Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios para seguir creciendo y ampliar sus negocios. Además están muy agradecidas por las oportunidades de crédito y capacitación que Adim les brinda las cuales les parecen excelentes ya que así pueden administrar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
In the photo are María U., Ana María C., Dielka T. and Consuelo Gaitán. The faceshot is of Alba G.. The Azucenas group is made up of five entrepreneurial female workers with initiative. One of them is María del Socorro U. C., the group coordinator. This 23-year-old youth began selling tortillas, a Nicaraguan staple. Today she sells meat and bones. The other group members are 52-year-old Consuelo Gaitán who has had a tortilla shop for the last two years, Dielka María T. who has a bakery and a tortilla shop, Ana María C. who also earns her daily bread making tortillas (the preferred staple of Nicaraguan homes) and 25-year-old Alba Lidia G. Gaitán who has been selling food for two years in the free-trade zone of Masaya. They will invest the loan in their respective businesses in order to continue growing and expanding them. In addition, they are very thankful for the loan opportunities and capacity building that Adim provides them, which they find excellent, since they allow them to better administer their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Meat and bones

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Batdorj S. is 39 years old and  lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia.  He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children attend a local middle school while his wife is a homemaker. 

Batdorj owns and operates his own wooden product business, specializing in 'ger' parts, 'ger' furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. His business is quite family-oriented as he operates his business with the help of his brother. He started his business in 2005. Most of his profit come from the sales of his larger-sized furniture which are sold at prices between 40000 to 150000 MNT. All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider. 

Batdorj would like to expand his sales so that he can increase his working capital.  He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood so that he can increase the number and variety of large furniture pieces that he can sell.

loans.use: purchase wood for his business

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat R. is 47 years old. She is married and has a daughter. For more than 20 years, Saodat has had her own business. She embroiders the national skull-cap for men and women. Saodat produces various types of the national skull-cap, so she has many clients and usually there are many orders. Her daughter helps her with the business. Saodat sells the skull-caps to her own customers, who are always in expectation of the new goods. Thus her business is stable, allowing Saodat to contribute significant income into the family budget. Today, Saodat requests 7500 Somoni. The loan is required for purchasing the fabrics for embroidering the national skull-cap. Saodat thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a being key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for embroidering the national skull-cap

loans.name: Almohada Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está formado por tres mujeres de la tercera década que se encuentran en su segundo ciclo de créditos con ADIM, Nora B. quien es la coordinadora del grupo se dedica a la venta de panes y reposterías que ella misma elabora con ayuda de sus hijos desde hace un año. A pesar que ella alquila el horno en el que elabora sus productos ella invertirá el crédito en compra de materiales para poder crecer más en el negocio antes de construir ella su propio horno.

Daxnia Leticia H. H. quien es otra de las miembros se dedica a la venta de algunos abarrotes  y frijoles cocidos, por otro lado Lesbia Raquel Dávila A. comercializa productos cosméticos, perfumerías y utensilios del hogar de la compañía AVON. Ambas también invertirán el crédito en la compra de productos para la venta.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women and they are on their second loan cycle with ADIM (Kiva Field Partner). Nora Boltadano is the coordinator of the group and she sells fresh breads and pastries that she makes with the help of her children. She has been running this business for the past year. Eventhough she rents the oven where she bakes her goods she will invest the loan in the purchase of materials to improve her business, before installing her own oven. Daxnia Leticia Hildago H. is another member and she sells varied grocery items and prepared beans. Lesbia Raquel D. A. sells beauty products, perfumes and kitchenwares of the Avon name brand. They will both invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to expand the business.

loans.name: G. S. Fraternidad Group

texts.es: El señor José Antonio tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero y tiene tres hijos de entre 8 y 18 años de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales distribuye en el mercado. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, para ofrecer más inventario en el mercado, con la esperanza de obtener más ganancias.  Otro integrante del grupo es Doña Sebastiana Del Carmen,  tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de Managua, en venta de ropa y zapatos. Su actividad es la venta de carne, sea de res, cerdo o pollo, cabe señalarse este negocio está localizado en su casa de habitación.  Otra integrante del grupo es Doña Maribel Del Socorro, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras, los cuales distribuye en el mercado Ella empezó este negocio con recursos propios y principalmente con la ayuda de su mama que fue la que le brindo apoyo cuidando a sus hijos. Hoy en día, lo que más le afecta es el alto costo del transporte, tanto para movilizarse ella como para movilizar la mercadería.
texts.en:
José Antonio, 42, is single and has three children between the ages of 8 and 18. He sells fruits and vegetables in the market. He is asking for the loan to buy fruits and vegetables in order to have more inventory available to offer thus increasing profits. Another member of the group is Sebastiana del Carmen, 49. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a merchant in Managua’s market; he sells clothing and shoes. She sells meat be it beef, pork or chicken. It’s worth mentioning that her business is located in her home. Another group member is Maribel del Socorro, 26. She is a single mother of three minor children. She is a fruit and vegetable merchant in the market. She started her business with her own capital and with help from her mother who cared for her children. Today, what most affects her is the high transportation costs both to move her and to move her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”, ubicado en el centro poblado D. Mataro Chico del distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja,  provincia D. Azángaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 67 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos (independientes), la señora estudió hasta 1ro D. educación primaria.

La señora Rosa esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  le permitirá  incrementar el capital D.  su negocio D. compra y venta D. animales menores como avino y chanchos.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo crédito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar  más animales para luego venderlos, también nos cuenta que venD. productos lácteos como leche.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar los animales y  hacer otros productos como quinua cebada y avena.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones  y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the community bank "Mataro Chico", located in downtown Mataro Chico in the district of Santiago D. Pupuja, Azangaro Puno. She is 67 years old, she is married, and she has 3 grown children. She has a graD. 1 education. Rosa has been a member of the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for the past 4 months. She had previously requested a loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. This loan supplemented her business' capital funds, to buy and sell small farm animals, such as chickens and pigs. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of more livestock for future resale. She also sells dairy products. Her dream for the future is to improve her livestock and to make traditional food products such as oatmeal. She most enjoys the gatherings in her community bank, as well as the proceedings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small farm animals.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor de María tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en el sector Los Peches del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega situada en su propio domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de productos de uso diario al contado y al crédito. El negocio es de mucha utilidad para sus clientes debido a que les facilita el acceso a diversos productos por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el pueblo principal para adquirirlos.

Flor de María se vale de este negocio para ayudar a su esposo, que trabaja como jornalero en los campos agrícolas de la zona,  con el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia. Actualmente ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que sus ventas puedan expandirse y pueda conseguir un mayor numero de ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que dia a dia da lomejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Flor de María, 42, is married and lives with her husband and one of her children in Los Peches, Mochumí district, a farming area in Lambayeque province, located over half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She has a home-based store where she sells basic needs items and groceries. She sells her items both for cash and on credit. The business is very useful for her customers because she gives them easy access to various products that they would otherwise have to go all the way into the main town to get. Flor de María uses the business to help her husband, who works as a day laborer in the area’s farm fields, support the family. She wants to expand the business buying more products so that her sales will increase thus leading to higher profits. To reach her goal she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. She is quite a hard working woman who daily gives her best to have her family succeed. People who know her consider her to be a responsible and calm person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic need items and groceries to stock her home-based store.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel M. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 37 years old. Raquel is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting peanuts and a variety of vegetables for sale. Raquel has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Raquel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Raquel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Elena is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish like milkfish, sardines and mackerel in the local community. She decided to change her business from making snacks and other delicacies because she finds the new business more profitable. Elena is just starting this business.

In 2008, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2008 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw ingredients for the business. Elena is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mr. Phally S., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Born, 39, have been married since 1989 and have six children. The family lives along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phally and his wife, both farmers, grow cauliflower, green beans and bitter gourds but do not have enough capital to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their farm. Phally is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200 to make these purchases.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Miss. Huoy Chhuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Miss Huoy C., who was born in 1987, is the village bank president selected by the 13 people who comprise this village bank loan. All residents of Trong Phum village in Takeo Province, the members will use their portion of the loan to improve their family living conditions.

Huoy, who is single in a five-member household, owns a two-hectare plot of land upon which she grows rice to sell to support her family; she is also a pig breeder. Huoy is requesting a loan in order to improve the yield of her rice field.

loans.use: To increase yield of her rice field

loans.name: Jospine Minayo

texts.en:
Jospine Minayo L. is 37 years old. She is married to Johana Mugavale who is employed and provides additional income for the family. They have five school-going children. The family lives in Eldoret, Kenya. Jospine sells charcoal and has a charcoal store. She has been in this business for eight years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs.5,000.

Jospine learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area. She is applying for her first loan of Kshs. 20,000 from KADET LTD, She intends to buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers during this festive season when the demand is very high. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her  business.

In the future, she wishes to start poultry farming since both businesses have proven to be very profitable in the area. Her deeper desire is to see her children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Rovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Rovelyn U., from the town of Eastern Pob.Lopez Jaena, is 31 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of her fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

A married mother of one school-aged child, Rovelyn owns and operates a fishing business harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 900 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting her second loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Rovelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Silvia Indaura

texts.es:
Silvia Indaura C. B. tiene 31 años, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 9 años. Ella vive con sus hijos en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Silvia Inalvra es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.  

Silvia Inalvra tiene su negocio de sembrio de yuca y cría de pollo desde hace 1 año. Ella compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther. Ella solicita este crédito para ampliar su negocio y para mejorar el servicio.

Sus metas para el futuro son tener su casa propia y su negocio propio con que pueda salir adelante. Los desafíos que ella enfrenta son pequeños problemas de salud y la época de invierno cuando no hay cosechas. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar indoor, bailar y cantar. También disfruta salir a la fiesta del pueblo que se celebra cada 8 de diciembre.
texts.en:
Silvia Indaura C. B. is 31 years old.  She is a widow and has 3 children aged 14, 11, 9.  She lives with her children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Silvia is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new loan group is located in Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office, in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in a number of different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Silvia has a business growing cassava and raising chickens.  She has had her business for one year.  She buys and sells her products in Matilde Esther.  Silvia is requesting this loan to expand her business and improve her service.  Her goals for the future are to own her own home and business with which she can get ahead in life.  The challenges that she faces are small health problems and the winter season when there are no harvests.  In her spare time she likes to play indoor soccer, to dance and to sing.  She enjoys celebrating the local fiesta which takes place every 8th of December.

loans.use: To expand her business and improve her service

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en: Adolf would like a loan to purchase general merchandise such as maize, beans and millet to resell. He runs a retail shop. He is a married man with ten children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a residential house and educating his children. His business dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans & millet to resell

loans.name: Dailinda

texts.en:
Dailinda T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 46 years old. Dailinda is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Dailinda owns and operates a fish business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and reselling assorted fish. 

Dailinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dailinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es: El sr. Abrahán vive en el barrio Sausalito de la zona norte en casa propia, con su esposa. El se dedica a la jardinería, trabaja con los condominios que hay en la zona donde vive. Tiene un ayudante que trabaja medio tiempo por 15 días. El crédito que esta solicitando es para terminar de construir dos cuartos para darlos en alquiler, el sr. Abrahán es una persona trabajadora, honesta y de una gran responsabilidad con su trabajo, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Abrahán lives to the north in the neighborhood of Sausalito. He lives in his own home with his wife. Abrahán works as a gardener and performs landscaping for the condominiums that are in the area where he lives. He has a part-time assistant who works for him for fifteen days.

The loan he is requesting will be used to finish the construction of four rooms for rent. Sr. Abrahán is a hardworking and honest man who demonstrates great responsibility in his work. He is grateful to Emprender for the support being provided.

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish the construction of four rental rooms

loans.name: Samet

texts.en:
Mr. Samet S. and his wife, Mrs. Ratana Kheav, are both 30 years old (pictured here together). They live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2008 and have one young son.  

Mr. Samet S. is a policeman, while is wife produces Bay Sey*. She hopes to supplement their income with a new business of selling groceries, but she does not have the needed capital. So, Samet is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to help his wife purchase grocery items and build a grocery store. 

*Bay Sey is a section of banana tree trunk with legs, to which 3, 5, 7, or 9 layers of banana leaves rolled up in finger shapes have been attached. This is decorated with flowers and used in certain ceremonies.

loans.use: To help his wife's new business of selling groceries.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida P. lives with her husband and two children in Meghri – a very southern city of Armenia. Aida is the only breadwinner in her family. For 15 years Aida has run a gift shop, and her husband used to help Aida a lot before getting ill. It took long years and lots of hard effort to get the shop premises. To be able to continue her business, it is vital for Aida to get a loan to purchase wedding accessories and gifts to sell. The loan will help Aida attract more customers, make more income to cover her family costs, and bring sustainability to her children.

loans.use: to purchase wedding accessories and gifts to sell to customers.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 25-year-old single man and works in a cellular shop. He lives in Beirut. He is very attentive to his customers and is en expert in his domain. 

This is his fourth loan and he reports that the previous loans allowed him to improve his financial and social situation. He requests a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy more recharge cards and mobile phones. In the future, he wishes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy recharge cards and mobile phones.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria tiene 47 años de edad. Es soltera y tiene hijos adultos e independientes. Vive en casa propia que ha ido arreglando de a pocos en el distrito de Ferreñafe en el norte de Perú.  Se dedica a la venta de especerías y condimentos  en el mercado central de Ferreñafe.  Tiene una experiencia de más de 05 años en el negocio. Trabaja todos los días en el mercado y cuenta con una clientela fiel y establecida. Desea aumentar su mercadería y comprar más especias para vender. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Espera usar sus ingresos para seguir arreglando y mejorando su casa.
texts.en: Maria is 47 years old. She is single and has adult children. She lives in her own home, which she has gradually been fixing up, in the district of Ferrenafe in the north of Peru. She works selling spices and condiments in the central market of Ferrenafe. She has more than 5 years experience in this business. She works in the market every day and has a loyal and established clientele. She wants to increase her supplies and buy more spices to sell. For this reason, she has seen fit to request a loan of $550 from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). She hopes to use her income to keep fixing-up and improving her house.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of spices and condiments to sell

loans.name: Wanjiku

texts.en: Wanjiku is a 70-year-old member of Faulu Kenya. She is married and has seven children.  She does farming to earn a living.  She has been farming for 10 years. She was previously growing vegetables to earn a living.  She previously took a loan, which she used to buy pigs.  She has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, which she will use to buy a dairy cow.  She hopes to find other markets so as to sell her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Faïssatou

texts.fr: Faïssatou est née le 30 Juin 1965 à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, Faïssatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à PK12, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Il y a près de cinq ans que Faïssatou et son mari vivent dans ce quartier. Faïssatou vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Faïssatou mène comme activité la vente de pur water, de boissons, des bijoux et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire. Faïssatou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Faïssatou sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, crédit qui lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Faïssatou was born on 30th June 1965 in Ekpè in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. She is married and mother to four children, all of whom are at school. Faïssatou lives with her husband and children in PK12, also in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. They have lived in this district for almost five years. Faïssatou helps her husband with the various family expenses. For the past ten years, she has had a business selling pure water, other drinks, jewelry and, as a secondary activity, telephone recharge cards. Faïssatou gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. It is the first time she has requested a loan from Alidé and this loan will be used to expand her business and better satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy drinks and jewelry

loans.name: Watty

texts.en:
Watty is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children in Cilincing, Jakarta, Indonesia.

Every day, she sells nasi uduk to get income. Nasi uduk is a rice with a unique flavor.

She requested 10,000,000 Indonesian rupiah to buy rice to produce more nasi uduk than she usually does. The income that she makes is used to pay their children's school fees. She also hopes she can send her husband to be a laborer in Brunei so that he can help their family to create more income and it can be used to send their children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce nasi uduk

loans.name: Mireya Yancarla

texts.es: La señora Mireya dedicada al servicio de transcripciones en computadora, realiza este trabajo durante el día y algunos veces por la noche ya que en cualquier momento los estudiantes la visitan para pedirle sus servicios de transcripción e investigación, por el momento ella solo cuenta con una sola maquina, el deseo de la clienta es hacer crecer su negocio abriendo una librería tienda para así tener un poco mas de ingresos, sin embargo con las ganancia que obtiene ella realizando este servicio ayuda mucho con los gastos en su hogar, de esta manera solicito el crédito para poder abrir una pequeña librería y ahí poder también ofrecer sus servicios de transcriptora, es un apersona joven y muy amable, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que ella quiere emprender con este negocio.
texts.en:
Mireya provides computer transcription services. She works during the day and sometimes at night because students come to her at all hours asking for her transcription and research services. Right now she only has one computer. She wants to grow her business by opening a book store so that she can have some more income. The money that she makes right now helps a lot with the costs of her home. 

She asked for a loan to be able to open a small bookstore and to offer her transcription services there. She is young and very friendly, and is grateful to the institution for the support that it has given her in starting this new business.

loans.use: to start a book store.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Esi sells tubers of yams (as shown in the picture) in Abura, which she has done for six years. She also makes banku, which is made from maize. She is showing the corn dough she uses for the banku in her right hand. Esi uses her income to support her partner in the education of her children. The loan, when received, will be added to her initial capital for the sale of yams. Esi plans to plow the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: to add to her initial capital for the sale of yams.

loans.name: Noupagagnon Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  TAMBA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide et le pois sucré avec NADIARA 2ème accroupie à gauche de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 0.5hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 12.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Noupagagnon IV group are all married women who are on average 36 years old with three children.  They mostly live in polygamous families in Tamba, one of the villages in the Nantien commune in the Sikasso municipality, the third largest region in the Republic of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance collective in order to boost their agricultural activities during the off-season. 
They are on their fifth loan with the organisation, and all previous loans have been repaid. 
The women, led by Nadiara (the second person kneeling on the left in the photo) cultivate peanuts and sweet peas. With this loan, she aims to pay for labour costs, and to purchase fertilisers etc and seeds for a 0.5 hectare plot of land. 
After harvesting, the crops are sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a customer base made up of men and women. Nadiara aims to generate an average monthly profit of 12,500 FCFA. 
This profit will enable her to repay her loan as well as supporting her husband with the family's everyday needs. She wishes to maintain this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso so that she can make the most of her plot of land, and generate greater profits from it.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and to purchase agricultural inputs (eg fertilisers) and seeds

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. He has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years.

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, candies and breads. Gilbert is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies and breads.

loans.name: Modelo Group

texts.es: María del Carmen, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Modelo, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, y reside en Barrio Belén. Desde hace tres años atrás María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, una de sus nueras la ayuda a trabajar, y lo hacen desde las 3 am hasta las 12 del mediodía. De vez en cuando cuenta con la ayuda económica de algunos de sus hijos, pero es muy poco, ya que la vivienda donde reside es rentada y el alquiler es caro, y parte su hijo menor aún está estudiando. Su ventaja es que las tortillas son un producto que las personas consumen a diario varias veces al día, así que le va muy bien con las ventas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de leña, maíz, cal y maseca. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han ayudado mucho porque ha podido para sacar adelante su familia. Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia para poder ampliar su negocio y vivir mejor. Su compañera de grupo Enma Neptalia se dedica a la venta de joyas y plata. Es este es el quinto ciclo de María y no ha tenido problemas de mora, ya que ahorra a diario para pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en: María del Carmen is a member of the communal bank "Modelo."  She is 50 years old, and is a single mother of 5 who resides in the Belen neighborhood.  For 5 years, Maria has been making and selling tortillas.  One of her daughter-in-laws taught her how to do this.  She works from 3am until noon.  At times she relies on the economic assistance of some of her children, but this is a small help, because the home where she lives is rented and the rent is very high, and her youngest child is still in school.  Her advantage is that tortillas are a product that people consume a number of times each day, and so her sales are going very well.  The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of firewood, corn, limes and corn flour.  The loans that she has received have helped her a lot because she has been able to provide for her family.  Her main dream is to have her own house so that she could expand her business and live better.  Her fellow group member, Enma Neptalia, has a business selling jewelry and silver.  This is Maria's 5th loan cycle, and she has not had problems with late payments, since she saves on a daily basis to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, limes and corn flour

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion, age 44, has a dressmaking business and earns approximately PHP 7,900 each month from her work.  She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 in order to purchase cloth for use in her dressmaking business.

Salvacion and her husband have five children and live in Pangi, Siquijor, Siquijor. In the future, Salvacion hopes to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for use in her dressmaking business

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.en:
Amadeo Jr., a 48-year-old hardworking father of six children, has been a farmer for almost 28 years. He plants rice and vegetables for sale, and usually earns a profit of P30,000 in every harvest season, utilizing his income for food, clothing and allowances for their children. Despite some financial instablity, Amadeo intends to continue sending all of their children to school.

Amadeo also operates a hog-raising business to earn additional income. Due to inadequate capital, he is now requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that the loan will help him to improve the business as long as he continue to strive. He hopes that his patience and sacrifices will bear fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Merry Riza

texts.en:
Merry Riza has a livestock business. In particular, she raises pigs. According to her, she has raised three fattening pigs and two sows. She has been in this line of business for seven months. She is thankful because she is able to maintain her business even though her husband is far from them due to his work as a security guard. Her mom taught her the business, and she was able to set up her own livestock business based at their home.

Merry Riza's child is still an infant, which is a great cost in her household expenses. For this reason, she would like to ask for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase a stock of feed for her livestock business. Through the business she manages, she could be able to sustain their daily needs and save some amount to prepare for the schooling of her child. She is hoping that she can improve their standard of living through the profits she generates from her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Martha Carina

texts.es:
Carina tiene 33 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora. Ella vive en la zona de Esquilan Chico de la provincia de Quillacollo, genera sus ingresos de la venta de leche que obtiene de sus vacas, ordeña sus vacas 2 veces al dia de forma manual a las 5 de la mañana y a las 7 de la noche. 
Carina vive  con su familia, necesita el préstamo para acceder junto a 15 compañeros de su zona, a la compra de un tanque de enfriamiento para la leche y de esta manera puedan conservar mayor tiempo el producto y no entren en perdida lo que afectaría gravemente a la economía de sus familias debido a que dependen casi exclusivamente de la venta de leche cruda de buena calidad. Ella está muy agradecida con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de hacer realidad su sueño.

Carina entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para comprar más vaquitas.

Para compra conjunta, de un tanque de enfriamiento  para acopio de leche, que tiene un costo de $16000 al cual estan aportando 16 vecinos con 1000
texts.en:
Carina, 33, is a hard-working person.  She lives in the Esquilan Chico area in the province of Quillacollo.  She generates her income by selling milk that she obtains from her cows.  She milks her cows manually twice a day, at 5 in the morning and 7 in the evening.
 
Carina lives with her family.  She needs the loan to buy a refrigeration tank for the milk along with 15 friends from her area.  In this way they will be able to keep the product longer and not suffer any losses, which would seriously affect the economy of their families, since they depend almost exclusively on the sale of good-quality raw milk.

She is very grateful to the people who managed through Kiva to give her the chance to make her dream come true.

Among her plans for the future Carina plans to take out a new loan to buy more cows.

The joint purchase of a refrigeration tank for storing milk has a cost of $16,000, to which each of the 16 neighbors is contributing $1,000.

loans.use: to pay for the joint purchase of a refrigeration tank for storing milk.

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Angelina es soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la tejeduría y al comercio ya que tiene una tienda de consumo diario, lleva 1 años de experiencia, inició su negocio con pocos productos.

Solicita un préstamo para compra de productos para la venta: aguas gaseosas, galletas, dulces, jugos y mas, espera en el futuro tener mas producto para la venta.
texts.en: María Angelina is single and 23 years old.  She never went to school.  She’s a weaver and merchant.   She has a grocery store and one year experience having started her store with just a few products.  She’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise to sell: water, soft-drinks, cookies, candy, juice and more.  She hopes in future to have more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 29 years old, is a worker, earning $1.60 per day. She has two children: one works, earning $2 per day and one stays home. Each month, Channy spends $40 on food and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $300 to pay for the electricity service in her house. This loan will help her family to have electricity to use at home. When she can save enough money, Channy wants to repair her house.

loans.use: To pay for electricity

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Riza is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Riza has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell.

Riza has been in this business for 10 years. Riza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Felicidad es una persona muy joven ella vive en la  comunidad de la provincia Mizque del departamento  de Cochabamba, felicidad desde muy pequeña quedo sola su madre y su pequeña hermanita fallecieron en un accidente de movilidad su padre le dio una pequeña parcela de terreno agrícola para que ella haga trabajar  donde ella empezó a trabajar en la agricultura con sus vecinos en el  lugar donde vive  ahí fue donde ha aprendiendo a cultivar tomate y cebolla en el tiempo que creció.
En el lugar donde vive solo cosechan dos veces al año con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y con el  crédito que está solicitando ella desea invertir más en sus cultivos comprando abono orgánico  y productos para recuperar algo de lo perdido de su anterior cosecha que fueron por motivo de sequia  y de esta manera mejorar su  calidad de vida y ayudarles a sus hermanos menores.
texts.en: Felicidad is a very young person who lives in a community in Mizque province, in Cochabamba department.  Felicidad was left alone when she was very young as her mother and her little sister died in a traffic accident.  Her father gave her a small plot of farmland to work.  She started farming with her neighbors in her community.  This is where she learned to grow tomatoes and onions as she grew up.  Where Felicidad lives, crops are only harvested twice a year.  Through her hard work and the loan that she is requesting, Felicidad would like to invest more in her crops, buying organic fertilizer and other products so that she can recover some of what she lost in her previous harvest as a result of a drought.  In this way, she will improve her quality of life and help her younger siblings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies for sowing her crops

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (shown in the photo) is 34 years old, and her husband, Tha, is 41 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have three sons. One is in school and others are still young. The family lives in a village about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Chanthy grows small mango trees and sells them from her home. Her husband is an auto repairman. He does not have his own shop, so he is hired for a fee. Chanthy is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Elena De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 10 años inicio su negocio con un balde de fresco actualmente tiene una refresquería con buenas condiciones; además comercializa cosméticos. Ella tiene dos hijos de 15 y 10 años quienes le ayudan en el negocio junto con su madre.
Elena con este crédito comprará ropa por la temporada de diciembre y su meta es crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking and enterprising lady who started her soft drink business with a single bucket ten years ago.  Now she has a well-kept refreshment stall and also sells cosmetics.  She has two children, ages 15 and 10, who help her in the business, along with her mother.

She will use the money from this store to buy seasonal clothing for December.  Her goal is to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 49 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two children. Josephine works in the fish industry, catching and selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fresh fish to sell. Josephine became a member of PMPC in 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Santos Ernesto

texts.es:
Santos, de 34 años de edad, casado,tiene 2 hijos, de oficio agricultor, su educación es básica solo finalizo el sexto grado de la primaria, vive en la comunidad El  Coyolito localizado en Jinotega. Inicialmente comenzó trabajando con su hermano y su papa entre los tres unieron capital para sembrar pero hace dos años se independizo de ellos y ahora trabaja por su cuenta. El viaja hasta el mercado local de la ciudad de Estelí para vender chiltomas, cebollas, tomates que le mismo siembra. 
El solicito el crédito para sembrar chiltoma y cebolla. Pues el crédito le ayudara a compara insumos y pagar mano de obra que necesita para establecer su cosecha de la cual espera le produzca hortalizas de muy buena calidad. Aunque el terreno en el que siembra lo alquila el no pierde la esperanza de tener sus propias áreas de siembra para generar empleos en su comunidad y salir adelante para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos, age 34, is married and has two children.  He is a farmer by trade, and he has an elementary school education as he only finished the sixth grade.  He lives in the El Coyolito community in Jinotega.

At first he started working with his brother and his father.  The three of them put their money together in order to plant.  Two years ago he became independent of them, and he now works on his own.  He travels to the local market in the city of Estelí in order to sell the bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes that he grows.

He requested the loan to plant bell peppers and onions.  The loan will help him buy supplies and to pay for the labor that he needs for his harvest.  He hopes that the harvest produces very good quality vegetables.

Even though he rents the land where he plants, he does not lose the hope of having his own land to farm.  This would generate employment in his community, and he would get ahead in order to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to plant bell peppers and onions.

loans.name: Beata

texts.en:
With her husband’s many years of rope-climbing experience and techniques for dealing with heights, Beata, 40, decided to take his talents and create a wind turbine cleaning service in Savannah, Texas.

Originally from Poland, Beata and her family moved to Texas in June of 2011. She began planning her new business three years ago, but only recently was able to launch it with the help of an Accion Texas loan. Her company, "Beata S. Climbex", currently only employs her husband and herself, but she hopes to create more jobs in the future. 

Beata and her husband’s past experience working with ropes inspired Beata to enter the wind energy industry, but the necessity of finding a job in a new country led her to take action in creating the business. She says, “I wanted to utilize the skills we possess and be able to make a decent living.”

In her business, Beata says she is attempting to "go green" by using environmentally-friendly products to clean wind blades with steam. She says it would have been far more difficult to start her company without Accion Texas, which she discovered through an Internet search. With her approved loan in hand, Beata was able to pay for start-up costs and insurance.

loans.use: to pay for insurance and working capital.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid lives in Sis village. He is a farmer with 12 years of experience. The farm that Majid currently owns consists of 5 cows and calves.  He also owns a plot of land where he cultivates potatoes, onions and greens. Majid sells the gathered harvest in the nearby market and gathers income, which is vital for his big family. 

Majid's family consists of his wife, his daughter, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. The whole family helps Majid to gather a good agricultural harvest. Since that's the only source of their income, they work hard to be able to cover basic daily costs. Majid has now applied for the loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase more calves and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan will expand his livestock and he will be able to get more agricultural income.  Majid and his family hope for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for calves and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama San Cayetano 2 es un grupo sólido, conformado por 18 mujeres, se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo, todas tienen un objetivo en común, que es la de salir adelante siempre junto con sus familias, son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona eminentemente rural, que está luchando por mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes de este comité es la señora Estela, es muy activa, y es ella quien esta encabezando este grupo, es dueña de una despensa, donde ofrece productos variados de necesidades básicas del hogar, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumo varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, verduras, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y ayudar a su familia.
