Así como la Sra Estela, sus demás compañeras trabajan con el mismo entusiasmo y agradecen esta oportunidad que se les brinda.
texts.en:
This group is called San Cayetano 2. It is a solid group that is composed of 18 women and is currently in its fourth cycle. All of them have a common objective, which is to always move forward with their families. They are from the city of Santani, an area that is predominantly rural and that is fighting to improve every day.

One of the members of this group is Estela. She is very active, and she is the person that leads this group. She is the owner of a general store, where she offers a multitude of products that meet basic household needs. She is requesting a loan to buy varied supplies for her store such as fruits, vegetables, and other things in order to continue her work and help her family. 

Like Estela, the other group members work with the same enthusiasm and give thanks for this opportunity that they have received.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Jesuwame Group

texts.fr: JESUWAME est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Honoré(celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgé de 50 ans. Honoré n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Honoré est marié à un revendeuse du nom de Elisabeth. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains scolarisés et quatre à leur charge. Honoré vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Honoré mène comme activité la pêche et vend également des filet depuis une trentaine d'année. Honoré vend également des poissons frais de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Honoré s’approvisionne dans un lac de sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Honoré sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUWAME, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des moteur à barque et des filets.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y para eventos prepara una pequeña venta de comida rápida y bebidas hidratantes, en su casa solo vive con su pareja y 2 hijastras, una de ellas trabaja y la otra estudia segundo grado.

Wilfredo, puede hacer trabajos de albañilería y también se dedica a la agricultura de subsistencia, junto a su esposa preparan la venta y de esta forma disponer de un ingreso a través de su pequeño negocio, para estas actividades se involucran sus hijastras, de tal forma que todos juntos buscan la manera más convenientes para impulsar el desarrollo de su hogar.

Wilfredo, necesita el préstamo para comprar bebidas, energizantes, bebidas hidratantes, galletas, jugos, entre otros productos y para comprar una hielera para mantener frescas las bebidas e implementar el negocio y tener la posibilidad de vender formalmente y obtener ingresos económicos para solventar muchos gastos familiares.

Wilfredo, sueña con ayudar a sus hijastras para que tengan acceso a la educación, comenta que es necesario mejorar la vivienda.

loans.use: para comprar bebidas, energizantes, bebidas hidratantes, galletas, jugos, entre otros productos y para comprar una hielera.

loans.name: Anani

texts.en:
Anani M. was born into a humble family in Tsévié in 1975. Despite his fragile health, he went to school and completed the 8th grade. Wanting very much to enter the real world, he learned how to be a tailor, a trade he currently practices. His wife, a colleague, makes baby hope chests. These parents have a child with a malformed leg. His wife is barely able to help with family expenses because she does not have enough customers to sell her goods quickly.

Mr. M. is requesting a loan of $850 as capital to buy two new machines for making different knots and bows and to add boutique items for sale that are unavailable in the area. The success of his plan will clearly allow him to earn a more substantial income in order to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur M. Anani est né en 1975 à Tsévié dans une famille modeste. Malgré sa santé fragile, il a fait les études jusqu’en classe de 4ème. Voulant très vite entrer dans la vie active, il a appris la couture, métier qu’il exerce actuellement. Marié à une collègue de trousseaux bébés, ils ont un enfant victime d’une malformation au niveau d’un membre inférieur. Sa femme l’aide à peine dans les dépenses familiales car elle ne dispose pas assez de clients pour l’écoulement rapide de sa production.

Monsieur M. Anani sollicite un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra d’acquérir deux nouvelles machines pouvant faire des différents nœuds et y associer les vents des articles de mercerie qui manquent dans le quartier. Il est évident qu’avec ce nouveau projet, Anani pour dégager des revenus plus consistants pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for making different knots and bows and to add boutique items for sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years old and married with five children. They are aged 14, 12, 10, 5 and 1. She is also supporting two relatives at high school and at the university.

Rita has knitting skills which she acquired from her in-laws in 1998. She would like to acquire a big knitting machine which can make 50 sweaters a day compared to a small one which makes 10 per day. The industrial knitting machine can make bed covers, baby clothes, and stockings and it is fast.

She would like to expand her business by diversifying the products and bid for big contracts in schools and institutions.

loans.use: To acquire a double-knitter machine

loans.name: Cécile

texts.en:
Cécile Y. was born in Aklakou in 1972. She is married and the mother of three. She is also the guardian of a boy in an apprenticeship who was left by her younger sister. Ms. Y. takes care of all these people by the fruits of her labor: cooking and selling rice, which has been her work for 9 years now. The stability of this business brings her a certain assurance which dispels all her worries. With pride in her business, she is requesting a loan of $600 in order to acquire rice, oil, and other necessities. She could thus meet the demands of her customers, and her family would then thrive.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née à Aklakou en 1972, Madame Y. Cécile est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi à sa charge un garçon en apprentissage, laissé par sa petite sœur. Madame Y. nourrit ce petit monde à partir du fruit de son travail : la préparation et la vente du riz. Cette activité, elle l’exerce depuis neuf ans déjà. La stabilité de ce commerce lui confère une assurance qui la met totalement à l’aise. Fière de ce commerce, Cécile sollicite un prêt de $600 afin de s’approvisionner en riz, en huile et autres nécessaires pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Par ce travail, elle pourra arriver à l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquiring rice, oil, and other necessities to meet customer demands

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a varied inventory of fruit for his micro-business

loans.name: Zoila Liliana

texts.es:
Zoila is 48 years old and has 3 children. She is part of a group pertaining to the communal bank Las Baguinas. She has a small shop where she sells various novelties and gifts, located in the principal market in La Peca, in Amazonas. She decided to start her business to improve the income of her household, and to do something important in her life. Her business is growing considerably, and now helps cover the needs of her family. Sometimes her children help her.

Her goal in the future is to grow her business much more, and continue to support her family. With the recent loan for Manuela Ramos of approximately $320.00, she will buy various products wholesale, such as gifts for different occasiones, as well as games for children, in the dozens and the hundreds, to have her store well stocked, and be able to satisfy her clients in her community as well as those farther away.

La señora Zoila tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Bagüinas, se dedica a la venta D. Pasamanería en su puesto ubicado en el mercado principal D. la localidad D. La Peca (Bagua Chica), Departamento D. Amazonas. Decidió iniciar su negocio para mejorar los ingresos del hogar y ser alguien importante en la vida. El negocio esta creciendo considerablemente, pues cubre las necesidades D. ella y su familia. Algunas veces sus hijos le ayudan, su meta en el futuro es hacer crecer mucho más el negocio y seguir dando apoyo a su familia. Con el crédito recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000.00 ($ 321.00 aprox.) comprará variados productos al por mayor como artículos para regalos para diversas ocasiones como cumpleaños, bodas, artículos para el peinado del cabello como peines, ganchos, carmines, como también juguetes para niños, todo esto por docenas y cientos, para tener la pasamanería bien abastecida, y así satisfacer a sus clientes D. la misma comunidad y D. los lugares aledaños.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Purchase various products wholesale for her store

loans.name: Bih

texts.en:
Bih M. is a widow and the mother of six children. Her husband died leaving neither money nor property for her and her children.

Faced with the difficulty of single-handedly providing for her children, she sought a loan from GHAPE. With a loan of $100 (40,000 FCFA), she plans to start cultivating and selling cassava, corn and ripe bananas, through which she will raise money to pay the school fees and apprentice fees for her children.

She believes she will succeed in repaying her loan because her children will help her sell the ripe bananas. She plans to repay the loan in 12 -15 months, with the first installment on the day the loan is received.

loans.use: Hire farm labor and buy corn seeds

loans.name: Zieviddin

texts.en: Zieviddin N. lives in Mastchoh; he is married and has 5 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007. He is a serious and strongly motivated borrower. He is eligible for an increased loan amount because of the stability of his business and its increasing profits. He breeds and sells livestock and operates a dairy. He would like to purchase a pedigreed bull for breeding purposes and a cow for the dairy.  He plans to expand the assortment of products he sells: pasteurized milk, buttermilk, sour cream, cottage cheese, and so on. He is asking for a loan of $700 to buy this livestock, which will allow him to expand his product line and increase the family's income.

loans.use: To buy a bull and a dairy cow

loans.name: Kabowa 1(D) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for nine months. Catherine is married and has three children. She earns a living by selling timber, and would like to expand her business by buying more material to sell to her customers. With the extra income she earns from increased sales, she intends to pay her rent and buy a saw. Ruth has a poultry business and wants to use the loan to buy chickenfeed. Aida intends to buy a juice blender. Aidah wants to use the loan to buy a hair dryer, and Carol would like to buy food warmers for her small food stand.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses by buying more equipment or materials

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is twenty-seven years old and the very proud mother of six children. She explains that four boys and two girls are hard to keep up with, but she is very proud that they are all in school. Her husband is a construction foreman and travels often.

Doris sells an assortment of kitchenware to the women in her community. Her products include pots and pans, bowls and plates, and other cookware. With her loan, Doris plans to boost her inventory and add fine crystal as well. Doris explains that supporting her children’s education is her most important goal for the future. Doris hopes to attend university herself some day and two of her children have already decided that they want to be professors!

loans.use: Purchase of new kitchenware and crystal for sale

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 22-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. Mohamad sells mobile phones.

This is the first time Mohamad has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy mobile phone refill cards. Mohamad is a very ambitious young man who is striving to develop his business.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone refill cards.

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Adita is a member of Las Azucenas (White Lillies) 2 Community Bank, which is located at Mz C Lt 13 in the Fernando Belaunde Ferry subdivision in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the state of Ucayali. She is 39 years old and has one child. Adita invested her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos in a small food store.

She currently gets up at 7:00 in the morning to make breakfast for her children. She then starts preparing food which she sells from 5:00-10:00 pm.

With this loan of 1,200 soles (approximately $450), which will be paid back in four months, Adita plans to purchase a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, chicken, beef, fish, vegetables and soft drinks.

Adita is very happy to have formed a solidarity group with her community bank, which always supports activities for strengthening ties of friendship and companionship.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

La señora Adita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Fernando Belaunde Ferry Mz C Lt 13, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 1 hijo. Adita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida.

En la actualidad se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para venderlos a partir de las 5 pm hasta las 10 pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, carnes de pollo, res, pescado, verduras, gaseosas.

Adita se siente muy feliz por que formo un grupo solidario con su banco comunal y siempre realizan actividades para fortalezar mas sus lazo de amistad y compañerismo

loans.use: Purchase of additional supplies for preparing food for sale

loans.name: Vanret

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanret D., 27, and her husband, Mr. Chhounvy Khim, were married in 2003. They have one daughter. Her husband has been a mechanic and mason since 2003. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Vanret has been a weaver since she was sixteen years old. It’s skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Domingo Asilo

texts.es:
Mr. Domingo lives in the municipality of La Concepcion in the community of Los Encuentros. He is a farmer dedicated to the production of pineapple. He is married, has 5 children, four of which are independent. His wife works at selling lottery tickets and helps him with the home expenses. His pineapple harvest is about to come out and that is why he is requesting a loan to acquire agricultural products and apply them to his harvest so that it is more fruitful. He wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so from the income that his production will bring.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Don Domingo habita en el municipo de La Concepción en la comunidad Los Encuentros. Es agricultor se dedica a la producción de piña. Es casado, tiene 5 hijos de los 4 ya son independientes a él. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de lotería y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Su cosecha de piña está por salir y por eso solicita el préstamo para adquirir insumos agrícolas y aplícárselo a su cosecha para que esta sea fructífera. Desea mejorar las condiciones de vida y espera poder hacerlos con ls ganancias que le dejen las ventas de su producción.

loans.use: Maintain his pinneaple harvest.

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es:
María is 54 years old, single and lives in the Hialeah II neighborhood. Her children no longer live at home. She has been working the penitentiary system in Modelo as head of her department for twenty years.

The loan she is requesting is for building materials to put a roof on a room that she has almost finished. Her goal is to completely finish the room she is building.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria tiene 54 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah II, es soltera y sus hijos son independientes. La Sra. Maria trabaja en el sistema penitenciario la Modelo desempeñándose como jefa de departamento, tiene veinte años laborando. El préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales para poner el techo de un cuarto que tiene ya casi terminado. Sus planes es poder terminar en un 100% el cuarto que está construyendo

loans.use:
Put a roof on a room in her house

Poner techo en una habitación de su vivienda

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: M. is a taxi driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car.  He is married, but his wife's income as a trader is not sufficient for Samuel and his 5 children. Demand for his service is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business."

loans.name: Eva Alicia

texts.es:
Eva inició el negocio porque su hijo sufrió un accidente al caerle agua hirviendo en su cuerpo y debía de costear los gastos del tratamiento ya que su pequeño duro mucho tiempo en el hospital por lo que ella perdió su empleo; movida por las necesidades económicas ella empezó con la venta de perfumes y ropa lo que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía nueva y perfumes para el desarrollo del negocio y tener más ventas. Con tu apoyo Eva saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Eva started her business after her son was scalded in an accident involving boiling water. She had to pay for the cost of treatments for the extended time her young son spent in the hospital. For this reason, Eva lost her job. Driven by financial need, she began to sell perfumes and clothing; this activity has enabled her to improve her situation.

Eva needs a loan of $475 for the purchase of new merchandise and perfumes that will allow her to develop her business and increase sales. She will repay the loan within 6 months. With your help, Eva will succeed in her mission.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana I. is a dynamic 36-year-old mother of two sons. Her husband is unemployed and sometimes helps in her clothing sales business. This is the family’s only source of income. Faced with the need to feed her children, Tarana began to sell different types of clothing eight years ago. Step-by-step, thanks to her passion for making sales and her personality, she has increased her number of clients and her business has grown. During these eight years, she has found that selling women’s clothing is the most profitable, so now all clothes she sells are for women.  At this moment, Tarana needs a loan of $1000 USD that she will use to buy more merchandise to meet the needs of her clients for the winter season. Help Tarana improve her family's quality of life by contributing to the growth of her business. She thanks you sincerely.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate E., a 48-year-old widow with six children, sells cooked foods and drinks in her shop, a business she has operated for a number of years. She opens her shop at 6 a.m. daily to sell to her customers before they leave for work.  

Kate started receiving financial Assistance from LAPO Microfinance two years ago, at which point her shop began to grow and expand. In order to keep growing and expanding, she is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks to sell.  Kate expresses her profound gratitude to Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta tiene 20 años, es casada y tiene un hijo, por el momento vive en la casa de su madre. Sus padres eran agricultores, y de niña Violeta les ayudaba, hace cuatro meses empezó a preparar anticuchos (brochetas de corazón de res a la parrilla con papas sancochadas) por las tardes en la puerta de su casa, sin descuidar a su pequeña niña. A ella le agrada todo tipo de negocio, tratar con la gente le encanta, por ello que ha visto por conveniente empezar con este pequeño negocio, para mas adelante poder tener un restaurante en su casa, esta actividad no le es dificultosa, además le es muy rentable. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero podrá comprar utensilios para el preparado de los anticuchos, y otra parte la utilizará para ambientar un espacio en su casa para la atención de los clientes.
texts.en:
Violeta is 20 years old and married with one child, and at the moment she lives in her mother's house. Her parents were farmers, and as a child Violeta helped them out. Four months ago she began to sell anticuchos (skewers of grilled beef heart with boiled potatoes) in the afternoons from her home, so she could care for her young daughter. She enjoys all types of business and she loves dealing with people which is why she thought it wise to start this small shop, in order to later have a restaurant in her home. This has not been a difficult endeavor and moreover, it is very profitable. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money she will be able to buy utensils for preparing anticuchos, and to decorate a space in her house to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying utensils and decorating the area where she serves her customers

loans.name: Pao Yeang

texts.en:
Mr. Pao Yeang S. is 61 years old and he lives in Svay Ta Thorm village in Kampong Cham province. His wife, Mrs. Men Sokhum, is a grocer who owns a small store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. 

Thus, Mr. Pao Yeang S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for his wife's inventory. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

He has five children. One of the children is a driver, and the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife appears with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Finesse (composé de 5 femmes toutes mariées)ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans avec en moyenne 1 enfant. Elles resident dans le quartier  Médine de la ville de sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles exercent différentes activités commerciales mais la plus dominante est la vente du bois de chauffe puis la vente de  savon de fabrication locale et de l’huile alimentaire. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante les femmes de ce groupe collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 1 an. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Le prêt précédent a été correctement  remboursé.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile alimentaire et 3 sacs de 100 morceaux de savons traditionnels. Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako (capitale du Mali),  ou sur place à Sikasso auprès de grossistes. Les produits sont vendus en détail et  au comptant dans les marchés de la ville de Sikasso, dans le quartier et à domicile à une clientèle composée de femmes et de quelques hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 19 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt,subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the "Finesse" group (made up of five married women and one single woman) are 30 years old and have one child each on average. They live in the Médine neighbourhood of Sikasso in Mali. They have different businesses, but mainly sell firewood and locally-made soap and cooking oil. To satisfy the ever-increasing demand of their customers, the women of the group have worked with the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso for a year. This is their second group loan; their previous loan was repaid in full. They will use the loan to buy a truckload of firewood, four 20-litre vats of cooking oil and 3 100-piece bags of traditional soap. They purchase their goods either in Bamako, the capital of Mali, or locally in Sikasso from distributors. They retail their products in the markets of Sikasso, in their neighbourhoods and at home, mainly to women and to a few men. They hope to each make a monthly profit of 19,000 FCFA which they will use to pay the interest on the loan, take care of their families' needs and invest the remainder in their businesses.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, soap and oil for resale.

loans.name: Elisiana

texts.en:
Elisiana is a banana seller in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 6 years. She belongs to Zingatia group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 12pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bananas for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Elisiana is  married, and has four children: ages 12, 10, 11 and 9. She also cares for three additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S. is 46 years old and lives with four of her children in the Siem Reap province. She is a widow who has a business selling grocery products at the market to earn a living. She is able to make about $5 every day and is supported by one child who works as a butcher.

Mao S. would like to take out a loan to invest in a butcher stand.

loans.use: To invest in a butcher stand

loans.name: Oen

texts.en: Mrs. Oen K. is a villager in Khlaugh Tvea village in the Takeo province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Pich Keam, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Oen K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse with cart to transport passengers to earn income. She is a 34-year-old mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a horse with cart

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз молодая , энергичная женщина , которая занимается продажей лекарственных препаратов. Её муж приехал с России в связи в с кризисом .Теперь он помогает ей по завозу товаров.Дилафруз использует свои кредиты для увеличения разнообразных медикаментов.Она имеет постоянных клиентов, которые покупают у неё лекарства.Муж привозит товар с Истаравшана, из оптовой базы по продаже лекарств,Российских фирм.Т.к. у неё лекарства оригинал,у неё большой спрос.
texts.en:
Dilafruz is a young, energetic woman, who sells medicinal preparations. Her husband came home from Russian in response to the economic crisis, and now assists her in delivering items. Dilafruz is using her loan to increase her range of medical supplies. She has regular customers that purchase medicine from her. Her husband delivers Russian-manufactured medical supplies from the wholesale warehouse in Istaravshan. Dilafruz also makes her own medicinal preparations, which are in high demand.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical Supplies

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 32 years old and married with three children. Juliana sells crates of drinks. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Гапирова  Мунира – женшина 26 лет. Замужем имеет одного ребенка. Мунира узнала о нашей программе решил получит займы для увеличение оборота. Мунира на полученный займ хочет купить овец и перепродать по выгодной цене. Муж Муниры работает в колхозником получает мало денег из за это Мунира вынуждена помогать мужу, чтобы прокормит семью. Мунира также в сезон фруктов занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Мунира очень благодарна   нам за оказанную услугу.
texts.en:
Munira G. is a 26 year old woman. She is married and has one child. She found out about our program and decided to obtain a loan to increase her business's turnover. She would like to use the loan to buy sheep and resell them at a profit. Munira's husband works on a collective farm and makes very little money, so she needs to help him support the family. In the fruit season she will also buy and sell dried fruit. Munira is grateful for the service provided.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock sales

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
M. Lê Thị (1001060009) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, M. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. M. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $170) a month from these activities.

In 2001, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 dong from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. M. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 8th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Susana Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Susana Alvina V. O. tiene 36 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Susana se dedica al reciclaje, su negocio consiste en comprar en la calle y venderlo a los depósitos (Trujillo).
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Mujeres al Progreso, lo invirtió en la compra y venta de chatarra.
Este crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de motores y carcasas de carros (repuestos y piezas de carros).
Susana  tiene como sueño tener su depósito de chatarra y que pueda almacenar su mercadería y pueda vender a otras ciudades para  crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Susana Alvina V. O. is 36 years old in lives in the Porvenir district, Trujillo province, in the state of La Libertad in Peru. She completed primary school and has one dependent son. Susana works in recycling; her business consists of buying material in the streets and selling it at various warehouses (in Trujillo). With first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles that she received from the "Mujeres al Progreso" bank she invested in purchase and selling scrap metal. With this loan of 500 Nuevos Soles she will purchase motors and car frames (spare parts). Susana dreams of having her own scrap metal deposit to be able to store her merchandise and sell it in other cities to grow as a microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motors and car frames (spare parts)

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (1126060760) is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. N. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 Vietnamese dong (about $113 US) a month from these activities.

In 2005, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. N. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 dong which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 7th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Evelyn Scarlet

texts.es: Evelyn Scarlet G. es una joven de 34 años y tiene 2 hijos, que todavía dependen de ella. Ella es una buena cliente de Fundación León 2000, pues siempre ha demostrado tener un bien manejo de su record crediticio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de videos juegos. La ubicación de su negocio es en la casa de habitación de su Mama, pero es ella quien se encarga de atender a los niños. Es una mujer muy alegre y los niños les gusta ya que ella es una muy buena. El dinero será para la compra de nuevos equipos de nintendos como controles, cargadores y reparar algunos televisores.
texts.en:
Evelyn Scarlet G. is 34 years old and has 2 dependent children. She is a good client of Fundación León 2000 and has always demonstrated excellent credit management. She operates a video game business out of her mother’s house, where she also supervises the children who visit. She is a very cheerful woman and the kids love her because she is good to them.

Her loan will be used to purchase new equipment, such as Nintendo controllers and chargers, and to repair some televisions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Korofo

texts.en:
Korofo runs a business selling foodstuffs in a restaurant and needs a loan in order to set up another restaurant. She is a 45-year-old woman who has three children. She is married.

 With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house that she can put up for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program – which is targeted towards returning war refugees – has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To set up another restaurant

loans.name: Julia Del Pilar

texts.en:
Julia is a member of The Dawn village bank. 
She is single, 50 years-old and has no children. 
Julia has always been a storekeeper and makes her living through sales. She decided to start a convenience shop in her house that was successful for many years. Unfortunately, she had to close it because her mother got sick and she had to care for her. Her mother is 91 years-old and needs a lot of attention, and because Julia is the only single sibling she has the responsibility of caring for her. Therefore, Julia decided to sell clothes and beauty products via catalogue in order to give her and her mother more time together. 
Since joining FINCA Perú, she has received loans that have helped her out of many tough situations. They have also helped her invest in more beauty products. 
Julia needs a loan 1200 soles to buy beauty products. Her dream is that her mother will remain healthy and that she will be able to open a new convenience store.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: Necifora

texts.en:
Necifora R., from the village of P-2, Brgy. 25, Pandan City, is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Necifora owns and operates a tailoring business whose main income comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Necifora has been engaged in her business for over three years, earning approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In April 2009, Necifora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials, Necifora is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs her family, most especially the children's education.

About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 50 años, es padre de un hijo y vive en su casa con su pareja. Cariñosamente le llaman “El  Rocotero”, debido a su actividad, pues se dedica a la compra y venta rocotos, también de cayhuas y plátanos. A Juan no le molesta que lo llamen así, por el contrario le hace mucha gracia. Los rocotos y las cayhuas que vende los envía a un mercado grande de la ciudad de Lima, mientras que los plátanos van con destino a otra ciudad aledaña donde año tras año le solicitan dicha fruta. Los viernes a las 3 de la mañana se dirige a las chacras de sus vecinos en busca de los plátanos; para que en la tarde, en compañía de su esposa e hijo, encajonen los plátanos para ser transportados sin dañarse. Juan está muy contento con su labor, porque le es rentable y con esas ganancias puede vivir tranquilamente con su familia. 
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene muchas expectativas y se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas para no defraudar a los demás socios de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de su capital de trabajo para la compra y venta de mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Incremento de su capital de trabajo

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is 27 years old and is married to Jay. Their family lives in the village of Jurisdiction Amulung, Cagayan. They are blessed with two children: Jayvee, who is 9 years old and is in second grade, and Jademar, who is 8 years old and is in first grade. They are enrolled in a public school in their village; the couple is hoping that, through their hard work, they will be able to afford to give their two children the education they need. 

Jovie is a hog raiser in her village. Through her patience and the sacrifices she's made to manage her business, she has been able to meet the needs of her family. Her husband is engaged in a manufacturing business; the profit he makes also helps sustain their family.

Jovie would like to borrow PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that this amount will help her business to grow.

loans.use: additional capital for her pig raising business

loans.name: Edil German

texts.es:
Edil  vive en la calle  “Simon Bolivar” de la zona  Porvenir de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en unas habitaciones en alquiler.
Su esposa  se dedica a la costura de ropa deportiva. 

El trabaja como chofer de un minibus  en las rutas de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de una maquina de costura para que su esposa pueda realizar trabajos y así colaborar en los ingresos de su joven familia.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Edil lives on Simon Bolivar Street, in the Porvenir district of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and his young child in rental housing. His wife is a sportswear seamstress. He works as a minibus driver on the city routes of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine for his wife, so that she can get work and, in this way share in the young family’s earnings. This is the first loan with Impro. which evaluated and approved him for granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: G. Martine est née en 1979 à Bopa, au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNHOUI Hector, Martine est mère de trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Martine vit avec son mari et ses enfants depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Adogléta à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Martine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Martine n'a jamais fréquenté ; c'est pourquoi afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Martine vend divers produits (conserves, biscuits, cube, piment, bicarbonate de sodium, riz, huile végétale, etc.) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Martine s'approvisionne. Martine mène cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année, et est à son neuvième crédit. Martine a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et agrandir davantage son commerce, Martine sollicite ce neuvième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Martine G. was born in 1979 in Bopa, in Benin. She's married to Hector HOUNHOUI and the mother of three children, out of whom some attend school. For about ten years, Martine has been living with her husband and her children in the Adogléta neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She helps her husband with the family expenses. Martine never attended school, and to provide for herself, sells various products (canned food, biscuits, bouillon cubes, chili pepper, sodium bicarbonate, rice, vegetal oil, etc) at her house. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. Martin has been running this business for about ten years, and is seeking her ninth loan. She always repaid her loans without problems. To bolster her working capital and expand her business, she's seeking this ninth loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned food, biscuits, bouillon cubes, chili pepper, sodium bicarbonate, rice, vegetal oil, etc

loans.name: Rit

texts.en:
The picture above shows Mr. Rit P., who is a man on low income living in Phnom Penh City. He owns a big area of farmland next to his house, on which he and his wife grow a variety of vegetable crops. Rit P. always plants his crops twice a year and can collect his mature crops three times per year.

For this coming harvesting rice season, rice is commanding the lowest price. Rit P. thinks that it is the time when he could earn additional income, so he is requesting a loan for capital so he can order rice in bulk to store in his home. He will sell it to gain income when the rice commands a high price.

loans.use: To order rice in bulk to store for future sale

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz, de 21 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y luchadora, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Su puesto está ubicado en el M. Manco Cápac (M. importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de verduras como zapallo, zanahorias, tomates, cebollas, etc. Su puesto es muy concurrido por sus clientes, motivo por el cual su mercadería se vende muy rápido.
Lo que más le gusta a Liz de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir a la calle. 
Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender sus verduras con mayor comodidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Liz con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus socias debido a la alegría que pone en el grupo.
Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más verduras, ya que desea implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Liz is a hardworking and fiesty young woman of 21 years. She lives in her parents' home and what she most wants is to succeed in life. Her kiosk is located at Manco Cápac, an important market in the city of Juliaca. She sells vegetables such as pumpkins, carrots, tomatoes, onions, etc. Her booth is busy with customers, so her merchandise sells very quickly. Liz's favorite part of her job is talking with neighboring saleswomen. She has 4 years of experience in the business, and the most challenging part for her is having to stay at her kiosk all day without being able to walk down the street. In the future, she hopes to have a very large store where she can sell her produce more comfortably. This is Liz's first loan with MFP and she aspires to be very punctual with the payment of her installments. She is well-liked by the members of her communal bank due to the joy she inspires in the group. With the thousand nuevos soles requested, she will purchase more vegetables, since she wants to improve her sales booth.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo A. is from the town of Gud, San Isidro. He is 29 years old. Rodolfo is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from motorcycle transport. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rodolfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used in the maintenance of his passenger motorcycle. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rodolfo from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Used in the maintenance of a motorcycle for passengers.

loans.name: Carlota Elizabeth

texts.es: Carlota Elizabeth A. C. de 28 años de edad, posee ya dos años de tener su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, que está ubicada en su casa de habitación en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el que vive junto a su familia la cual está conformada por su esposo y dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad, quienes asisten a la escuela del lugar. Carlota solicita un préstamo con la ilusión de ver crecer su negocio, comprando productos como pan, huevos, granos básicos y mayor cantidad de sodas, las cuales son las que más se venden. Una tienda es un negocio muy rentable el que permite tener muy buenas ganancias siempre y cuando se cuente con una tienda muy surtida, es por esto que ella espera poder comprar toda la cantidad necesaria de mercadería la cual le permita aumentar sus ventas. Carlota siempre ha soñado poder darles una vida mejor a sus hijos de la que ella tuvo, razón más que suficiente para trabajar arduamente cada día por mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlota Elizabeth A. C., 28, has had her grocery store for two years now. She stocks food and basic needs items in a space in her home, located in Lourdes Colón, La Libertad department. She lives there with her family, which is made up of her husband and two children, 9 and 4 years old, who are enrolled in the local elementary school. Carlota requests funds hoping to help her business grow. She will buy items like: bread, eggs, basic grains, larger amounts of soft-drinks (which are her best sellers). A grocery store is a very profitable business and she always makes good profits, as long as she is well stocked. She hopes, therefore, to be able to buy all the necessary merchandise that will allow her to increase her sales. Carlota has always dreamt of providing for her children a better life than the one she had; sufficient reason to work very hard every day to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mary Jane's Group

texts.en: Mary Jane M. is from the village of Yeban Norte. She is 29 years old. Mary Jane is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mary Jane M.'s Group. Mary Jane is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling curtains in the local community. Mary Jane is just starting this business. In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kulakulana Group, Mukono

texts.en: Mary N. is the chairperson of her group in Katosi. She runs a tailoring business from her home. She makes and mends clothes and sells a few new clothing items from a stall. She is grateful for her loans because they have enabled her to transform her business. Now she no longer has difficulty taking care of her family, since her business is profitable. Mary needs a loan to be able to buy more clothing materials and supplies for her business, and to partly pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Buying clothing materials and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Maria Joaquina

texts.es:
Maria Joaquina T. R. tiene 45 años, es casada, y tiene seis hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 

Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, y las legumbres además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como patos gallinas, ganado, chanchos,  los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria desea que todos sus hijos estudien. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Joaquina T. R. is 45 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She is a member of Grupo Enmanuel, which has 17 members and is located 45 minutes from the canton of Guaranda, capital of the province of Bolívar. It is an agricultural and cattle-raising community where Quechua is spoken. Maria works in agriculture to contribute to her family's finances. The crops that are most popular are maize and legumes. Maria also raises farm animals such as ducks, chickens, cattle, and pigs. She sells her products at home and what she grows, she sells in the wholesale market in Guaranda every six months. Carnaval is one of the key aspects of the culture in the area and is celebrated in February.Maria also wants all her children to study. She is asking for a loan to purchase supplies for her work in the field, especially for fertilizers. Her goal is to do well financially for her family. The challenges she faces are related to weather and pests that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and animals

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
El señor José Alberto G. Q. es trabajador de la escuela Marcos Dessys se desempeña como profesor de educación física de primaria y habita en el reparto Estela.

El señor José Alberto G. Q., solicito el crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. José Alberto G. Q. is employed by the Marcos Dessys School. He teaches physical education at the elementary school level and lives in the division of Estela.

Sr. José Alberto is requesting a loan to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items for his home such as a television, wardrobe, and refrigerator

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama B. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has five children: two girls and three boys.The eldest child is in secondary school, the middle three are in primary school, and the youngest is in nursery school.Her husband work as a security guard in one of the small firms in Sierra Leone. Adama and her family live in Ogoo farm where she has a shop selling food. She has been a client of LAPO Sierra Leone for quite sometime now, and she has taken three previous loans. With the money from her past loans, she was able to complete the building of her shop, where she sells her goods now, and to pay the school fees for her children. Adama needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to invest in her business; she hopes the loan will enable her to earn more profits that will help her and her entire family.

loans.use: This loan will be used to invest in her business selling food

loans.name: Cristoval

texts.es: El Sr.Cristoval nacio en Cueva Pampa Nor cinty Chuquisaca en Sucre Capital de Bolivia en  septiembre  de 1975. concubino (Que viven en pareja pero no son casados legalmente) con la Sra. Rosa, ellos tienen 5 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Hace 15 años que el Señor compro su parcela en cañada 2, son 27 hectareas. El señor actualmente esta sembrando papa, poroto,  y tambien  todos los productos que el cosecha lo vende en el mercado central de el torno. o lo lleva al Abasto el mercado principal de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es muy responsable y trabajador ya que es el unico que mantiene el hogar ya que con 5 hijos es dificil para el brindarles la comodidad a su familia, uno de sus deseos es el de construir su casa ya que ahora tienen  solo 2 ambientes, con el dinero dle credito comprara semillas para la siembra de Papa,  el cliente esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo que le  brindaron en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Cristoval was born in Cueva Pampa Norcinty Chuquisaca in Sucre, the Bolivian capital in 1975. He has five school aged children. 15 years ago he set up a 27 hectare parcel of land, where he raises potatoes. He either sells his harvest in the central marketplace in Torno, or takes it to the Abasto marketplace, the primary marketplace in Santa Cruz. He is very responsible and hard working, as he provides the sole support for his family. It’s difficult. One of his desires is to build a home with his savings. He will use the money from this loan to buy potato seed. He is grateful to the institution for the support they have given him and for helping him receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Potato seed

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa ,de 57 años, vive con su esposo Carlos y su hijo Erick que ya es independiente. Todos habitan en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 11 años, se dedica a la atención de  su tienda de abarrotes , y siempre ha tratado que su negocio este bien implementado con los productos comestibles necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes . Su tienda  es muy concurrida  con gran cantidad de clientes, además Teresa se esfuerza mucho por brindar una buena atención, para que las personas regresen en cualquier momento por el buen trato que les brinda . Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le da la disponibilidad de tiempo ,que necesita para realizar las labores de su hogar, pues mientras deja la reja de su tienda abierta puede entrar en  su casa y organizarla; mientras los clientes optan por comprar. En el futuro Teresa quiere seguir mejorando su negocio  y es por eso que necesita mayor capital.Es el  sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con los pagos de todas sus cuotas.Teresa tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, entre otros comestibles para de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela.
texts.en:
Teresa, 57-years-old, lives with her husband Carlos and her son Erick, who is already grown. They all live in their own home. For 11 years, she has had a grocery store, and she has always tried to make sure that her store is well stocked with the merchandise necessary to meet her customers’ needs. Her store is very busy with a large number of customers. Teresa works hard to give them good customer service, which keeps them coming back again and again. She enjoys her work very much because it gives her enough time to take care of her household chores, and as long as she keeps the door open to her store, she can be at home working, while her clients choose what they’d like to buy. In the future, Teresa wants to continue improving her business, and that is why she needs more capital. This is the seventh loan she has had with MFP, and she has always been very punctual with her payments. Teresa is thinking about investing the money in buying candy, soft drinks, and cookies, among other foods, to satisfy her clientele’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock grocery store

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 32 years old. She is married and has no children. She is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. Joyce has been farming for eight years and has one employee. Her products are milk, tea and pineapples which she sells to the local market.

Her major challenges in farming are the high cost of medicine for her dairy cows when they get sick and lack of sufficient market for her milk and pineapples.

She has successfully completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES which she used to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She has requested this loan from Juhudi for 50,000 KES to purchase another dairy cow. This loan will enable her acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale and hence earn her enough income.

In the future she intends to improve the quality of her breed for better milk production and to open a shop as well.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Najibullah Group

texts.en:
Hokum Bibi is the leader of Najibullah Group. She lives in District 3 of Jalalabad city. She is 45 years old. She is married and has six children: two sons and four daughters. She runs an embroidery business. Currently, her husband has some financial problems. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy more rolls of cloth and different colors of thread to allow her to embroider more clothes. She wants to increase her business income to be able to support her husband and children. 

Hokum Bibi would like to extend her gratitude to both AFS and Kiva lenders for their effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam B. is a villager in Kaoh Reah Leu village in Kandal province. She was born in 1949. She is a farmer who rents a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She currently has a problem in that she does not have money to farm. To solve this problem, Mrs. Seam B. is asking for a loan to rent a plot of land. She will use the rest of the loan to hire farm laborers. 


She is a widow with one child who is a laborer and also a fisherman.

loans.use: To rent a plot of land

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Камолова Фируза проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 22 года. Не замужем. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей. Она продает мужcкую и женскую обувь в центральном рынке города. Имеет хороший опыт в этой сфере. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. На полученную прибыль хочет устроить свадьбу своего брата.
texts.en:
Firuza K. lives the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 22 years old and single. She has a high school education. She works in sales. She sells male and female footwear in the city’s central market. She has experience in this work. She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods she sells. With her profits, she wants to pay for her brother’s wedding.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE NABY est né le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues toutes du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. 

Madame Anta M. à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce de niébé, de beignets, de produits cosmétiques, d’encens et de parfums.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement pour réaliser des bénéfices plus importants. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The SOPE NABY group was created on December 30, 2009. It consists of 11 women from the same village. They came together as neighbors sharing an affinity. Mrs. Anta M., seen at the far right of the photo, is the group leader. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children in he care. She has a small business selling cowpeas, cosmetics, incense and perfumes. With her loan, she plans to increase her stocks and boost her profits. Her goal is to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nelsa Antonieta

texts.es:
Nelsa de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa y papelería.  

Comenzó desde joven trabajando con sus padres, cuando creció y tuvo sus hijos, los ingresos que generaba su esposo no alcanzaban por eso decidió invertir sus ahorros en ropa y venderlos a sus conocidos, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Ella quiere con el préstamo comprar ropa y papelería para surtir mas su negocio, en el futuro quiere darle un buen futuro a sus hijos y surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelsa (41 years of age), lives in the Peruvian area of El Paraiso de Guayaquil. Her home is made of concrete and has only basic electric service. She sells clothing and stationery from a small sales post. Her sales experience began when she was young and helped her parents. Then, when she had her own family and children, and her husband's income wasn't enough, she decided to invest their savings in the purchase of clothing so that she could sell them commercially and supplement their income. She now works from 08h00 a.m. until 20h00 p.m. She wants to use this loan to purchase more clothes and stationery to restock her business. Her desire is to provide a good future for her children and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ropa, papeleria (clothing and stationery products)

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy conversadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace muchos años atrás, se dedicaba a la elaboración de desinfectantes y jabones líquidos con aromas de fresa, manzana, sandia, mandarina y melocotón, en un inicio le fue bien, hasta que aparecieron los hipermercados, su negocio cayo y no pudo competir. Desde entonces trabaja preparando platos típicos de la serranía peruana, de esa manera han transcurrido 3 años y hasta ahora sus clientes acuden a su establecimiento para consumir uno de sus tan deliciosas comidas. Los días que más negocio tiene son los fines de semana, por lo que logra vender todo lo que prepara, resultándole muy rentable este negocio. En un futuro dese tener otro negocio que le genere más rentabilidad, como es el de instalar una librería en su casa. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, ya que como líder de su grupo debe dar el ejemplo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará ingrediente para su preparar más platillos, así como una vitrinas para su futura librería, con las que va diversificar sus ingresos en su economía.
texts.en:
Betty is 40 years old and lives with her husband and their 3 children in their own home. Many years ago, Betty started a business making cleaning products and soaps with the fresh scent of strawberry, apple, watermelon and peach. In the beginning her business did well. But then the supermarkets started to appear and sales fell because she couldn't compete. After that, Betty began a new business preparing typical Peruvian dishes. She's been running her new business for 3 years now, and her customers frequent her small restaurant for the delicious meals she prepares. The busiest days are the weekends, when she sells every meal she prepares, making this a very good business. Going forward, she would like to have another business that will generate more income, so she is considering opening a small general store in her home. This is Betty's 13th loan with MFP and she has complied with all of her payments. As a leader in her group she sets a good example. With the new loan, she will purchase ingredients to prepare her meals, as well as a display case for her new general store. In this way she hopes to diversify her income and economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare the meals she sells, as well as a display case for the small general store she is opening in her home.

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida es separada, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella, Frida se dedica a la venta de leña que ella misma manda hacer, producto que vende en el mercado Nery, además Frida se dedica a la agricultura de cereales y verduras en la comunidad de San Juan de Viñaca, también se dedica a la crianza de animales.
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa y necesita un préstamo de 2600 para la compra de leña y tara.
Los sueños de Frida son mejorar su casa para vivir mejor y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Frida is separated and has 8 children four of whom live with her. Frida sells firewood in Nery Market that she has made. She also farms cereals and vegetables in San Juan de Viñaca and raises animals. Frida is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) communal bank and needs a 2600 sol loan to buy firewood and tara (a Peruvian tree rich in tannins). Frida’s dreams are to improve her home to live more comfortably and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and tara (Caesalpinia spinosa, a Peruvian plant rich in tannins)

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
He is young, ambitious and hard-working. He is 23 years old, married with two children, aged 3 and 2 years. His name is Yasin. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda where he operates a used shoe business having started it four years ago. He says it has been good so far as he has been able to buy a plot of land from his business gains and some cattle. He adds that bad debts and seasonality are the challenges he has to deal with as he strives to earn a living from selling used shoes. He hopes to see his business bigger in size in the future. 

Yasin intends to use the loan to purchase more used shoes to sell and one heifer for his farm.

loans.use: Purchase more used shoes for resale and one heifer for his farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 26 years old and a member of Kuendelea group in Faulu Kenya. He has been selling mosquito nets for one year. He also sells food for extra income. He does a part-time job as a musician and an instrumentalist. He hopes to develop a career as a musician in the future. He has requested for a first loan of KES 20,000 to buy a sewing machine, mosquito nets and maize and beans for cooking.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, mosquito nets and maize and beans for cooking.

loans.name: Margaret Wambui

texts.en:
Margaret Wambui N. has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town since 2006. She is 22 years old and a single mother of two children.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She paid all her previous loans on time.  She plans to use the loan amount of 50,000 KES to buy sugar, rice and flour in bulk which she will later sell in small quantites to her customers.

In the future, Margaret hopes to grow her shop to be a mini supermarket.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and rice in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Chan C. and her husband. Mrs. Chan C., 31 years old, is a humble mother who has two young children who attend school. Mrs. Chan C. cultivates rice and vegetables on her farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. Her husband also works with her on the farm.

 Beside the current farm work, Mrs. Chan C. has feeds some pigs behind her house in order to earn extra income. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Chan C. and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional pigs to fatten for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.ru: Файзуллоев Махмади проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст, 61 год. Женат. Имеет семерых детей. Живет вместе с женой и детьми. Жена, домохозяйка. Сыновья предоставляют услугу, такси. Сам Махмади имеет среднетехническое образование. Занимается перевозкой людей по маршруту Душанбе-Рудаки. В этой области более 7 лет. Он хочет продать свою старую машину и купить новую. Кредит берет для приобретения новой автомашины тангем.
texts.en: F. Mahmadi lives in the Rudaki region. He's sixty-one years old, married and is a father to seven children. They live together. His wife is a stay-at-home mom and his sons work as taxi drivers. Mahmadu has a high school level of education and has worked as a cab driver on the Dushanbe-Rudaki route for seven years. He wants to sell his old car and buy a new one. Which is why he's asking for a loan - to buy a new "Tangem".

loans.use: To buy a new Tangem (a car)

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en:
Sen N. T. is 58 years old and lives in the town of Thanh Hoa. She leads a five-member loan group that's affiliated with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this loan group is Dong Son.

Sen is married, has one child and makes a living by running a store where she sells beverages such as beer and wine. She has worked in this field for more tH. two years and earns about 2,100,000 VND a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Sen joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 4.248.000 VND, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income generated by this loan to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  L. T. Hop is 44 years old and requesting a loan for 4,248,000 VND to support her business, a stall where she sells food.
2.  T. T. Lien is a 39-year-old woman who is applying for a 4,248,000 VND loan to operate her retail store.
3.  H. T. Anh Thuong is 35 years old and applying for a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her food stall.
4.  H. T. Mui is 31 years old and is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) aims to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Sen N. T. (7) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Sen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02 Dong Son (10.11.02).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán loại thức uống có cồn như bia & rượu trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Sen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sen kiếm được khoảng 2.100.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Sen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Hop (8) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  T. T. L:ien (9) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  H. T. Anh Thuong (10) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  H. T. Mui (11) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to expand several small retail businesses

loans.name: Fanny Janethe

texts.es:
Fanny de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es profesora parvulario y vende productos de uso personal marca Avon. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso hace tiempo ha trabajado para poder mantener a su hijo ya que está separada de su esposo.   

Trabaja de lunes a viernes como profesora en una escuela y los fines de semana vende  productos de uso personal Avon a sus amigas y conocidas. Tiene muchas aspiración para su hijos por eso quiere continuar trabajando para generar dinero y asi darle una buena vida a su hijo. 

Ella quiere construir mejor su casa por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena, bloques, pintura para comenzar el año con su casa arreglada. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando  y terminar de construir su casa.
