texts.en: Fanny, age 35, is a hard-working woman who is a primary teacher and sells Avon personal products. She has lived in a periurban zone called Paraiso for some time and has worked in order to maintain her child, as she is separated from her husband. She works Mondays to Fridays as a teacher in a school, and on weekends she sells Avon personal products to her friends and acquaintances. She has many goals for her children, so she wants to continue working to generate money and give her child a good life. She wants to improve her house, and so she wants to use this loan to buy cement, sand, blocks and paint in order to start off the year with her house in order. For the future, she wants to continue to work and finish building her house.

loans.use: cement, sand, stones

loans.name: Lion Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim T. (first row left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Ibrahim was born in Yele village about thirty years ago. He is married to a businesswoman.  The couple has two children who are not yet of school-going age. 

For over six years, Ibrahim has been selling market food – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, pepper, etc.   This is the first loan that Ibrahim and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ibrahim will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand his business.  He will buy palm oil, rice, pepper, kola nuts, etc. at wholesale to add to his inventory.

loans.use: To buy palmoil, rice, pepper, kola nuts, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Mr. Oem M. is living in Thnoas village, Takeo province and he was born in 1967.  He and his wife, Mrs. Chrean Ben, are farmers who own 3-hectares of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family.  Besides farming, he is a fisherman and he owns a mill where he is able to earn some profit to support his family.  

In the past, he wanted to breed a cow, but he did not have enough money to buy one.  In order to do that, Mr. Oem M. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding so he can start a new business.  He is a father of five children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, while the other one is attending a local public school, and the others are too young to work or study.  His wife is taken in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sartawi De San Roque Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTAWI DE SAN ROQUE” iniciará el ciclo número dos en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Concepción, también se encuentra la tesorera la señora  Josefa y la secretaria de actas la señora Santusa. .   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados: venta de vinos, tejido de chompas, macramé de mantas, tejido de variedad de prendas, venta de abarrotes y verduras.
 
La señora Josefa, tesorera de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C. “SARTAWI DE SAN ROQUE”  2 ciclos, aproximadamente  un año.  La señora Josefa  solicitó su primer crédito para impulsar su negocio de tejido de buzos para niños,  ahora se le ha presentado la oportunidad de trabajar con una tienda en su propio domicilio y quiere el crédito para surtir la tienda.   Debido al tiempo que requiere la atención de una tienda de barrio, ella comenta que le ayudarán  sus hijas mayores.  La señora Josefa está casada, es madre de siete hijos y considera que el trabajo que tendrá con la tienda le permitirá atender a sus hijos.
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The "SARTAWI DE SAN ROQUE" communal bank will begin its second year in Pro Mujer as part the the Panamerican Focal Center.  The group has eight members and is lead by a board of directors with Mrs. Concepción as president, Mrs. Josefa as Treasurer and Mrs. Santusa as secretary.  The members' businesses are varied and include sales of: wine, knit sweaters, macrame blankets, clothing fabric, groceries and vegetables.

Mrs. Josefa, the treasurer of the communal association, has been a member of the "SARTAWI DE SAN ROQUE" group for approximately one year.  She requested her first loan to start her business of knitted children's clothing.  Now she has the opportunity to set up a shop in her own home and needs a loan to stock the shop.  Because of the time needed to run the business her oldest daughters will help her.  Mrs. Josefa is married and the mother of seven children.  She feels being able to run the shop will help her attend to her children's needs.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says its the companionship she shares with other members.

loans.use: To buy grocery items such as bread, softdrinks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Syonthi

texts.en:
Syonthi S. is 26 years old and married. Her husband also contributes to the family's income. She has three children, ages nine, seven and four. She has been running a grocery store for a period of five years, where she sells various types of fruits and vegetables. She gets a monthly income of about $125.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD, with which she plans to add more stock of fruits and vegetables, like onions, potatoes, etc. to sell. 

In the future she hopes to buy a piece of land to develop for the family, and also to buy a vehicle for transporting vegetables from the farm to the shop.

loans.use: to add to her stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: C4809 Twiyungure Group

texts.en:
Antoine is 31 years old and is married with three children. He is the president of a group which is called "Twiyungure" in the local language. The group is composed of five people: three men and two women.  Antoine is the first person on the right side.  He sells soft drinks like soda and milk.

This business is well-organized. He works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and he has three years of experience. Antoine and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase additional drinks such as water, soda and milk to sell. With the resulting profit, Antoine and his team will be able to save in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks such as soda and milk

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 31 years old and is a married woman. She has 3 children aged 16, 10 and 5. Her husband works as a driver.

Gemma is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 8 years. She works hard to support her family. 

Gemma's loan will be used to purchase farm fertilizers and other supplies. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies for her rice farm

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Osman K..  He is married, and has 4 children aged 4, 10 12 and 12 years. In 2006, Osman established his electronics business. He began his business to enable him to generate enough income to support his family.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. 

Osman would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. He requires a loan in order to buy different type of radios and electric lamps for his business. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Osman plans to open a bigger shop, educate children and buy a piece of land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different type of radios and electric lamps

loans.name: Najwa

texts.ar: نجوى في عمر 46 سنة متزوجة تعمل في بيع ماكنات الطباعة و حبال اكياس لها في عملها 14 سنة تحب عملها وتسعى دائما الى دعمه وتطويره فهي مثابرة ونشيطة وتسعى الى تحسين وضع عائلتها ووضعها المادي والاجتماعي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة وتطوير المصلحة حتى تزيد من مدخولها الشهري فهي تعتمد على نفسها وتعيل افراد عائلتها تعمل بكد ولا تكل عن طلب التقدم وتطوير الذات لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها وقد واجهت صعوبات مادية من خلال المنافسة في المحيط تتميز بالمعاملة الجيدة والتعامل مع الاخرين
texts.en: Najwa is 46 years old and married. She works selling printers and straps for bags. She has 14 years of experience in her work. She likes her work, and she is always trying to improve it, as she is diligent and active, and trying to improve her family's material situation and social status. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods for her business in order to improve it as well as in order to increase her monthly income. This is all the more important as she relies on herself in providing for her family. She works hard, and she never tires of seeking ways to progress in life and develop herself. She has customers from her community and from among her neighbors; however, she is facing material difficulties because of the competition in her community. She stands out in her field due to her good dealings with others and her overall good conduct.

loans.use: buy goods for her store where she sells printers and straps for bags.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 30 years old. She has five children who are 1 ½ to 10 years old. Three children are in school while the others are not yet school age. 

Her husband rides a motorcycle for a business. 

Angelique sells different kinds of food stuffs such as sorghum, and she has sold them for the past three years. This business has enabled her meet the needs of her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs and make more profits. With the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and other food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en:
Albertha is 38 years old and lives in Logan Town. She’s married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman and all of their children attend school.

Albertha has been running a movie center where she shows beautiful African, European and American movies among others, and due to this she has a lot of customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more DVDs for her business. She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more DVDs for her business.

loans.name: Maritza Reina

texts.es:
La Señora. Maritza es socia del banco comunal Renacientes, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, a esta ciudad le hace hermosa su gente, su cultura, tradiciones, la belleza de su naturaleza y arquitectura, también es conocida como cuna de grandes deportistas, tiene una variada gastronomía que cautiva a propios y extraños.
 
Doña Maritza tiene 32 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 14, 11, 9 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus tres últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Maritza trabaja realizando los quehaceres domésticos en una casa, actividad que la desempeña hace un año y labora solo medio día.
 
Después de algunos años se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de la maraca Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos para iniciar con le venta de este producto.
 
Su sueño es comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank “Renacientes” (The Resurgents). She lives in the Feria Libre sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is beautiful because of its people, culture, traditions, natural settings, and architecture. It is also the birthplace of great athletes and has a variety of cuisines that captivate the palates of locals and foreigners.

Doña Maritza is 32 years old and a single mother of four children (ages 14, 11, 9, and 6). Her oldest child is in high school and the other three attend school in the city. She lives in a rental property since she does not own a home.

Sra. Maritza works as a housekeeper at a private home and has been in this job for a year and a half. She returned to the Communal Bank after being absent for a few years. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of Yanbal products such as perfumes, crèmes, trinkets, and cosmetics so that she can begin selling these items.

Her dream is to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, crèmes, trinkets, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: In the picture above, Araba is standing close to the traditionally built oven which she uses to smoke the fish for sale. She lives together with her spouse and has 5 children.  Her spouse is a mason.  Araba has been selling smoked fish for 15 years. She responsibly helps her husband take care of their  home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Janat has a business of brick-laying, which she has had for over 10 years. She also has a second business of selling firewood.  

To help expand her business, Janat has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase firewood for burning the bricks and paying some of the workers. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Janat hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Janat hopes to own a charcoal business. Janat is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for burning bricks and to pay some of the workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Amoko

texts.fr:
Amoko est une femme âgée de 30ans,Elle est mariée à un peintre –auto.Elle est mère de trois enfants .
Amoko travaille comme couturière et revendeuse  depuis 2006 .Elle vend des pagnes et des produits de mercerie à domivile à Kpogan.Elle achète à Lomé et ses environs .Elle travaille seule sans aucune aide.
Amoko a requis son premier crédit  de WAGES afin  d’acheter des pagnes et des produits de mercerie.
texts.en:
Amoko is a 30 year-old woman married to a painter and driver with whom she has three children. Amoko has worked as a seamstress and tradeswoman since 2006. She sells pagnes (colourful waxed cloths) and haberdashery from home at Kpogan. She purchases her wares from Lomé and the surrounding area, and works alone. 
Amoko is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase more wax cloths and haberdashery items.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes (colourful wax cloths) and haberdashery

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a retail shop that sells bananas, snacks, breads and ice candies. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Amie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw body and spare parts

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 50 years old and is engaged in a hog fattening business as a source of income. She is blessed with four children to send to school and provides for their needs. Erlinda and her husband are helping each other to earn a higher income to achieve their desired standard of living. Her husband works as a farmer while she works on her hog fattening business.

She wants to provide better sustenance to her hogs, therefore she has requested a loan amount of PHP 5,000 to buy feeds and vitamins. Given that nutrition and sustenance, she can sell her hogs at a higher price. She hopes to gain higher sales in order to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice owns two clothes shops. She opened the current one in October, 2010. She is married and has three children: one in class 3, her first adopted child has completed class 8, and the last born aged 3 years has not began schooling. They live in the Malindi area of Coast Province. Her business is in the heart of a small town and she has a number of customers. Among the coastal people who like nice dresses, she does good business. 

Alice was invited to join Milango Financial Services by her friends in May, 2011. A loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings will help Alice buy new stock of clothes, shoes and sufurias (cooking pots). She hopes to improve her business, obtain a larger loan, and build her own business premises, because she rents the current premises. Just like in other tourist destination towns, her business faces a low season in February when there are few sales, but she advises fellow ladies to join Milango in order to obtain credit to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cooking utensils

loans.name: Hortencia María

texts.es:
La Señora. Hortensia es socia del banco comunal Bella Vista, vive por una comunidad que  pertenece al a parroquia Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), está localizada al sur de la Capital Azuaya, lleva su nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, precisamente en las faldas del cerro Portete el 27 de Febrero de 1829. Su gente mantiene las tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

Doña Hortensia tiene 62 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 8 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, seis de ellos son casados e independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y  le ayudan económicamente.  Su esposo labora en varias actividades o en las que les ofrezcan trabajo, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora. Hortensia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa  tiene tiempo para criar ganado, cuyes y gallinas. También labora en la agricultura y lo que cultiva es solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  al cual fue invitada por una vecina, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es tener más ganado y crecer en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Hortensia is a member of the Bella Vista communal bank.  She lives in a community belonging to Victoria del Portete (Cuenca) Parish located south of the Azuaya capital.  Its name is in honor of a battle that took place in its fields precisely on the skirts of the Portete Hill on 27 February 1829.  Its residents maintain the traditions of its peoples and they raise livestock and farm.

Hortensia is 62 years old and lives in a common law relationship.  She has 8 children who are all adults now.  Six of them are married and independent. Her two single children work and help out economically.   Her husband works in various activities or at jobs he’s offered.  They do not own a house; they are renters.

Hortensia does the household chores and since she stays home she has time to raise livestock, guinea pigs and chickens.  She also farms but everything she grows is only for home consumption.

This is the first loan she’s taken out in the communal bank that she was invited to join by a neighbor.  She will use the loan to buy livestock.  Her goal is to have more livestock and to grow in this activity.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Sern

texts.en: Sern, 60 years old, is a village leader and a farmer earning $1 per day. His wife stays home. They have two children who both work earning $9 per day in total. Every month he has to spend $25 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for his children to travel to work. Most of the family expenses are paid for by his children. He wants his daughter to sell groceries at home so that she does not need to travel far from home to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his children to travel to work

loans.name: Kitumla

texts.en:
Kitumla is 28 years old, married and has two children. He has been a maize farmer for the past five years. He learned about KADET Ltd. through advertisements done by KADET. 

He applied for his first loan with KADET, with which he plans to buy maize seeds for planting and also chemicals for spraying. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. 

He is an honest man who will thrash about to achieve if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Virgen de Caacupé”. Están en el Primer Ciclo y tiene 11  integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor,  trabajan en conjunto para tener fondos que puedan ayudar al comité en caso de necesidad.
La señora Lourdes es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas interiores, tanto para hombres como para mujeres. Comenta que ya se ha formado una buena clientela y que gracias a sus ventas ella tiene los medios para mantener a toda su familia. Siempre ella tiene mucha variedad de prendas pero quiere seguir abasteciéndose y es por eso que acude a la fundación y kiva y solicita el crédito para la compra de nuevas prendas, para que de esa forma tenga más variedad y atraiga a más clientes.
Agradece a la fundación y a kiva, por esta oportunidad de crecimiento que les da.
texts.en:
Their committee is called “Virgen de Caacupe.” It's in its 1st loan cycle and has 11 members. The group is well known in the barrio for being very responsible and united. The members possess great enterprising spirit and work together to obtain funds to help the committee in case of necessity.

Lourdes is one of the members. She sells underwear for both men and women. Lourdes comments that now she has a good customer base and, thanks to her sales, she has the means to maintain all her family. Lourdes always has a large variety of clothing items to sell but she wishes to continuing resupplying them. And that is why she approached the Foundation and Kiva to request a loan to buy new merchandise, so she will have more variety and can attract more customers.

Lourdes thanks the Foundation and Kiva for the growth opportunity they are providing.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a married woman with five children. She lives in the town of Trinidad in the province of Bohol with her family.

Demetria earns a living selling ready-to-wear clothes to her community. She sells mens and ladies shirts and jeans. Demetria is also a Natasha (a Filipino-owned direct sales company) dealer. She works hard to support her family.

Demetria has requested this loan to buy more items, such as shirts and jeans, to sell. She hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as shirts and jeans, to sell.

loans.name: Cicila

texts.en: Cicila is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, none of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for three years. Cicila is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Wendeza

texts.en:
Wendeza is a 24-year-old married mother of two children, ages four and and one. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter. Wendeza makes nipa roofing materials to sell, and also buys and sells dried fish and salted sea oysters, earning an income of 2200 PHP per month.

Wendeza is requesting this loan to buy more nipa and dried fish to sell. She hopes to have a progressive business and also hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more nipa and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: C5687 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 28 years old and is single. His business is well organized. He sells sugar, soap, bananas, salt, sorghum, beans, maize in the market and he works from 6am until 10pm every day. Jean Baptiste employes two people to help him.

Jean Baptiste has requested a loan from a Kiva lender in order to purchase more quantities of rice, soap, salt, sorghum, beans, maize to sell. With this profit, Jean Baptiste will be able to buy more quantities of food for his family and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, soap, bananas, salt, etc to sell.

loans.name: Luzolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Sami, age 40, is the chairman of the community group named Luzolo Plus, which consists of 8 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through its partnering microfinance institution, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. Sami is married and the father of four children between 2 and 11 years old. Three of them attend school.

Sami has been in the microenterprise world since 2001. He has been selling drinks. His drink facility is located west of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of HOPE RDC and has already received five different loans and repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of his goods by buying 20 crates of drinks with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $210. His ambition is to open a larger drink facility in his area.

loans.use: to increase his stock of his goods by buying 20 crates of drinks for resale

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim is 32 years old and married with three dependent children, two of whom are in school while another one is too young for school. She lives in a rural village of the Bovel district of Cambodia where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, her family's main sources of income have been from growing cucumbers and mushrooms for ten years. Lack of working capital is a main challenge for her family’s business. 

Lim’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her family to obtain sufficient food and to better support the business. Currently, she can earn about 46,000 KHR per day from the business. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthy and fruitful mushroom and cucumber crops in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Françoise(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 39 ans. Françoise ne vit plus avec son mari. Françoise est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et trois à la charge du couple. Françoise vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Françoise vend de la nourriture, des boules d’akassa (pâtes de maïs fermenté) et du riz dans sa région et des boissons de façon secondaire. Françoise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Françoise sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, du maïs, de l'huile végétale et des condiments.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 51 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre catorce y veintiocho años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la agricultura, el lleva 40 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad pues empezó desde muy pequeño, gracias a sus años de experiencia ha logrado obtener siempre buenas cosechas.
Manuel  ahora está necesitado de dinero  pues aunque ha intentado cultivar en estos días esto no le ha sido posible por esa razón acude a un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semillas de arveja. Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio  y terminar la construcción de su casa.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y semillas de arveja.

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Ms. Essi A., 40 years old, has lost three husbands and no longer knows where to turn for help. A mother of three children, she finds herself being crushed by the household expenses, for which she alone is responsible. She is a courageous, dynamic woman who sells charcoal for a living. This business is very prosperous, but she does not have enough money to go herself to buy the charcoal wholesale in production areas, where the prices are lower. Ms. A.’s income has dwindled to next to nothing, and she is no longer able to meet the needs of her family. She fears that, because of a lack of financial means, her children will stop going to school and will become delinquents.

To strengthen and develop her business, Ms. Essi A. is requesting a loan of $950. The loan she is requesting will allow her to order charcoal wholesale from production areas, to transport it, to stock it and to resell it. This will allow Ms. A. to increase her income, to better her family’s living conditions and above all to ensure her children’s education, which is her greatest concern.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 40 ans, Mme A. Essi a perdu successivement 03 maris et ne sait plus à quel saint se vouer aujourd’hui. Mère de 05 enfants, elle se trouve écrasée par les charges de son ménage qu’elle supporte seule. Femme courageuse et dynamique, elle a pour activité le commerce du charbon de bois. Cette activité est très florissante mais elle n’a plus assez de moyens financiers pour aller elle-même s’approvisionner en gros dans les zones productives où les prix sont plus bas. Le revenu de Mme A. est devenu insignifiant et elle n’arrive plus à faire face efficacement aux besoins de la famille. Elle craint fort que ses enfants abandonnent l’école faute de moyens pour devenir des délinquants.

Pour renforcer et accroître ses activités, Mme A. Essi sollicite un appui financier d’un montant de $ 950 pour renforcer son commerce. Le crédit demandé va servir à commander en gros du charbon de bois dans les zones productives, à le transporter, le stocker et le revendre. Cela permettra d’améliorer le revenu de Mme A. et donc des conditions de vie de sa famille et surtout assurer l’éducation de ses enfants qui est sa première préoccupation.

loans.use: To buy charcoal wholesale

loans.name: Sutinah

texts.en: S. is a 46-year-old mother with 4 children. She sells some snacks and beverages. She sells them in a small kiosk near a beach. She may earn more income if many fishermen go to the sea. She is a member of MBK and really wants to get a $50 loan to expand her business and purchase more kerosene. She hopes that she can earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase kerosene

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.en:
Rosa is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of three young men. Two of them are studying, which is why her husband’s low salary wasn’t enough to cover all the family’s expenses. In order to bring in some extra income, Rosa began selling shoes, cosmetics, and jewelry two years ago. Her liking for sales and her convincing words have helped her increase her number of customers and made her business grow.

In order to cover the demand from her customers and to offer them good service, Rosa needs a loan of $750.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She promises to pay the loan back over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can help form a part of this business; your assistance is very useful to Rosa. She and her family appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hombres, dos de ellos están estudiando, por lo que el bajo salario que recibe su esposo resultaba insuficiente para cubrir todas las responsabilidades de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra Rosa inició con la venta de zapatos, cosméticos y joyería desde hace dos años, su gusto por las ventas y su facilidad de palabra la han ayudado a incrementar su numero de clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.

Para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y ofrecer un buen servicio, Rosa necesita de un crédito por $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, mismo que se compromete a devolver en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes formar parte de este negocio, tu ayuda es de gran utilidad para Rosa, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru:
Maftuna is 19. She lives with her parents. Both parents work as controllers at Ispharinskiy Chemical Plant and receive scanty pay. Maftuna’s business provides a sizable contribution to her family’s income. Maftuna sells fried sunflower seeds, chewing gum, cigarettes, and other small items at the town’s bus terminal. The business is doing well, because there are plenty of buyers at the station. To buy her goods, Maftuna travels to neighboring Uzbekistan. She is a Tajik citizen and it is not easy for her to cross the border. Because the goods cost less in Uzbekistan, Maftuna must continue her trips in spite of many difficulties. Maftuna has been a MicroInvest borrower for half a year. She used her loan to expand her business slightly and purchase the necessary amount of goods. Now, many of the goods that Maftuna is selling have gone up in price. She plans to use the new loan to purchase more goods.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мафтуне 19 лет. Она живет с родителями. Отец и мать работают контролерами на Исфаринском химическом заводе и получают мизерную по нынешним временам заработную плату. Бизнес, которым занимается Мафтуна, вносит весомый вклад в семейный бюджет. Мафтуна продает жареные семечки, жевательную резинку, сигареты и другие мелкие товары на городском автовокзале. Торговля идет хорошо, так как покупателей очень много. Для закупки товара Мафтуна ездит в соседний Узбекистан. Для нее как гражданина Таджикистана существует проблема пересечения границы, но товар там стоит дешевле и Мафтуне приходится несмотря на трудности ездить в Узбекистан. В Микроинвест Мафтуна кредитуется полгода. С помощью займа она намного расширила свой бизнес, закупила необходимое количество товара. Сейчас многие товары, которые она продает, повысились в цене. Новый займ она хочет потратить на закупку товаров.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Juana Ines

texts.es:
Juana is married, and her husband is a taxi driver. They don't have children, but they do have a strong desire to move up in the world and have some assets for when they do have kids so they can offer them a high quality of life. With these high hopes she started a small beauty salon a year and a half ago because she studied the craft and wanted to develop professionally. Little by little the salon became successful and business grew. Juana tries to improve her craft every day, and she's sure she'll succeed because she's a very hard worker.

Juana is requesting a loan of $375, which she will use to improve her salon and set it up some more to improve the service she provides. She plans to repay the loan within six months. She and her husband are grateful for your support in helping them move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juana es una mujer casada y su esposo es taxista, no tienen hijos pero desea superarse y formar un patrimonio para cuando los tengan y así poder ofrecer una buena calidad de vida, con estas ganas de salir adelante fue hace un año y medio que puso un pequeño salón de belleza ya que fue lo que ella estudió y quiere desarrollarse en su profesión y poco a poco es lo que esta logrando y creciendo con el mismo, por ello es que ella desea mejorar cada día más y lograr sus metas, las que esta segura de lograr por que es muy trabajadora.

Juana esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para mejorar su negocio y acondicionarlo más para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su esposo te agradecen el apoyo que les das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Invest in the business and remodel the salon

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Mrs. Happiness O. is 32 years old and is married with 5 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she fixes hair for people and sells hair cream.  She spent a year and a half learning her business and opened her own in 1996.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more weavon, hair cream & relaxer to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, hair cream & relaxer to sell.

loans.name: Santi

texts.en:
Mrs. Santi A., 25, of Bhakapati (Nepal) lives in a nuclear family, together with her husband Suresh A. and one son. Most of the people in this area are involved in agricultural work. Mr. Suresh A. is a police officer and their son is in primary school.

Mrs. A. opened a grocery shop two years ago. She sells different types of grocery goods in her shop. Due to lack of capital, however, she cannot expand her business. So she is requesting a loan of US$ 250 to buy necessary goods like noodles, biscuits, etc. to expand her business. She spends her income for her son's education and household expenses.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for re-sale

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong Y., 24, is married with one small child and her 22-year-old husband. They live in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on a plot of land breeding ducks and growing rice, making collectively about $10 in revenue from selling their ducks, duck eggs, and rice to a market. Mrs. Yong Y. hopes to use this loan to increase her number of ducks to generate more profit for her family.

loans.use: To expand her livestock.

loans.name: Marbis Manuel

texts.es:
Marbis C. spent a great part of his youth working as an electrician. However, seeing his difficult economic situation he decided to invest in the purchase of a grinder so as to dedicate himself to this business situated in his home in the El Sauce municipality in Leon.

Since starting this milling business 10 years ago, Marbis has sacrificed a great deal to maintain it, and it is for this reason that he is well recognized in the village. He believes he can better his economic situation since it has always been a dream of his to improve his business with new machinery. To realize this dream Marbis has sought the support of Ceprodel, which as been a great factor in the development of his business by disbursing loans that have been beneficial to the growth of his business and the betterment of his life. His loan record is five loans.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Marbis C. es un caballero que gran parte de su juventud la dedicó al negocio de electricista pero al ver la difícil situación económica que le rodeaba decide invertir en la compra de un molino para dedicarse a este negocio en su casa de habitación en León específicamente en el municipio de El Sauce.

Desde hace 10 años inició este negocio que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado mantenerlo y es por eso que hoy en día es muy reconocido en el pueblo y asegura que mejorará su situación económica ya que son sus sueños ampliar el negocio con nueva maquinaria. Para hacer realidad este sueño, el señor C. se ha apoyado de Ceprodel que ha sido un factor importante para el desarrollo de su negocio otorgándole créditos que le han beneficiado en el crecimiento de su negocio y mejora de su nivel de vida. Su record crediticio es de 5 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his mill

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fida B.. She is currently in the business of milling and selling maize and is requesting a loan to purchase more maize. Fida is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children ranging from ages 18 to 27 and three of her children go to school. Each week, Fida makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and cater for her family's basic needs. Fida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her milling business and the loan was paid back on time.

Fida is joined in her small group by Betty N., and Aziza K.. Betty N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase a fridge. Aziza K. is currently operating a business selling charcoal and wants a loan to purchase in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of maize

loans.name: Fe En Marcha Group

texts.en:
Claudia lives in Samana, in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. She has raised three wonderful children (ages: 25, 22, and 20) and now focuses on her small “colmado” business, which provides much needed necessities to her community. She wants to use this loan to buy more rice, beans, sugar, bread, and milk for her store. When Claudia has free time, she enjoys going to church and talking with the other women in her community.

This will be Claudia’s 5th loan with Esperanza, and we hope that more women in her community will follow her example. On behalf of these women and Esperanza, thank you for your support and generosity!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, milk, sugar, and bread

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is very enthusiastic and hard-working, always looking to give the best to herself and her 3-year-old son. It's this that is her biggest daily motivation. She travels constantly to her country's capital city in search of clothing articles and with time she has come to learn the best sales techniques that has kept her in the merchant trade. Her goal is to increase her inventory, which is why she's requesting a loan.

Translated by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Margarita, es muy entusiasta y trabajadora, siempre está buscando dar lo mejor de sí a su pequeño hijo de 3 años y para ella esta es la razón y la más alta motivación que encuentra en su diario vivir. Viaja constantemente a la ciudad capital de su país en busca de sus artículos y con el tiempo ha visto y ha aprendido las mejores técnicas de ventas que han asegurado su permanencia en este rubro mercantil. Su deseo de incrementar sus ofertas la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase the amount of clothes she offers / Incremento de capital para incrementar las ofertas de sus prendas de vestir.

loans.name: Idimoh

texts.en:
Idimoh A. is 22 years old. She is not married yet. In order to support her parents, for about two years, Idimoh has been running her own business. She works in a tailoring shop. Currently, there are four sewers working in the shop. Idimoh specializes in sewing clothing for women in the national style. She wants to make herself more popular in the city and expand her business.

Today, Idimoh is planning to expand her business and to buy modern summer fabrics to meet the requirements of her customers. She requests 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for 12 months. The loan will be used to purchase new modern summer fabrics produced in Dubai. Idimoh is counting on your help and would like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy new modern summer fabrics

loans.name: Juan Roney

texts.es:
Mr Juan lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, is married, 26 years old and has two children of 2 and 4 years old. His wife washes and irons for private residences and helps with their homes. Mr Juan works as a welder and bricklayer and has nine years of experience doing this labor, which began with his own funds.

The loan he is asking for is in order to build a vertical structure where he can do welding work and in this way provide better quality for his customers. Future plans are to expand the business and gain more customers and teach his daughter this line of work.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Juan habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado, tiene 26 años de edad, y le tienen dos hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, su esposa lava y plancha a personas particulares y ayuda a su hogar. Don Juan trabaja como soldador y también es albañil tiene nueve años de estar laborando e inició con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para construir una estructura vertical donde relizar trabajos de soldadura y así brindar mejor calidad de trabajo a sus clientes. A futuro es expandirse y captar más clientes y formar a su hija en la educación.

loans.use: Vertical structure in order to do more welding work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase some fashionable pants and blouses for her business.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is 24 years old. She is married and has a little child. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuffs like maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, and gari in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She enjoys selling foodstuffs and takes pride in serving her customers.

Alberta says the sale of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make a good income to support her family. Alberta is a member of the group called Anointed Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like maize, plantains, groundnuts, gari, and beans for re-sale

loans.name: Arkin

texts.ru: Кахоров Эркин житель города Яван. Но живет он очень далеко от центра. Имеет продуктовый магазин рядом с домом . Это единственный магазин в их селении , кроме того магазин является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Эркин женат и имеет двоих детей. Планирует сделать ремонт в магазине , на что и запрашивает кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.Это поможет улучшить условия работы и хранения продуктов. На кредит закупит стройматериалы.
texts.en:
Arkin K. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He lives very far from the center of the city. He owns a grocery store and a house. This is the only store in the surrounding region, and it is also the only source of income for his family. Arkin is married and has 2 children. He plans to renovate the store and he wants to take out a loan, which he plans to repay in 10 months. This will allow for better working conditions and the preservation of goods. With the loan he will buy building materials.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovation of Building

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian, who is 30 years old and married with two children, sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for the past 3 years and is now requesting a loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and kind hearts.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: El Sr. Nicolasa  tiene 51 años de edad,  habita en Healeah un barrio de la capital de Managua, madre soltera de un hijo de 19 años de edad,    que está estudiando en la universidad y en su tiempo libre le ayuda a su madre. Trabaja de sol a sol en el molino, venta nacatamales, tortilla, cosa de horno y chicharrón desde hace quince años, iniciando con capital propio y con su trabajo ha logrado que su hijo haya llegado a la universidad. Sus planes son componer la estructura del molino y construir una chimenea par mejor confort en la elaboración de sus productos. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic sus planes de  un negocio grande y fuerte será culminado y tendrá para ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 51 years old, lives in the Healeah district of the capital Managua. She has a 19-year-old son who studies at the university and helps her mother in his free time. Nicolasa works at a mill day in, day out and has been selling nacatamals (stuffed corn dumplings), tortilla, baked goods and chicharrones (pork cracklings) for 15 years. She started her business with her own capital and has achieved with her work that her son can go to university. She plans to repair the structure of the mill and build a chimney to be able to prepare the dishes in a more comfortable way. Thanks to the loans of Afodenic she will be able to achieve her plans of a big and strong business and would be able to provide a better future to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Edit Pecsi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material to improve the structure of her mill

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr: Abou L. est un bijoutier trés connu au marché central (Boucotte) de Ziguinchor. Ce pére de famille travaille dans ce secteur depuis une vingtaine d'années. Grâce à ses revenus, il assume les charges faliliales. Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son business.
texts.en:
Abou L. is a well-known jeweler in the central market (Boucotte) of Ziguinchor. This father of a family has been working in this field for approximately 20 years. Thanks to his revenues, he provides for his family. He's seeking this loan to bolster his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his business

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka tiene 37 años, hace 23 años que viene conviviendo con su pareja, y fruto de ese amor tiene 4 hijos, esta familia vive en su casa propia. Tiene un negocio de cabinas públicas de Internet y servicio de fotocopias, el que realiza en un local de su padre, por ser un lugar céntrico y atractivo. Cuan empezó no tenia mucha competencia y ganaba muy bien, pero últimamente han aumentado sus competidores, debido a ello ha bajado su nivel de ingresos, pero está contenta porque algunos de sus clientes que se habían ido a la competencia han regresado. Es por ello que en este negocio se mantiene más de 15 años, todo este tiempo logró superara las dificultades cuando se malograban sus fotocopiadora y no tenía cómo repararlas, entonces fue ahí que su esposo se vio forzado en tratar de solucionar las maquinas. Forzado a tratar de arreglar las máquinas, su esposo comenzó a ver sus fallas y ahora ya es técnico de fotocopiadoras y experto en realizar las limpiezas de sus computadoras. Desde entonces es el encargado del servicio técnico y a veces también, le traen sus vecinos sus computadoras para que les cargue algunos programas, y este servicio les sirve como ingreso adicional. Milka está muy contenta porque a pesar que es tiempo de vacaciones escolares, cuando baja su clientela, su negocio le es rentable, a la semana logran sacar líquido 300 soles, mientras que en épocas de clases llega hasta 500 o 580 soles por semana. Milka es una socia muy comprometida con su banco comunal en el que viene desempeñando el cargo de tesorera, y ya tiene dos préstamos consecutivos que viene recibiendo de MFP, y todo este tiempo ha pagado sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. El dinero que ha solicitado es para la compra de papel, de repuestos para sus fotocopiadoras y computadoras y el toner para las fotostáticas.
texts.en:
Milka is 37 years old and has been living with her partner for 23 years. They have four children and live in their own place. Milka has her own public internet and xerox machine business. She runs her business from her father's place, mainly because its located in a good spot and its appealing to the eyes.

She didn't have much competition before but this has changed as of some years ago. Her earnings have gone down but she's happy because some of her former clients have returned.

They have kept this business for over 15 years and her husband has been forced to learn all about repairs for these machines. He has become a technician and is an expert at keeping these machines clean. Since then he's the service technician and even uploads programs for his neighbors! This brings him an additional allowance.

Milka is very happy although students are on vacation and her number of customers goes down. Her business is rentable and she's able to get 300 soles a week. Sometimes during the school year she is able to make somewhere from 500to 580 soles a week. Milka is a commited partner to her bank, which she has been serving as a treasurer. She has been receiving two loans from MFP and has been making the payments on time. The loan she is requesting is to be used to purchase paper and toner for the copier machine.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper and toner for her copier machine

loans.name: Basurat

texts.en: Basurat sells provisions like noodles, candles, bathing soap, detergent, etc. She is a LAPO client and she is the leader of her lending group. She is 50 years old and she is married with 5 children. She lives in Ogbomosho, Oyo state, Nigeria. She says thanks to Kiva lenders and Lapo microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mil

texts.en:
Y. is 47 years old and a resident of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has two children: one is married and lives separately, and the other one is single and works as a construction worker. She is married to Lim, 46, who is a local construction foreman. Y. is a local farmer and has been working in this field since 1987.

She earns a good income because she has a lot of experience in her work. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. Recently, she became tired of hiring her neighbor's oxen to plow her farmland. So Y. is requesting a loan to buy a pair of oxen to plow her farmland and rent in her neighborhood.

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen to plow the farmland and rent in the neighborhood

loans.name: Sadiya

texts.en:
Sadiya J. is currently in the business of selling clothes and bedsheets. She is requesting a loan to build a shop. Sadiya is 21 years old and married; her husband is a soldier. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Rose Akyini

texts.en:
Rose Akyini O. is a 33-year-old mother of four children, the youngest is 5 and the oldest is 17. She sells used clothes in the Nyamasaria slum, where she also lives. All her children are in school, but as a widow (her husband died in 2006), she is supporting her family herself. Her business is the source of all her income and the highest cost for her is transporting her goods. She would like Kiva lenders to know that her living standard is probably lower compared to theirs, that food security is weak and that it is hard to send her children to school due to lack of funds. She is asking for 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more clothing stock.

Rose recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Yen Pich, 39, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters, all of whom attend school. Her husband has been driving a horse and cart in his village for one year.

Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver for nineteen years; she sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase silk to continue her silk weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for her weaving business.

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.ru: Тошпулотов  Мансуржон - мужчина 32-х лет, женат,  имеет 3-х  детей.   Он  занимается  куплей  и  продажей  скота  на  скотном  рынке  Спитаменского  района.  Мансуржон  кредитуется  у  нас  больше  двух  лет.  Его  жена  Джураева  Мархабо  занимается  переработкой  и  продажей  молока  и  тем  самым  пополняет  семейный  бюджет.  За  счёт  нашего  нового  кредита  эта  молодая  семья  планирует  купить  дойную  корову  с  телёнком.  Мансуржон  благодарен  нашим  кредиторам  за  помощь  в  осуществлении  его  планов  и  рекомендует  нашу  организацию  своим  знакомым.
texts.en:
Mansurjon T. is a 32 year old man with a wife and three children. He works in livestock trading at the Spitamensk district livestock market. Mansurjon has been our client for over two years. His wife Marhabo Juraeva processes and sells milk to earn income for the family. The young family plans to use the new loan to buy a dairy cow with a calf. Mansurjon is grateful to the lenders for helping him fulfil his plans. He recommends this organization to his friends.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Antonio Florencio

texts.en:
Antonio, a long-time client of the Fundación Paraguaya, is 64 years old, married with six older children and fourteen grandchildren. Three of his children work in Spain. He lives 10 kilometers outside of San Lorenzo and comes to the city every day to buy merchandise for his small grocery store. He owns the oldest grocery store in the neighborhood, which has been very successful.

Antonio does not wish to expand anymore or call attention to his store, as he lives in a dangerous neighborhood. He is very thankful to the Fundación Paraguaya for his loan, as it has supported his business and helped it grow.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise (dairy products, breads, beverages in general)

loans.name: Jacqueline Javiera

texts.es: La Joven Jacqueline Javiera T. Martínez tiene la edad de 32 años, es una joven soltera. Jacqueline se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por su familia, ya que su Mama estaba muy enferma y tenía que recurrir a una fuente de ingresos para sufragar los gastos, por lo que decide incursionar en el negocio ofreciendo a sus amistades pantalones y camisas, por lo que su ayuda fueron los financiamientos ya que el ayudaron a incrementar su inventario y sabe que son muy importantes para su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, ropa y calzado. El deseo de Jacqueline es ofrecerle a sus clientes el mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Javiera T. Martínez, a young, single woman, is 32 years old. She sells general merchandise and has done so for more than 11 years. She began her business for the sake of her family; her mother was very sick, and Jacqueline had to find a source of income to defray expenses. She decided to begin her business by offering pants and shirts to her friends. Loans helped her to begin and have helped her increase her inventory. She knows that the ability to increase inventory is very important to her business. She requests this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, clothing, and footwear for her business. Her wish is to offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta is a 32-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Two are schooling and the last baby is still breastfeeding. She is a food vendor and sells banku with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Atta wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She also runs a grocery shop alongside the food production. She hopes to raise increased income so her business can include the sale of cereals in bags to her customers. She has been in business for five years now and believes that the loan will boost her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Las Cruces Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Cruces lo integran Ana de los Ángeles A., Jahaira Esmeralda G. y Brenda S. Rodríguez. Estas tres mujeres provenientes del municipio de Nindirí y de muy bajos recursos  ya han trabajado en conjunto  con Adim lo que le ha otorgado   mayores oportunidades para su negocio y su familia. 

En la actualidad ellas desean seguir trabajando pero para ello necesitan de capital para invertir en la compra de productos para sus negocios respectivamente como  cosméticos (desodorante, cremas, champú, pinturas) y en productos para la realización de comida como el nacatamal, la fritanga y helados.

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Ana de los Ángeles A. de 33 años de edad que hace cuatro años  inicio con la producción y venta  en pequeña escala de  helados (mamon, leche, nancite, coco) chiverías y nacatamales que es una comida típica de Nicaragua y es parte de la dieta del fin de semana.   Ella es madre de tres hijos de las edades  6, 11 y 15 años y que necesita de capital para seguir trabajando.

 De la misma manera su compañera de grupo Brenda S. Rodríguez que tiene tres años de tener una fritangueria que uno de los negocios más rentables pero que necesitan de mayor inversión y trabajo.
Mientras Jahaira Esmeralda G. vende cosméticos de tipo más comercial y accesible  como champú, desodorante, cremas, pinturas y tintes entre otros los cuales distribuye en su comarca.
texts.en:
Ana de los Ángeles A., Jahaira Esmeralda G. and Brenda S. Rodríguez are members of the the Las Cruces group. These three women are from the municipality of Nindirí. Although they have limited resources, their businesses and families have benefited from opportunities previously provided by ADIM. In order to continue working, they need capital to invest in the purchase of products for their businesses. These products include cosmetics (deodorant, creams, shampoo, make-up) and products used for preparing dishes such as “nacatamales,” “fritangas” and ice cream. Ana de los Ángeles A. is the group coordinator. Four years ago, she began her business as a small-scale production and sale of ice cream (made of “mamon”, milk, “nancite”, and coconut), "chiverías," and "nacatamales," typical Nicaraguan foods often consumed on weekends. Ana de los Ángeles is 33 years old and the mother of three children aged 6, 11, and 15. She needs capital to support her business. Likewise, another group member, Brenda S. R., has operated a “fritangueria” for the last three years. It is a profitable business that requires ongoing investment and hard work. The third group member, Jahaira Esmeralda G., sells commercial-type cosmetics such as deodorant, creams, make-up and dyes that she distributes in her region.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to support their businesses: variety of cosmetics and ingredients for typical dishes such as fritangas and nacatamales.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi is a member of the zizi la ngombe borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 38 years old woman,she is married and a mother of  children.Her children are aged  and  years.she also cares for 1 dependent.

Tausi started her own business selling tomatoes,anions,banana 1 year ago,she works  hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately , Tanzania shillings.

This is Tausi first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more banana,tomatoes etc.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Tausi hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tpmatoes,banana,onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a selection of clothing

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 32 years old. She is married to Jose and they are living in the rural village of Bantay Solana, Cagayan with their children.  Their three children are: Angelica – 11 years old, Jenina – 10 years old and Jhun – 2 years old.  Her two eldest children are already in the elementary level. 

lea own and manages a small store in front of their house and it is open from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 in the evening.  She hopes that her store will become progressive and in order to do this, she wanted to apply for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000. Her dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman in their community motivated Lea to work hard and save for the education of her children. Lea wanted them to finish their studies, thus she is doing her best to provide them with good education by managing her business well.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Eyoudaenan Tchilabalo K.

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de cartes de recharge cellulaire; il a débuté cette activité il y a de cela deux ans et cela lui permet de se prendre en charge et donc de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. C’est un vendeur ambulant de cartes dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé ; il vend aussi ses cartes à domicile dans la soirée. Il est bien connu de son voisinage et a des clients fidèles qu’il approvisionne en cartes de recharges. C’est pour disposer de nouveaux stocks qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter des cartes de recharge Togocel et illico. Il est célibataire sans en enfant.
texts.en:
This man sells cell phone refill cards in order to generate revenue. He started this business two years ago and it allows him to handle his own business and to provide for his own needs. He is a traveling salesman, selling the refill cards throughout the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. He also sells the cards from his house in the evening. He is well-known in his neighborhood and his clients faithfully supply themselves with recharge cards from him. In order to have have access to new stocks, he is requesting a loan from the micro-finance group WAGES, in order to purchase Togocel and Illico brand cellphone refill cards. He is single and has no children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase phone credit refill cards

loans.name: Nazirhan

texts.en:
Nazirhan B. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His three children, two sons and a daughter, all attend a local secondary school. 

B. operates a livestock selling business in his province. He travels up to 200 km from his town to sell livestock throughout the province. In Mongolia it is common for a household to buy at least one cow and 10 sheep to be eaten during the long Mongolian winters. For that reason, B.'s business is particularly busy during October and November. 

B. started his livestock business in 2004 and has had steady growth over the years. To supplement his income, he also owns three cows that can produce up to 3 liters of milk per day. His wife sells the milk for 1,800 tugurugs (~1 USD) per liter. Selling livestock is hard work and B. works diligently to raise quality animals. He even produces all the hay necessary to feed his animals. He hopes to continue his success and says, "All I want is to save enough money for my children's education." He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora has been married for 23 years. She is 48 years old and she has two children.  She works as a dairy cow farmer and sells the milk that her cows produce to Pil, a large local dairy company.  She learned dairy farming over 27 years ago when she worked alongsiD. her parents.

With this loan, Leonora plans to purchase chopped cornhusk to feed her cattle.  This investment is very important as Cochabamba has been suffering from a major drought and the prices of livestock feed have skyrocketed.  Leonora's main goal is to continue funding both of her children's education.  Her older son is studying agriculture at the university and will help her run the farm when he finishes.  Her younger son spends his mornings helping Leonora on the farm and goes to school in the afternoons.

loans.use: To purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers pour aider leur mari. 
Ces femmes ont intégrés  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont  à leur premier  prêt solidaire et comptent l’utiliser pour acheter, une grande quantité de fruits et légumes et  divers articles de commerce. Les articles divers sont achetés à Bamako, quant aux fruits et légumes ils sont achetés sur place et dans les villages environnants. 
Elles font leurs ventes, en détail au comptant et à crédit, sur place à Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 49 900FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djekadi are married women averaging 37 years of age and 4 children each.  With their husband and children, they live in large traditional families and reside in the city of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali. The women know one another by ties of community and kinship.  They do commerce in a variety of goods to help their husband. These women joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of preserving their lucrative businesses.  They are on their first solidarity loan and intend to use it to buy a large quantity of fruit and vegetables and various commercial goods.  The various goods are bought in Bamako.  As for the fruit and vegetables, these are bought locally and in surrounding villages.  Sales are made retail in cash or on credit, locally in Dioïla, to customers composed of women and men.   The group members envision realizing a monthly profit of 49,900 francs CFA per person.  A portion of the profits will be reinvested into business, and the other portion will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. is from the village of Gango, Ozamis City. She is 52 years old, a widow, and has four adult children. Linda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business, selling a variety of products to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Linda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Linda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products for sale

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia C. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 31 years old. Leticia is married and has children. To make a living, Leticia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock (pigs). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Leticia has been engaged in her business for several and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna Y. is 21 and single, and lives with his mother and sisters and brothers on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Veasna has been a wooden house builder for two years. He works in his village. He is in the process now of building his own new house, but it is not finished yet. He is requesting a loan of $600 to complete the job.

loans.use: To add to his own money to finish his house building.

loans.name: Cyrielle

texts.fr: Née le 18 Mars 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, G. Cyrielle vit depuis environs 25 ans au quartier Dédokpo à Cotonou. Cyrielle est une jeune divorcée ayant un enfant à charge et qui est scolarisé. Cyrielle vit seule avec son enfant et assure les charges de son enfant. Cyrielle n’a fait que l’école primaire. Il y a quatre ans environs, Cyrielle a commencé la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, plats, bols, sceaux et paniers en plastique) par le système de distribution. Cette activité génère des revenus que Cyrielle utilise pour assurer l’entretien et l’éducation de son enfant. Cyrielle achète ses produits au Nigéria et au Togo, deux pays limitrophes du Bénin. Cyrielle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Cyrielle ambitionne renforcer son capital et agrandir son étalage ; ce qui lui permettra de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Cyrielle sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born on 18th March 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Cyrielle G. has lived for around 25 years in the Dédokpo neighborhood of Cotonou. She is a young divorced woman with one child in her care, who is at school. Cyrielle lives alone with her child and covers the child's expenses. Cyrielle has only been to primary school. About four years ago she started selling kitchenware (ice-boxes, plates, bowls, seals and plastic washing baskets) through the distribution system. This activity generates income that Cyrielle uses to cover the upkeep and education of her child. Cyrielle buys her products in Nigeria and Togo, two countries which border Bénin. She is an old client of ALIDé who repays her loans without problem. Much in demand from her customers, Cyrielle's ambition is to strengthen her capital and expand her display of goods; this will allow her to meet the ever rising demand. It is the reason for which she is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ice-boxes, bowls, sets of plates and plastic washing bowls

loans.name: D.g.

texts.en:
R. is a 38-year-old woman living with her husband and their four children. Her husband is a local bus driver.

They have a piece of land and on this land R. grows spices. She wants to extend her cinnamon garden and grow more cinnamon so that she can earn more money to support her family.

R. hopes to ensure her children’s education in the future with this additional income.

loans.use: To purchase more cinnamon plants

loans.name: C1166 Intambwe Group

texts.en:
Thelesphore is 29 years old and is married with two children who are 7 and 2 years old. He and his family live in the Gicumbi district, a region of Byumba situated in the Northern Province of Rwanda. From here to Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda, it is a one-hour drive.

Thelesphore is the leader of this group, which consists of eight members; this group is called Intambwe. He and his team are known for a business selling foodstuffs, mainly Irish potatoes, potatoes, beans, rice, etc. The hours of the business are from 7 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

After five years of experience in the business of selling foodstuffs, Thelesphore and his team are requesting a Kiva loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. They want to add a large quantity of wheat, Irish potatoes, etc., in order to expand their business.

With this loan, Thelesphore and his team expect to earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to supply all the basic needs for their families. In addition, Telesphore and his team plan to save for the future reinvestment in their business.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 41años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rodolfo de 43 años y sus 6 hijos.
El secreto para que su restaurante tenga muchos clientes es la buena sazón que tiene, además está ubicado en una zona estratégica, en plena plaza principal de su localidad ,y sólo tiene como competencia a dos señoras que venden comida afuera de su casa
