Le encanta cocinar, por lo que prepara los alimentos muy de mañana para abrir temprano las puertas de su restaurante llamado “El buen sabor de la tía Juliana”. Paralelamente, atiende su tienda de comestibles desde hace 2 años; mientras que su esposo, desde hace 9 años, se dedica al cultivo de café, plátano y maíz, actividades muy rentables que les permite vivir cómodamente.
Por ello, ambos vienen ahorrando para que en el futuro puedan comprar un carro, con el cuál trabaje su esposo transportando personas y los productos que cosecha.  

Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y entre risas confiesa que le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal porque comparte nuevas experiencias con los integrantes que hace su grupo más unido. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita pretende comprar los insumos necesarios para preparar sus comidas (desayuno, almuerzo y cena) diarias.
texts.en:
Olga is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Rodolfo (age 43) and their six children. The secret behind why she has many customers is due to the great taste her food has. In addition, she is located in a strategic area in the middle of the town square. Her only competition comes from two ladies who sell food outside of her house.

Olga loves to cook and prepares the food in the morning so that she can open early the doors of her restaurant, which is called “El Buen Sabor de la Tía Juliana” (The Great Flavor of Aunt Juliana). At the same time, she has been managing a grocery store for two years. Meanwhile, her husband has been growing coffee, bananas, and corn for nine years. Their activities are very profitable and allow them to live comfortably. Both of them are saving so that they can purchase a car in the future that her husband will use to transport passengers as well as the products that he harvests.

This is her second loan with MFP. With laughter Olga admits that she likes working with her Communal Bank because she shares new experiences with the other members, which brings them closer as a group. With this loan of 2000 PEN that she requested, Olga will buy needed supplies for preparing breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries & ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba M. M., tiene 76 años y vive con su hijo que trabaja,  en el barrio 7 de Abril ubicado en el Sur Occidente de Barranquilla.  Ella vende en su enfriador refrescos como Boli, hielo, bolsas de agua por un lado y   mercancías variadas por otro;justamente solicita $1.000.000 para comprar refrescos y mercancias como toallas, cubrelechos y conjuntos femeninos especialmente. 
Su negocio empezó cuando en el año 1975 se vino a vivir en Barranquilla procedente de Caucasia, en el Departamento de Antioquia, donde vivía y se ganaba la vida lavando ajeno y su cónyuge trabajaba como jornalero. Al llegar a Barranquilla, se radicó en el barrio Galán donde continuó con el mismo trabajo, hasta después de 4 años que su hija mayor   le pide que se vaya a vivir con ella,  para  ayudarla a cuidar su casa, porque esta trabajaba viajando; con su traslado al barrio 7 de Abril, donde empezó a vivir con su hija empieza a vender refrescos como cerveza  y gaseosas en lugares de alto trayectoria comercial; una vez comienzó a irle bien, vende su casa del barrio galán y se radicó definitivamente en 7 de Abril comprando una mejora cerca de su hija; es en este barrio y en su nueva  casa , donde  aprovechando su cercanía a escenarios deportivos como una cancha de futbol, empezó a vender refrescos como gaseosas, cervezas, pony malta y gradualmente fue adicionándole a su negocio la venta de mercancía variada.
Desde hace 5 años ha recibido con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo 5 prestamos, estos le han ayudado a continuar trabajando y capitalizándose para sostener sus gastos personales. Su meta es arreglar su enfriador que funciona en un 50% , poner rejas en su casa para protegerse de las pelotas que caen en su casa cuando juegan
texts.en:
Rosalba M. M. is 76 years old and lives with her working son. They live in the 7 de Abril neighborhood located in the south of Barranquilla. Among other products, from her refrigerator she sells products such as Boli, ice, bags of water. She is asking for 1,000,000 COP to buy drinks and other merchandise like towels, bedspreads and other products that women might like. She started her business in 1975 when she came to live in Barranquilla from Caucasia, which is in the Antioquia department. There she used to earn a living washing clothes. Her partner used to work as a day laborer. When she arrived in Barranquilla, she settled in the Galán neighborhood where she continued with the same work. Since she is elderly, four years later her eldest daughter asked her to move in with her and help her keep house. When she moved to the 7 de Abril neighborhood and began to live with her daughter, she started selling drinks like beer and soda in very commercial neighborhoods. As soon as this began to go well she sold her house in the Galán neighborhood and moved completely to the 7 de Abril neighborhood and bought a house near her daughter. Now, she lives in a new neighborhood, and a new house. Here she is able to take advantage of the fact that she lives near several sports events, like a soccer field, and sell drinks like soda, beer, a local drink called pony malta and bit by bit begin to sell other merchandise. For the last 5 years she has been a client of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has taken out five loans which has helped her to keep working and increase the capital she needs to cover her personal expenses. Her immediate desire is to fix her fridge which right now, is at 50% capacity, and to install bars on her house to protect it from the soccer balls that hit it during matches.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks and other products like bed spreads

loans.name: Aly

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aly S. est marié à une femme et est père de 6 enfants (3garçons et 3 filles). Il est né vers 1963 à Brimado et  vit dans une famille monogame avec ses enfants et son épouse à Loulouni une des sous préfecture de la préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative  de la république du Mali.
Il  fait le commerce depuis maintenant 10 ans et excelle dans l’achat et la vente de céréales. Expérimenté en raison des années dans le domaine, il le mène avec réussite et est très sollicité. 
Il est à sa première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt,  2 tonnes de maïs. Il s’approvisionne à Loulouni et dans les villages avoisinants auprès des producteurs. Il vend au comptant et souvent à crédit, en gros et en détail, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il  ambitionne construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Aly S. is married and father to six children (three boys and three girls). He was born in 1963 in Brimado and lives in a monogamous family with his children and his wife in Loulouni, one of the sub-prefectures of the prefecture of Kadiolo, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. He has been in business for ten years now and excels in the purchase and sale of cereals. As a result of the number of years he has worked in this area he is experienced, successful and in great demand. He is on his first loan from the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan he is planning on buying two tons of corn. He gets his supplies in Loulouni and from producers in neighboring villages. He sells for cash and often on credit, wholesale and retail, to a customer base made up of women and men. He envisages making a monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, of which part will be used to increase his business; he will save the rest because his ambition is to buy a house in Sikasso Town to live in.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
EL SR. EUGENIO, VIVE EN SANTA RITA A 2KM DE EL TORNO, EL NACIO EN SANTA CRUZ, VIVIO DESDE MUY NIÑO EN SANTA RITA,CONVIVE (QUE VIVE EN PAREJA PERO NO SE CASO) CON LA SEÑORA DOMINGA, TIENE 4 HIJOS MAYORES. 

EL TRABAJA EN LA AGRICULTURA, SIEMBRA PAPA Y YUCA Y TAMBIEN TIENE SU CAMIONCITO CON EL QUE TRANSPORTA SUS PRODUCTOS AL MERCADO DE LA ZONA, TAMBIEN TRABAJA TRANSPORTANDO MATERIAL DE CONSTRUCCION, PERO SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA AGRICULTURA LA TIERRA EN LA QUE EL TRABAJA  ES EN LA BANDA DEL RIO A 1500 MTRS. DE SU CASA, EN ESTE MOMENTO EL  EL TIENE YUCA PARA COSECHAR. 

ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE PENSANDO EN LE BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA SEMILLAS PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA YA QUE ES TEMPORADA DE SIEMBRA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Eugenio lives in Santa Rita, 2 kilometers from El Torno. He was born in Santa Cruz but grew up in Santa Rita. He is partnered with Dominga but they never married; he has four adult children. He is a farmer who plants potatoes and yucca (manioc) and also has a small truck that he uses to bring his products to local markets. He also works hauling construction materials and supplies; but his main commercial activity is farming. The land he farms is in Banda del Rio which is about 1500 meters from his home. He is currently getting ready to harvest yucca. He is a hard-working, responsible person who always thinks about the well-being of his family. With the loan money, he will buy seeds to plant potatoes, since planting season is approaching. He is very grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for trusting him with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La Sra. Agripina tiene  47 años, esta casada con el Sr Luis V., tienen tres  hijos, uno D. ellos es menor D. edad. 
Ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas para damas y niños a domicilio.
Trabaja en esta actividad desD. el año 2004.
Este crédito será D. mucha utilidad para ella, pues necesita comprar prendas para la nueva temporada(invierno) para cubrir los pedidos que ya recibió  e incluir también prendas para caballeros en su stock D. mercaderías, ya que sus compradoras le solicitaron tenga disponible también este tipo D. prendas. 
La Sra Agripina está iniciando el proyecto D. abrir un local D. ventas, en el cual anhela poder instruir D. la mejor forma a su hija para que la misma aprenda a ser una persona emprendedora y pueda ser exitosa en la vida.
texts.en:
Agripina is 47 years old. She is married to Luis and they have three children; one still a minor. Agripina does in-home clothing sales for women and children and has been doing this since 2004. This loan will be of great use to her because she needs to buy clothing for the coming season (winter) in order to satisfy her customers’ requests. She also wants to add men’s clothing to her inventory, because her customers have requested it. Agripina is in the process of opening a shop, where she can also teach her daughter to be entrepreneurial and allow her to excel in life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a networking type of business selling a variety of beauty products and ready-to-wear clothes. She lives in Barangay Landangue, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental with her husband and their five adult children. Victoria has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her networking business selling beauty products and ready-to-wear clothes, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000. Victoria is now borrowing Php 28,000 so that she can continue sustaining her business activities. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Victoria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: Muniratu M. sells provisions at Abura. She is married and has a child. She has received a senior high education. Muniratu has been dealing in these things for six years now. Her husband is a vulkanizer (he fixes car tires). Muniratu uses her income to help her husband provide the general needs of their home. Muniratu will use the loan to buy more provisions to fill her shop. With the new income from her extended business, Muniratu plans to save to open a new shop in a different location.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to fill her shop.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is a 42-year-old woman and has been a member of ASHI (KIVA's first field partner in the Philippines) for five years. Delia is supporting the financial needs of her two children in high school and she hopes to sustain their education until they graduate from college. Presently, she works hard to give them a better kind of life as much as she can give. Delia feels fortunate that she has able to avail loans through ASHI. The loan enabled her to put up her own business and to generate her own income. The proceeds she gets out of her hog raising and native bag making businesses enables her to augment the small and sporadic income of her hired laborer husband. 

Delia has undergone an operation due to an ovarian tumor. However, her health condition could not alter her desire to make her businesses stable and profitable. For as long as she is a member of ASHI and she can avail loans to be invested in her businesses, she will never lose hope of giving her family a comfortable life and a brighter future. Presently, she can still manage to sell her products and grow her piglets. With the love and support of her family, her outlook in life is always positive.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for bag weaving and a small portion will be used to purchase piglets for her hog raising businesses.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a farmer from the town of Kisii in Western Kenya. He has been farming for over 20 years and has employed one farm-hand. His products are maize, bananas, beans, milk and tea which he sells to other retailers. He also makes and sells bricks to the local market.

Ezekiel is 48 years old. He is married with 6 children between the ages of 14 and 27. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. He says that this dairy cow will produce enough milk to improve the nutrition of the family and earn income from the sale of milk. This income will enable him to educate his children and provide for the basic needs of the family.

His main challenges have been lack of technical knowledge on disease and pest control, lack of storage facilities and proper markets for his products. He hopes, however, to open a retail shop and sell his cereals in wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive en el sector Colera del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, situado en la región del mismo nombre, la zona se ubica a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chicayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores ligadas a la agricultura, específicamente a las de crianza y venta de animales: el cría aves de corral en su domicilio y las ofrece en venta cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo, adicionalmente trabaja como agricultor ya que cuenta con una pequeña plantación de limón, cabe resaltar que la zona es bastante conocida por producir diversas frutas para exportación.

Elmer desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas aves y alimento balanceado con el cual se puedan desarrollar de mejor manera y puedan ser vendidas a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Elmer es un padre trabajador y que dia a dia da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive es conocido por ser una persona honesta y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a los demas.
texts.en:
Elmer, 43, is married and has three children. He lives in the Colera sector, a farming district of Tambogrande which is a district in Piura province, Piura region. The area is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. He works in farming-related tasks, specifically animal-raising. He raises barnyard fowl at home and then sells them when they reach an ideal level of development. In addition, he works as a farmer because he has a small lemon crop. It’s worth mentioning that this area is quite well known as a fruit for export producing region. Elmer would like to expand his business buying more fowl and nutritionally balanced feed for them so that they will develop better and thus be sold for a higher price. To reach this goal he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a 500 new sol. Elmer is a hard working father who daily gives his best to help his family succeed. In the area where he lives he is known for being an honest person who is always willing to help out others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
A 40-year-old married mother of eight, Malia T. has owned a business catching and selling ocean fish for four years. In 2008, Malia joined SPBD and is now requesting her third loan for the amount of WST$1500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 360 talas or US $150 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family. SPBD's loans are Malia's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's lending philosophy is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma O. is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Emma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana R. R. es una señora de 52 años, hace poco  tiempo se dio cuenta de que es  una execelente vendedora, por lo tanto se unió a una red de  vendedoras de artículos personales, esto le ha ayudado a superarse y a mantener su familia.
Ella vive en la comunidad de Canalete de Alajuela, una zona  conocida por su maravillosa vista al cerro Miravalles y  especialmente por el liderazgo  y valentía  que caracterizan   las mujeres que la habitan. 
Doña Ana  necesita un Crédito de ¢600 000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de mercadería  como ropa para Hombre, ropa para mujer, Cosméticos y artículos para el hogar.
Ella    es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Ana R. R. is 52 years old. A little while ago, she realized she is an excellent saleswoman, so she joined a network of women who sell personal items. This has helped her to excel and to support her family. She lives in Alajuela's Canalete community, an area known for its beautiful view of the Miravalles volcano and especially for the leadership and courage of the women who live there. Doña Ana needs a loan of 600,000 colones to purchase merchandise such as men's clothing, women's clothing, cosmetics and items for the home. She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete (Canalete Communal Loan Company), one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to continue growing personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, cosmetics, items for the home

loans.name: Volodymyr

texts.en:
Volodymyr is married with two teenage children. He is a businessman from Skvira. Volodymyr raises poultry, i.e. chickens, geese, ducks and turkeys, and sells them in the local grocery market. 

He used to have an old car that he used to transport poultry to the market. Recently Volodymyr managed to purchase a van for that specific purpose. It is more spacious, which allows Volodymyr to bring and sell more poultry every time. Volodymyr has been in the market for eight years. He has already invested more than 80,000 Grivnyas in his venture. His monthly net profit is usually less than 10,000 Grivnyas.  

Volodymyr is requesting a loan of 21,000 Grivnyas to construct a chicken coop and repair the engine of his van that he uses for poultry transportation. Volodymyr is planning to construct a chicken coop as it is much cheaper to have one than to rent one. Rent would cost him another 2,000 Grivnyas in expenses every month. Volodymyr’s wife is actively helping him run the business.

loans.use: to construct a chicken coop and repair the engine of his van

loans.name: Agenes

texts.en: Agenes K. is 32 years old, married, with no children.  Her husband is a peasant.  Agenes is currently in the business of selling charcoal  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal for sale.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. is a twenty eight year old shoe seller in Kongowea Mombasa.  He is married to Ann Waithaka who is a business woman.  Together they are blessed with three children.

Samuel has been in this business for the last seven years and he is doing well with a good income. As a member of KADET he is requesting his second loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more shoes for resale.  He plans on using the anticipated profit to open up another shoe store in another part of Mombasa town.  He hopes to grow his business into a shoe importing firm in the future and see his family succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is engaged in running a grocery store selling household items (canned goods, rice, etc.) She has been in business for 15 years and earns a monthly net income of 4000 Php. Teresita is from the village of Balasdiot, part of the Municipality of Baliangao. She is 58 years old, married, and blessed with 3 adult children.

In 2009, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting her 1st loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock for the store to sell.
  
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase new stock

loans.name: Joelle M.

texts.fr: Joëlle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Dotée d'une expérience d'au moins 2 ans, Joëlle vend divers articles tels que tomates en boîtes, sardines, mayonnaises, boissons, savons et autres à son domicile sise à Cocotomey, un quartier populeux sis à la banlieue ouest du Bénin. Ses clients sont constitués des ménages de la zone et de ses environs. Elle s'approvisionne chez les grossistes à Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin. Elle sollicite et obtient un micro crédit à FINADEV pour achalander son étalage de ces divers articles en quantité suffisante et en qualité appréciable afin de pouvoir combler l'attente de ses clients qui ne cesse de s'agrandir au jour le jour. Puisque la dépense familiale revient au couple; avec le revenu supplémentaire que va générer ce micro crédit elle pourra mieux faire face à ses charges personnelles et aussi contribuer convenablement à l'épanouissement de sa famille. Joëlle souhaiterait ouvrir plupart une autre boutique dans les environs.
texts.en:
Joëlle is married and the mother of three children. Benefiting from at least two years' experience, Joëlle sells various items such as tinned tomatoes, sardines, mayonnaise, drinks, soap, etc. out of her house located in Cocotomey, a working class neighborhood in the western suburbs of Bénin. Her customers come from the households in her neighborhood and surrounding areas. She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Tokpa, the international market of Bénin. 

She has requested and has been granted a small loan from FINADEV to replenish her shelves with these various articles in sufficient quantity and of good enough quality so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers whose numbers are daily growing. 

The couple share in supporting their family, so with the additional income that this small loan should generate, she will be in a better position to cover her personal expenses and also contribute appropriately to improving the living conditions of her family. 

Apart from these goals, Joëlle would like to be able to open up another little shop in her area.

loans.use: stocking up on foodstuffs to sell in her little shop

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is 35 years-old and married with three children.  He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda and has the aspiration to educate his children. He deals in spare parts and has been in business for six years.  His dream is to have at least four shops as the venture is very profitable. Steven needs the loan in order to buy spare parts for sale.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: La Reforma 3 Group

texts.en:
Catalina is the coordinator of her group named La Reforma 3 (Reform). She has a long term partner and is a mother with 7 children, all living with her in a simple structure home, in a rural villa of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity here is the free trading zone, a cement factory, and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. 

Catalina has been operating clothing sales for aproximately 10 years. She saved a small amount of capital and started her business. She plans to use this loan to buy jeans, shirts, underwear and other clothing pieces for both men and women. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, like her other eight loans. She wants to have a successful business with employees. This is currently her most difficult challenge and her goal. By making her business more successful, she will have the opportunity to have a better life and to help others.

In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to read and watch television. Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tawopaneh” group. They are small business owners based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sayma K., who is pictured in the first row on the left. Sayma is forty years old.  He was born in Kambia town but currently resides in Makeni with his wife and two children. His wife is a businesswoman.  His children are not yet of school-going age. 

For twenty-five years, Sayma has been selling used clothing. With his share of this loan, he will buy bales of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes

loans.name: Namanve Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
28-year-old Mariam N. runs a beauty salon enterprise, which has now been in existence for the past 5 years in Kazinga-Mukono. She credits a close friend with talking her into setting forth in this business.  Her friend had to prevail to talk her out of her erstwhile retail business. 

Mariam comes across as a courteous, hardworking, and determined lady who says she wants the best in terms of welfare for her family of 5 kids and her husband. Mariam says her business generates for her 250,000 shillings monthly.  With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more cosmetics and other hair products for use in her beauty salon. 

Mariam belongs to Namanve Development group-Mukono. The person seated in the back on the computers is a credit officer.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila T. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 61 years old. Priscila is married and has 11 adult children. To make a living, Priscila owns & operates a small retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Priscila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Priscila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Priscila is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Priscila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy- Baybay Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy was born in 1952. She is married to Mr. Lor. They are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land where they can grow both rice and vegetables that they sell to earn some money to support their family. She is a pig breeder, too. They support two children who are students and they are helping their parents’ businesses.

In the rice field, they have some problems because their field is infertile and far away from the irrigation system. It also has a lot of insects. So to improve production of rice, Mrs. Suy is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide. With the rest of the loan she is going to buy more pig food. 

Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticide

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en: Neckson is a thirty year-old married man with three children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in his retail shop for ten years after raising money from farming.  His hardships include debtors, price fluctuation and high transport costs.  His vision is a wholesale business and educating his children.  Neckson needs the loan to buy iron sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets (roofing) to sell.

loans.name: Zafarjo

texts.en:
M. Zafarjon is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Zafarjon is the sole breadwinner and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers.  Zafarjon would like to expand his business, as the income from his existing herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $1000 USD in his business. Zafarjon has applied for a loan for this amount from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle to expand the business and improve his family's living conditions

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité se inició gracias a la señora Gladys F., domiciliada en el Barrio Niño Jesús distante a 22km de la oficina de Carapeguá.
“Renacer” fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en el ciclo Nro. 14 con 15 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican a diversas actividades tales como: venta de lencerías, venta de comidas, despensa, venta de ropas, etc.
Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad independiente a los que se refiere al cuidado de su familia.
Las mujeres agradecen a la Fundacion Paraguaya por la iniciativa ya que mediante ella lograron desarrollar bastante  su capacidad de trabajo en equipo.
La Sra. Crescencia se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar su bolsa para salir a vender. La venta lo realiza de forma ambulante y ahora mediante créditos anteriores lo realiza en una motocicleta.
La Sra. Crescencia agradece de manera especial a la Fundacion por que mediante el apoyo brindado por la misma pudo adquirir más capital y aumentar su negocio, pero ahora solicita el crédito nuevamente para adquirir más ropas que vender y crear su propio salón de venta de ropas.
texts.en:
This group was started thanks to Ms. Gladys F., who lives in the Niño Jesús neighborhood, some 22 km away from the Carapeguá office.

The group was named Renacer, and it is currently in its 14th loan cycle. This group is comprised of 15 very hardworking and responsible women who sell things like lingerie, food, groceries, and apparel, among other goods.

Some of the women already had a job before joining the group, nevertheless, they joined because they wanted to improve their businesses. Other members, however, are working for the first time, not counting looking after their families.

These women thank Fundacion Paraguaya for the help because with it, they have been able to develop their work skills as a team.

Ms. Crescencia has been selling apparel for several years. She gets up very early in the morning to go out and sell her merchandise. She is a street vendor, and now, because of her previous loans, she uses a motorcycle for work.

Ms. Crescencia would like to give special thanks to Fundacion Paraguaya because with their help, she has been able to increase her capital and expand her business, but she is once again requesting a loan so that she can obtain more apparel and set up her own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase winter apparel and obtain a business space.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 37 years old and has four children, two of whom go to school. 

Angelina is requesting a loan in order to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future using the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to offer for sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y es madre de un niño, ella tiene 30 años de edad y vive junto a su pareja en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco, Perú.  Este lugar se caracteriza por ser un sector turístico, ganadero, agrícola y por estar habitado de gente emprendedora que se identifica con el refrán de la localidad que dice: “Provincia Arqueológica del Perú"”.

Con más de 14 años de experiencia como profesora y actualmente trabaja en el colegio de la comunidad de Palcaraqui de la ciudad de Urubamba y la podemos encontrar cumpliendo su deberes en el colegio desde las 7h00 hasta las 15h00 de lunes a viernes, Carmen también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Carmen solicita un préstamo a Asociación Arariwa de 500 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar más animales como por ejemplo gallinas para poder tener un mayor capital. Esto le permitirá expandir su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para el bienestar de su único hijo.

Carmen cuenta con buena reputación en Asociación Arariwa, pues con anterioridad éste ha tenido varios créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Carmen was born in the city of Urubamba. She is the mother of a child. She is 30 years old and lives with her partner in a house located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, Perú. This place is characterized by being a sector of tourism, cattle-ranching, and agriculture, and for being inhabited by entrepreneurial people who identify with the slogan of the region, which is "Archaeological Province of Peru."

With more than 14 years of experience as a teacher, she now works in the school in the community of Palcaraqui in the city of Urubamba. We can find her fulfilling her duties in the school from 7 am until 3 pm from Monday to Friday. Carmen also raises small animals. She has already been in this business for 3 years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

Carmen is applying to Arariwa Association for a loan of 500 PEN, which she will use to buy more animals, such as hens, so that she will have greater capital. This will permit her to expand her business, obtaining better earnings for the well-being of her only son.

Carmen has a good reputation with Arariwa Association, since in the past she has had various loans that she has paid off with punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as hens in order to have greater capital.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a 41-year-old married man living in Malibabag, Peñablanca, Cagayan. Ricardo has three children. Ricardo's spouse works as a domestic helper. He has been in the business of motorcycle transport services for seven years and he earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. He plans to use this loan to pay for his license and for the repair of his motorcycle for better service.

In the future, Ricardo would like to have good financial management and make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to pay for his license and to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Tomas Larrea (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Tomas Larrea se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos mejoraran sus pequeños negocios.  Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Aquí  tuvimos la oportunidad de dialogar con el Señor Mauricio, tiene 40 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 14, 12 y 9 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Él se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, el viaja cada quince días a la ciudad de Esmeraldas con la finalidad de vender sus productos por esa linda provincia, nos cuenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo ya que tiene que dejar todo ese tiempo a su familia sola, pero a la vez comenta que tiene que hacerlo para poderles llevar el pan de cada día. Él para  surtir su negocio tiene que viajar hasta las ciudades de Guayaquil y Santo Domingo donde compra su mercadería. Lleva más de 20 años dedicado al comercio pues empezó desde muy joven.

Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, ropa interior y ropa de niños para surtir a su negocio.

Sus  sueños  son tener un lugar fijo donde trabajar y vender sus productos dentro de la provincia para no dejar sola a su familia por sus viajes.

La foto pequeña adjunta es una de las socias que no pudo estar presente por motivos de trabajo cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
El Tomas Larrea community bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo. This area is known for being very commercial, and for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and San Pablo as well as for the cheerfulness of its people.  

This is a group of people who decided to get together and make this community bank. It serves them very well because with the loans the improve their small businesses. They work at different activities such as business, services, and selling food, among other things. 

Here we had a chance to talk to Mauricio, who is 40 years old. He is married and has four children, aged 15, 14, 12 and 9 years old. Three of them go to school and the youngest is in elementary school.

He is a merchant and sells clothes. He sells door to door, and travels every two weeks to the city of Esmeraldas in order to sell his products in that beautiful province. He tells us his job is very hard, since he has to leave his family alone a lot of the time, but that he has to do it to get them their daily bread. To supply his business, he has to travel to the cities of Guayaquil and Santo Domingo to buy his merchandise. . He has been a merchant for more than 20 years, since he started when he was very young. 

This loan is to buy t-shirts, blouses, shorts, pants, underwear and children's clothing, to supply his business.

His dream is to have a permanent locale where he can work and sell his products in the province and not have to leave his family to travel.   

The small photo included is of one of the members who couldn't be present when the photo was taken because of work.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, shirts, pants, underwear and children's clothing.

loans.name: Marlon Rodolfo

texts.es: El joven Marlon , es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de las dispersas , junto a sus padres , los sueños del joven es poder brindarle un mejor bienestar a su familia ya que por medio de su pobreza lucha día a día para logar a ser un profesional ya que los fines de semana estudia , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es no poder contar con un capital suficiente para la mantención del cultivo de café , ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para que pueda dar una buena producción , Agradece e a Afodenic que atrávez de fon Kiva tiene un programa para el apoyo de cultivos y así la personas del campo logren trabajar sus tierras .
texts.en: Marlon is a young farmer who, together with his parents, dreams of providing the best lifestyle possible for his family.  He works every day striving to break away from poverty and become a professional, since he studies on the weekends.  His largest challenge is coming up with sufficient capital for coffee crop maintenance, since he lacks the necessary fertilizer and supplies for optimum production.  He is grateful to Afodenic which, through Kiva, offers a crop support program for people to work in their fields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with four children. Two attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. Her dream is to expand her business to wholesale in the future.

Mwaka decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase household items, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: To purchase household items, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en:
Cayetano, 58 years old and married, is a farmer who tills land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. With parents who were farmers, Cayetano has been growing rice for a long time now and also raises pigs for fattening and sale in his backyard.

Due to current financial constraints, Cayetano is requesting this loan to purchase additional rice seeds, fertilizers, and pigs. The loan will help Cayetano continue his businesses and earn more for his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pigs.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Xequemeya Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Bernardina es soltera, tiene 18 años de edad, curso el quinto años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de tacos, actualmente cuenta con un puesto donde tiene demanda su negocio de tacos, inicio este negocio con una carreta de tacos y hasta el momento tiene 7 años de experiencia, ya que empezó desde que era una niña. En el futuro espera contar con 10puestos de venta y 10 carretas, por esa razón decide solicitar préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar ingredientes para los tacos: Carnes, maíz, aceite, cebollas, tomate, etc. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades: crianza de animales, comercio y a la sastrería.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Bernardina is single and 18 years old.  She studied through the fifth year of primary education, and works in trade, selling tacos.  She currently has a food stand where she operates her taco business.  She started this business with a taco cart and so far has 7 years experience, having started when she was a child. 

In the future she hopes to have 10 food stands and 10 food carts.  For that reason she decided to apply for the loan, which she will use to buy ingredients for the tacos: beef, corn, oil, onions, tomatoes, etc.  

The other group members engage in various activities: animal husbandry, trade and tailoring.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for selling tacos.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 58 years old and lives in the municipality of Sinacaban in Misamis Occidental Province. He is married with 3 children.

To earn a living, Rudy has a business selling milkfish. He earns about 3000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Rudy has requested a loan for 9000 PHP to purchase feed for the milkfish.

Rudy has been a member of PMPC for 3 months.  In the future, Rudy would like to have bigger fish cages.

loans.use: to purchase feed for milkfish.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 53 years old. She engages in buying and selling fruits and vegetables as her primary source of income. She sells in the market every Thursday and Sunday (market day) and works in her vegetable garden for the remaining days.

She is requesting a loan amount of 9,000 PHP to buy beans, avocados and bananas as additional goods to sell. She hopes this will increase her income every market day. She dreams of getting out from poverty, so she is being industrious and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy beans, avocados and bananas as additional goods to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a farmer’s wife who engages in the selling of fruits and vegetables in their community. Because of their poor living condition she needs to work hard. She doesn’t want to depend on her husband. With further improvement to their living condition, she also helps in uplifting their lifestyle.

Rosalina is 47 years old and does not have any children at all. Since she was not blessed, she helps her nephew in school. She still pursues a life in helping others. Consequently, she is asking a loan amount P5,000 to buy cabbages, beans, squash and cucumbers as additional goods to sell.

She hopes this will lead to a boom in her income and her business to prosper. Thus she can enrich her help to her needy relative, now that she has no children.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, beans, squash and cucumbers as additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Carina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Carina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Carina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Roqueta

texts.en:
Roqueta is married with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. Roqueta requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving. In the future, she would like to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: 03.12.102.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hiền has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. Hiền is 29 years old and she is married with one child. Hiền is the group leader of the 102.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of five members.  She lives and works in Thiệu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hiền  has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes to buy land of her own, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is aged 25 and single and support his parents. He has been a wheat farmer for the past three years and earns monthly income of KES 6,000.

He learned about KADET through a registered client, and he has applied for his second loan which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to make profit and use it to purchase sheep for fattening.

He dreams that when he is thirty-five he will be stable and his future children will live better.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lider De Defensores Group

texts.es:
Dora es miembro del grupo “LIDER D. DEFENSORES”  son 09 socias que pertenecen al grupo, ella al igual que sus compañeras tienen sus propios negocios, la Sra. Dora se dedica por más D. 10 años a dos oficios  la artesanía donD. confecciona joyería hecha a mano como pulseras, argollas en hilo D. plata y cobre   también se dedica a la costura confecciona manteles, cortinas, set D. cocinas etc. Estos oficios los aprendió asistiendo a cursos libres y  le sirven para poD. brindarle a su única hija una mejor calidad D. vida con sus ahorros pudo comprarle una computadora algo que le había prometido si ingresaba a la universidad, estos son algunas D. las satisfacciones que le da su trabajo y eso la hace sentir feliz con su nuevo préstamo  comprara telas, hilos y paño lenci para empezar a confeccionar productos para las fiestas naviD.ñas sus clientas le han pedido manteles naviD.ños, pie D. arboles etc. 
 
*Dora es la primera D. las paradas viste blusa blanca y negra.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Líder D. Defensores group.  There are nine members in the group.  She and her fellow members have their own businesses.

Dora has worked for more than ten years at two jobs.  In handicrafts she makes jewelry such as bracelets and rings in silver and copper wire.  She also works as a seamstress making tablecloths, curtains, kitchen coordinates, etc.

Dora learned these jobs attending free classes, and they allow her to be able to offer her only daughter a better quality of life.  With her savings she managed to buy her a computer, something she had promised her if she enrolled in the university.  These are some of the satisfactions that her work gives her, and that makes her happy.

With her new loan she will buy fabric, thread, and Lenci wool to begin making products for the Christmas season.  Her customers have requested Christmas tablecloths, tree skirts, etc. 

*Dora is the first of the women standing, wearing a black and white blouse.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and wool

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela works hard to support her family. Carmela is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Carmela requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy fabrics and other tools for sewing.

Carmela has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Carmela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other tools for sewing

loans.name: Chimeddorj

texts.en: Chimeddorj lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan, Mongolia. His wife is employed, his eldest child is in school and the younger one is in kindergarden. Chimeddorj started his deel (Mongolian traditional clothes) sewing business in 2008 by taking a sewing class in the same year. His deels are very stylish and of high quality. He provides customized service and is a trusted supplier by many. With his profits, Chimeddorj has already bought his own ger. Due to his machinery, his work is slow and he is not meeting customer demand. Therefore, he is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Munavvarkhon

texts.ru: Мунаввархон занимается скотоводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Munavvarhon works in animal husbandry. She breeds livestock for resale.  She has been doing this for six years. She is taking out a loan to buy sheep or goats.

loans.use: buy sheep or goats.

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
Virginiah is 35-years-old, married to Antony and they have four children. She has been in the business of selling charcoal to her clients for the last 8 years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 40,000.

She is applying for her sixth loan with KADET ltd of Kes 10,000. She will use the loan to buy stocks of charcoal. She paid the previous loan well and in good time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. With the anticipated profits she will save for the expansion of her business.

Her hopes are to educate her children and expand her business to sell cooking gas.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Pokr Sepasar.  She is married with two children – a ten-year-old daughter and a thirteen-year-old son.  Gohar has a high school education and has been farming for the past fifteen years.  She would like to expand her business and provide for her children’s education.  Gohar would like a loan to purchase additional livestock.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by 15%.  Gohar is pleased with the conditions of microfinance and the well-organized loan collection process in her village.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Abanamarimwe Group

texts.fr:
Aline fait partie du groupe Abanamarimwe et  habite à Gitega.	Elle a  25 ans et est mariée à serges,un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants.

Elle  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 7ans.
Elle a aussi une boutique(haricot,riz,sel,...) 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Aline is a member of the Abanamarimwe group and lives in Gitega.  She is 25 years old and is married to Serges, a farmer.  They have three children together.

Aline has been selling bananas for 7 years.  She also has a shop where she sells beans, rice, salt... This is her fourth loan with Turame.  With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy large quantities of bananas for resale, in order to make more money.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of bananas for resale.

loans.name: La Sagesse Group

texts.fr: LA SAGESSE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sabine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 31 ans. Sabine n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture, activité qu'elle exerce depuis neuf ans à son atelier. Sabine est mariée à un certain Romuald. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé. Sabine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Sabine vend des tissus et des colliers de façon complémentaire. Sabine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sabine  sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe LA SAGESSE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des colliers.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 21 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de un hijo de 1 año, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá. 
José para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, con  este negocio le ha ido muy bien pues gracias a su amabilidad tiene mucha clientela. El lleva 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio. José tiene el enorme deseo de hacer crecer negocio por esa razón ha considerado fundamental solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá para la compra de productos de abarrotes como: golosinas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar. 
Su gran esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio, contar con un local propio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de productos de abarrotes como: golosinas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar.

loans.name: Natik

texts.en:
This single man was born in 1981 in Salyan region Yenikand village. He likes the animals. He started his business 2 years ago. Natik wants to expand his business. 
He applies for the loan amount $800 to buy 3 cattle. He is very opimistic about the future of his business.

loans.use: to buy 3 cattle

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en: A. is 40 years old and married with 2 daughters. A. sells grilled chickens, and her husband, Adul, sells chicken in the market. She earns $5 per day. She really hopes to get a $50 loan to expand her business, and she intends to spend half of the loan to fund her husband's business. She hopes that, with her income, she can pay for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Selling grilled chicken

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 55. She is a widow with three children. Her greatest current challenge is paying her children's school fees, and also the poor health of one of her children. 

She has benefited from GHAPE loans in the past and has successfully paid them back. She says, thanks to the low interest rates, she has always paid back the loans with little stress. She believes her business is sound: she takes the manure from her pigs and uses it on her farm, sells her farm products and pigs and gets much money. She helps her community by making available these products and the manure for them to buy and improve their own farms. She intends to use the profit from her farm for the education of her children and expansion of her farm. She intends to take bigger loans in the future to grow her farm and build a good house for herself.

loans.use: Mixed Farming

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a married mother of 3 children. She is a hardworking woman who strives to see development in her local area of Nyahera . She belongs to a group of women who have come together to venture seriously into the pottery-making industry. Most people prefer clay ware as it lasts longer and is high-quality and economical.

She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business and to purchase all that is needed to make her business a success.

She belongs to a self-help women's group in Kisumu Kenya, called 'Ongeza Maarifa' which is a Swahili phrase meaning "increase your wisdom." They make a variety of products and are particularly involved in a project termed 'jiko kisasa' (earthen oven/cooker). This cooker was recently introduced and due to the high demand, the group is targeting to buy a kiln with higher capacity than the one currently in use. They also need to purchase a vehicle which would provide them a quicker and more efficient means of transporting their goods.

loans.use: To fund her pottery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more products for her store

loans.name: Victor H.

texts.es:
Victor lives in the borough of Tembladerani in La Paz, the capital city of Bolivia. He supports his family with his salary as a driver. He lives in his father-in-law´s house along with wife and children.

The credit will be used to turn a storage room into a bedroom for his children. Right now the kids share one room, but have grown and need more space.

This is Victor´s first time with IMPRO, and according to his credit score he qualifies to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Victor vive en la calle Mario Alborta de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como chofer asalariado con lo cual mantiene a su familia; vive en la casa de su suegro con su esposa y sus hijos. El crédito que solicita es para transformar la habitación de depósito en dormitorio para sus hijos ya que actualmente ellos viven en una sola habitación y los niños ya crecieron y necesitan mayor comodidad, No tiene antecedente con Impro pero según la evaluación socio-económica efectuada Victor califica para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: Turn a storage room into a bedroom for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tea farming business.

loans.name: Thi Nguyet

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyệt, 38 years old, has 3 school age children. She and her husband have a bicycle business. They’ve been in this business long time ago. They sell a lot of bikes at the start of school season. The shop carries brand new bikes but her husband sometimes puts used parts together for those who can not afford a new one. They have all kinds of bikes to satisfy everyone’s need. She would like to borrow money to replenish their shop. Daily income allows to pay small installments easily.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyệt, 38 tuổi, có 3 con còn đang đi học. Cả hai vợ chồng chị kinh doanh xe đạp từ lâu. Chị bán đắt hàng nhất khi học sinh bắt đầu đi học. Chị thường mua xe về bán, đôi khi chồng chị cũng lắp ráp lại từ những chiếc xe cũ để bán cho những người có thu nhập ít hơn, hay sử dụng vào mục đích khác. Xe chị bán có nhiều loại phù hợp với từng người. Chị vay vốn về để mua thêm xe bán.Ngày nào chị cũng có người mua nên có thu nhập, việc trả vốn hàng tuần không là vấn đề lớn đối với chị.

loans.use: Expand bicycle business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco is 47 years old. He is married and has 4 children who are studying in high school. The gentleman is a pineapple producer with more than 30 years of experience. He works all day on the plantations and he is involved in the whole production process including post-harvest and selling them.

It is relevant to explain that the production of pineapples requires an adequate fertilizer so that they can generate the expected harvest. Nutrients and chemical fertilizers are needed throughout the process. Currently, Francisco is having difficulties getting into the market with his product due to the fact that he doesn't have enough organic matter to incoporate into the soil. There isn’t enough fertilizer and the soils are poor in nutrients. It is for these reasons that his harvests aren’t going well. He lacks the capital to be able to correctly prepare the plantations and thereby achieve a successful harvest in which he can sell his pineapples in the different markets.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco, tiene 47 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando en secundaria, el señor es un productor de más de 30 años de experiencia dedicándose al cultivo de piña, trabaja todo el día en las plantaciones y se encuentra involucrado en todo el proceso productivo desde la postcosecha hasta la comercialización de la misma. Es relevante señalar que el proceso productivo de la piña requiere de una adecuada fertilización para que pueda generar la cosecha esperada, además de los nutrientes y abonos químicos que se necesitan en todo el proceso. Actualmente, el señor posee dificultades en la incursión del mercado con su producto, debido a que no cuenta con el material vegetativo necesario, no existe la fertilización adecuada, los suelos son pobres en nutrientes, razón por la cual sus cosechas se encuentra detenidas debido a la falta de capital económico para poder preparar correctamente las plantaciones y así lograr una cosecha exitosa, en la cual pueda comercializar en los diferentes mercados la piña.

loans.use: To buy nutrients like phosphorus, calcium, and organic matter for preparing his soil

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en: Osaretin H. is married with 2 children. She is 26 years old and hails from Edo State. She sews and sells clothing materials. She has been a LAPO client for over 5 years now. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more clothing materials for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for sale

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza belongs to the comunal bank “Carmen Cabrejos”, which is located in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. Shi is 43 years old and is the mother of 5 children. Her husband works in wood. With the first S/. 300.00 loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, Maritza decided to invest in a business of buying and selling merchandise.

She gets up at 7:00 am to prepare breakfast for her children and husband. After that, she spends the rest of the day until 4:00pm selling her merchandise.

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00, which will be paid back in 5 months, she will buy: clothing for women, men, and children, rings, bracelets, earrings, purses, wallets, handkerchiefs, shoes, jewelry, towels, ties, and Thermoses, etc.

Maritza is very content. She feels that she is an independent woman and her earnings allow her to help support her family. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos provides for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal Carmen Cabrejos, ubicado en el Jr Cahuide No 410, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la madera. Maritza con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en el negocio de compra y venta de mercadería. En la actualidad ella sigue con su mismo negocio de compra y venta de mercadería, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y de allí se dedica a la venta de su mercadería hasta las 4 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: ropas para damas caballeros y niños, sortijas, pulseras, aretes, carteras, billeteras, pañuelos, zapatos, joyas, toallitas, corbatas, ternos etc. Maritza esta muy contenta, por que esta se siente una mujer independiente y sus ganancias de penden de ella misma permitiéndole apoyar a su familia y también puede aportar en su hogar y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise

loans.name: Priscila Estefany

texts.en:
Priscila Estefany is a young entrepreneur who started a small business selling clothes just a couple of months ago. She is working to pay for her university studies and produce more revenue for her family. Priscila is married and says that, even though she has no children, it is hard to pay for all the expenses of the couple with just her husband’s job.

This entrepreneur sells her garments to friends, teachers at her university, and people in her neighborhood. She says that her business has an excellent reception from people she regularly visits, and her clientele continues to grow.

She used her first loan to open her business. Priscila is now requesting a second loan to buy goods for the approaching season in order to augment her sales volume and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Nisso

texts.ru:
Nisso P. is 55 years old, she is married and has 3 children. Nisso sells women's clothing in the markets of Isfara. Although her business is small, it is an influential addition to her family's budget. She expanded her business half a year ago with a loan from MicroInvest. Currently, she applied for a new loan for further expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Ниссо 55 лет, она замужем и у нее 3 детей. Ниссо продает женскую одежду на рынках Исфары. Хотя ее бизнес небольшой все же он дает весомый прибавок к ее семейному бюджету. Для расширения бизнеса получила в Микроинвест займ полгода назад. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To further expand business

loans.name: Sokhum's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhum U. (shown in picture on the right with her group members) was selected by members to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including hers. All the group members are living off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sokhum U., 43, is a widow with one daughter and one son. Her daughter is a garment factory worker and her son is a construction worker. Mrs. Sokhum has been selling vegetables in Ta Khmao market for five years. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase more vegetables so as to expand her business.

2-Mrs. Sochea C., 39, is also a widow with one son and one daughter. Both of them are enrolled in a local school. Her husband died a few months ago. In addition to her children, her parents-in-law also live with her. Sochea has been in the business of cutting grass to sell for cattle feed. Sochea is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 for her mother-in-law who sells Khmer noodles.

3-Mrs. OeU. H. and her husband, Mr. Sophan Ban, were married in 1997 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are enrolled in a local school. OeU. has been in the business of making and selling papaya pickle for ten years, while her husband has been a mason for ten years as well. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale, expand Khmer noodle business, and buy construction materials

loans.name: Ni Ketut Manis

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Manis works as a weaver, producing traditional cloth that is well-known for its unique weave. The income generated by her husband is not sufficient to meet her family’s needs. This has made Ni Ketut Manis diligent in her work towards producing one woven cloth each month. Ni Ketut Manis has become quite dependent on the income generated by creating these traditional woven pieces. Ketut Manis has high hopes of getting a loan from the DINARI foundation (via the village’s central institution), with which she can purchase equipment for weaving and various materials, including special thread out of which she can make better and more varied finished pieces.

Typically Ni Ketut Manis sells her finished products directly to the customers in the market. Money from the sale goes towards purchasing more thread. Ni Ketut Manis’s initial outlay for her activity was as big as Rp.200,000 (~US $22) and her earnings amount to Rp.50,000 (~US $5) for each finished woven piece. Ni Ketut Manis’s husband sometimes joins in to spin the thread which will be used to make new woven pieces. Although they live in a simple house, nevertheless Ni Ketut Manis is very happy with her small family in a home environment that is clean and pleasant.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Manis adalah seorang pengrajin Tenun Tradisional yang cukup terkenal karena keunikan cara pembuatannya. Penghasilan suaminya yang tidak mencukupi keperluan hidup keluarganya hal inilah yang membuat Ni Ketut Manis tekun dalam membuat tenunan sehingga setiap bulan bisa menghasilkan satu kain tenun. Membuat tenun tradisional ini sudah lama digelutinya sehingga Ni Ketut Manis sangat bergantung dengan penghasilan yang didapatinya dari membuat tenun. Besar harapan ketut manis untuk mendapatkan dana pinjaman dari yayasan Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga didesanya untuk membeli peralatan tenun dan perlengkapan tenun seperti benang khusus untuk tenun lebih banyak lagi agar hasilnya lebih bagus dan lebih bervariasi.

Biasanya Ni Ketut Manis menjual hasil tenunannya langsung kepasar tempat langganannya, setelah itu uang hasil penjualan dibelikan benang lagi. Modal awal yang dikeluarkan Ni Ketut Manis sebesar Rp. 200.000.- dan keuntungan yang diperoleh Rp. 50.000.- untuk setiap kain tenun yang sudah jadi. Suami Ni Ketut Manis terkadang ikut membantu memintal benang yang akan dipakai untuk membuat kain tenun yang baru. Walau mereka tinggal dirumah yang sangat sederhana tetapi Ni Ketut Manis sangat bahagia dengan keluarga kecilnya dengan keadaan rumah yang asri dan bersih

loans.use: To purchase weaving equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Elisa Benjamina

texts.es:
Elisa, de 49 años de edad, socia del Banco Comunal “Unión Pedregal”, sueña con tener un negocio propio, como un restaurante. 

Debido a que ella realiza actividades en su barrio, la venta de alimentos como las tamaladas, polladas y otros, beneficia en parte a su familia, a pesar de contar con ingresos que genera su esposo, también (su esposo) colabora junto a sus tres menores hijos con la realización de este negocio.
