Elena prepara los alimentos en su casa, el cual está ubicada en el barrio de pedregal alto en la ciudad de Huaraz, luego lo distribuye a pedido de los clientes. La mayor dificultad está en que a veces los clientes no le pagan a tiempo, pero aún así, ella espera tener un local donde pueda tener un negocio de servicio de restaurante.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500, el cual pagará en 4 meses, invertirá en insumos para sus polladas, platos y tenedores descartables que lo almacenará para las próximas actividades.
texts.en:
Elisa is 49 years old and is a member of the communal bank “Union Pedregal.” Her dream is to have her own restaurant.

She works selling food such as tamaladas and polladas in her neighborhood in order to benefit her family. Even though they count on her husband’s income, her husband and her three small children also help Elisa with her business.

Elisa prepares the food in her home which is located in the pedregal alto neighborhood in the city of Huaraz. She then distributes her clients’ orders. Her biggest difficulty is that her clients sometimes do not pay her in time. Even so, she hopes to be able to have her own business space where she can establish a restaurant.

With this $175 loan - which she will repay in four months - she will purchase ingredients for her polladas, plates and disposable forks.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for her buisiness.

loans.name: Khov

texts.en:
Khov B., 68, and her husband, Dem Krut, 69, live in a small village across from the Mekong River, which is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1964 and have five children. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter weaves silk at home. Khov and Dem also live with their two grandchildren and niece, and they are all silk weavers.
Khov is a silk weaver and a rice farmer. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then sells the items in Phnom Penh. Even though both are in their late 60's, they are both still strong enough to work. 

Khov is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more silk materials for five looms for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling perfumes, deodorants and similar products

loans.name: Edmith

texts.es:
La señora Edmith, socia del BC “DORADINAS EN ACCION”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia del Dorado y distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, bebidas gasificadas y chicha de maíz. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 04 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y demás productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Edmith  tiene 33 años de edad,  vive con su hijo y su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura. Está agradecida con el apoyo brindado porque le permite crecer en su negocio. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Edmith is a member of the Doradinas en Acción (Dorado Women in Action) Village Bank, and lives in the San Martín region, in the San José de Sisa district of the Dorado province. She earns her living selling groceries, soft drinks, and chicha de maíz (a local drink made from corn). Her business is in her home, where her customers shop daily. With the loan of 1,000 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, Edmith will buy basic grocery products such as rice, sugar, detergents, canned goods, milk boxes, personal hygiene products, and other products she needs to stock her business and satisfy her customers’ needs. Edmith is 33-years-old, and lives with her son and her husband, who is a farmer. She is very appreciative of the support she receives, as it allows her to grow her business. Her goal is to grow her business and buy her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, canned goods, milk boxes, personal hygiene products, etc..

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Thuo's Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of seventeE. people is located in Phum Soupy village in Kampong Chhnang province.  Mrs. Thuo C. is a village bank president. 

She is a basket maker and also a pig breeder.  Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy three more piglets for breeding.  Her husband, Mr. Leng Run, is a laborer who can make a small income to support the family.  

Mrs. Thuo C. is 21 years old and the mother of two childrE. who are both too yoU. to work or study because they are at the ages of five months and two years old.  Mr. Dieb P. did not come to take the loan with his wife is, so she is presented in the picture instead.
   
All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 25 años, viene conviviendo más de 4 años con su pareja, es madre de 3 hijos, por el momento está viviendo en la casa de su madre. Desde muy niña apoyaba en los trabajos de agricultura a sus padres, ahora levanta a las 5.00am para preparar el desayuno, en seguida lava los pañales de su bebe, y a toda prisa prepara el almuerzo para llevar a la chacra donde ya se encuentra laborando su esposo. Ella y su esposo todos estos años han estado sembrando papa, pero en esta oportunidad va incrementar su producción sembrando arvejas. También sembrará flores para que las pueda vender en el próximo mes de mayo por el día de las madres donde le será muy rentable. Carmen ya tiene preparada su chacra para la siembra de arveja, donde anteriormente sembró papá. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido en cumplir con los pagos en las fechas señaladas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará semilla de arveja, a un costo aproximado de 400 soles, y con el resto comprará abono.
texts.en:
Carmen is 25 years old and has been living with her partner for more than 4 years. She is the mother of 3 children and for the moment she is living in her mother’s house. Since she was a very young girl she has helped her parents with agricultural work. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to make breakfast, and then she washes her baby’s diapers and quickly prepares lunch for her husband who is already working on their farm.

For several years she and her husband have been planting potatoes, but this opportunity is going to increase their production by planting peas. Carmen will also plant flowers so that she can sell them next May for Mother’s Day, which will be very profitable. Carmen has already prepared her farmland for the planting of peas where she previously grew potatoes.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is committed to making the payments on the scheduled dates. With the solicited money she will buy pea seeds at a cost of approximately 400 soles and with the rest she will buy fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Angèle A. est propriétaire d’un pressing à Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle est propriétaire de cette entreprise depuis 5 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit acheter un nouvel appareil à laver et des gardes habits pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Angèle A. is the owner of a laundry in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has owned this business for 5 years and hopes to use this loan to buy a new washing machine and clothing protectors so as to better satisfy her clientele. She is counting on this opportunity to change the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing a new washing machine

loans.name: Adija

texts.en:
Adija has been a business woman in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 5 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2003).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her retail business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Adija is 48 years old, divorced, and has four children: ages 26, 20, 18 and 16. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Crisnan

texts.en:
Crisnan M. owns a small "sari-sari" store. She is 52 years old and has only 1 child. She started her business since marrying her husband, Elmer M.. Aside from the store, she also owns a van. Her husband is using it for passengers and additional income for the family. She wants to buy another van to augment their income. They also farm. They grow rice and sell all their produce to rice traders.

She is requesting a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and additional stock for her sari-sari store business. Her loan will help her grow her store and improve the soil on her farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. They not only provide their clients credit assistance, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and additional stock for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Niamtougou, madame B. afi est une revendeuse de liqueur préparé localement à base du mil et de soja. Elle est domiciliée à Kpémé. Avec quatre personnes à charge, elle achète du mil et du soja pour préparer sa boisson pour la vente. De cette vente , elle tire l’essentiel de son revenu pour les besoins de sa famille. Vu la lourde responsabilité qui la tienne et surtout l’éducation de ces enfants, elle ne cesse de courir de gauche  à droite  pour trouver un stable capable d’assurer l’épanouissement de ces enfants. Pour accroître sa capacité de vente, elle sollicite un financement qui lui permettra de faire face à la demande et d’augmenter son revenu.
texts.en:
Afi B. was born in Niamtougou in 1971, lives in Kpémé, and sells locally-produced millet and soy-based liqueurs for a living. With four people in her care, she buys millet and soya to prepare drinks for selling. This activity provides the bulk of the income with which she supports her family. Given this heavy burden of responsibility, particularly that of her children's schooling, she is constantly on the hunt for a way to secure their educational development. In order to increase her selling power, she is looking to obtain funding that will allow her to meet customer demand and generate more income.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of millet and soya supplies for preparing drinks

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata Koné est âgée de 40 ans mariée et mère  de 5 enfants. Elle  vit  avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Kôkô de la préfecture de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales elle n’est pas allée à l’école. Très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus   apprises  auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour  la vente du bois de chauffe il y a 5 ans. Il est à noter que Fatoumata a 20 ans d’expérience dans le commerce d’articles divers.  Le bois est l’un des éléments essentiels pour les femmes Maliennes  dans la  préparation (cuisine). 
Dans le souci de constituer un stock important de bois de chauffe en vu de prévenir  l’hivernage où   la rupture du  bois de chauffe est très cruciale, elle décide de  rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Madame Fatoumata  envisage utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  2 chargements de  camion remorque en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans des villages  environnants  de Koutiala  et elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte au quartier Kôkô. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 150 000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des d’intérêts du prêt, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Koné, age 40, is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and children in the Kôkô district, in Koutiala prefecture (Region of Sikasso). For societal reasons, she did not go to school. She soon got interested in revenue-generating work, something she learned from her mother. After having tried several kinds of work unsuccessfully, she ended up five years ago opting to sell firewood. It should be noted that Fatoumata has 20 years of experience in the commerce of various goods. Firewood is one of the essential elements for women in Mali when preparing food.

Concerned about building a sizable stock of firewood in anticipation of the off-season, when firewood shortages are crucial, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan.

Ms. Fatoumata envisions using this loan to buy two truckloads of firewood from rural producers around Koutiala. She makes her sales in front of her doorway, in the Kôkô district.

She plans to realize a profit of 150,000 franc CFA per month that will be used to make loan interest payments, to help cover day-to-day family expenses, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Amam

texts.en:
Amam S. is currently selling beans and rice at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more chairs and tables for enough accommodation of customers in her restaurant. She is 28 years old and got married to a clerk who works in the Ministry of Regional Co-operation, government of Southern Sudan (GOSS). Amam has one child who doesn't go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase land, build a house and rent it out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more chairs and tables for her little restaurant

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno.  Ella tiene 70 años D. edad y es madre D. 06 hijos, (solo dos viven con ella y están estudiando), D. estado civil casada, y tiene estudios D. Secundaria completa.  Vive en el Barrio Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal (hace 10 años aproximadamente).  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizó para la compra D. ganado menor.  Paralelamente tiene un negocio, juntamente con su esposo, D. venta D. repuestos  D. maquina D. coser. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra D. repuestos D. maquinas D. coser y comprar algunas cabezas D. ovino.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando hasta que las fuerzas le permitan

Nos cuenta que les gusta mucho los ahorros que podido juntar gracias a sus créditos.
texts.en:
Ms. Flora M. is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Microfinance Institute, located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 70-year-old married mother of 6 children, only two of whom live with her and attend school. She completed secondary school and lives in the Central neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement since the founding of the microfinance institute approximately 10 years ago. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used to purchase minor livestock breeds. Additionally, she and her husband sell spare parts for sewing machines.

At this time, she needs a 500.00 PEN loan so that she can invest it in purchasing spare parts for sewing machines and heads of cattle.

Her biggest dream is to keep working as long as she is physically able to do so.

She states that she really likes the savings that she has been able to set asiD. thanks to these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock and spare parts for sewing machines

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is a resident of Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in May 2009 and obtained a loan to amounting Php 3,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetables and fruit plants.

She's is thankful to Paglaum micro-finance for their programs and services that help the poor people and encourage them to work hard for their future. She wishes to have a better living in the future and to be able to give their children a good future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro tiene 43 años, es un hombre muy noble y trabajador, vive en su casa propia. Desde pequeño se dedica a la siembra y al cuidado de sus cultivos agrícolas, por lo que aprendió las técnicas de esta actividad que ahora realiza con mucha precisión. Alejandro sabe cómo y cuándo sembrar la papa, arveja y maíz, por eso muchas veces sus vecinos le piden consejo para sus cultivos y esto lo reconforta y anima a seguir compartiendo sus conocimientos. La dificultad de Alejandro es en el momento de la comercialización de sus productos en el mercado, pues tiene problemas de audición y no habla muy claro, además su esposa es analfabeta y se limita a cuidar los productos mientras él se esfuerza en hacerse entender con sus clientes. Pese a esta discapacidad tiene planes de surgir, por ello piensa comprar una motosierra para talar árboles de su chacra y poder vender leña, generándose así un ingreso adicional. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, demostrando ser un cliente muy responsable y que le gusta asistir a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal para estar enterado de los acuerdos de su grupo. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la comprar 20 sacos de fertilizantes químicos, calcula que le costará un aproximado de 2300 soles, con el resto del dinero comprará bolsas de arvejas (semilla).
texts.en:
Alejandro is 43 years old, he is a very noble and hard working man who lives in his own home. Since he was little he has spent time planting and taking care of his crops, so he was able to learn all the techniques of this activity, and now he does it with great precision. Alejandro knows how and when to plant potatoes, peas and corn, so many neighbors ask for his advice for their crops. This has reassured and encouraged him to continue sharing his knowledge. Alejandro's difficulty; however, is in selling his products at the market as he has trouble hearing and speaking very clearly, besides this, his wife is illiterate and simply looks after the goods as he strives to understand their customers. Despite his disability, he has plans to grow his business, so he plans to buy a chainsaw to cut trees from his farm to sell as firewood, thus generating additional income. This is his eighth loan from MFP and he is proving to be a very responsible member. He likes to attend all meetings of his community bank in order to be aware of all the arrangements made for his group. The money he is requesting is for the purchase of 20 bags of chemical fertilizers, the cost is estimated to be approximately 2300 suns, with the rest of the money being used to purchase peas (seed).

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur is a young and active vendor of balot (incubated 18 day old duck eggs). She is Mrs. Evelyn C., 28 years of age, married to Angelito C., a tricycle driver in the city. They are blessed with four children: three of them are now in elementary school and the other one is an infant.

With starting capital of 500 PHP from a lending investor, she was able to begin her business almost a year ago. Now she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000 PHP. Upon hearing the good news of Paglaum MPC, she immediately joined the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) in the year 2006. With her good credit record, she has accessed multiple loans.

Now on her sixth cycle, she is applying for 8,000 PHP to buy one unit tricycle for her husband. Her hope in life is to be able to meet the daily needs of her family and give them a better education for their future.

loans.use: To purchase one unit tricycle

location.town: Ozamis-P6 Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Lydia Kai

texts.en:
Lydia is married and has four children. Her husband is a welder. Her oldest child passed the Bac this year and will go to university in the fall. Lydia lives on the outskirts of Porto-Novo, the capital of Benin. She sells second-hand clothes, snacks, and vegetables in front of her home. She has been involved in this activity for ten years. Lydia buys her goods in Cotonou, a large city that is about an hour away. 

Lydia has already had two loans from Alide, a Kiva field partner in Benin. Thanks to these Alide loans, she was able to buy a machine that grinds peppers that are used in many Beninese dishes. She supplements her sales by letting people use the grinder for a fee. Lydia is seeking a third loan to restock her inventory. She would also like to start selling jewelry and necklaces.

loans.use: Second-hand clothes, jewelry, necklaces, and other goods

loans.name: Kossi Essenam

texts.fr: Ce monsieur dispose d’un entrepôt de vente de maïs dans le quartier d’Atiégou à Lomé. Il a ouvert cet entrepôt depuis 2000 et ce commerce lui permet de vendre à des femmes grossistes, revendeuses au grand marché de Lomé. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses 02 enfants. Son entrepôt est très connu de beaucoup de vendeurs de maïs. Il reçoit ses commandes de plusieurs villages de l’intérieur du pays. Pour lancer de nouvelles commandes, il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This gentleman owns a corn warehouse and selling point in the Atiégou neighborhood in Lomé. He opened this warehouse in 2000, and this business enables him to sell to women who buy wholesale and resell at the grand market in Lomé. This business enables him to provide for his wife and his two children. His warehouse is known to many corn sellers, and he gets his orders from several villages in the interior of the country. To launch new orders, he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of corn

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita F., 36, has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2002 but embarked on establishing a hardware store only five years ago. Her husband Rogito, 39, is a plumber. All their four children are in school. They live in Maricaban, Pasay City.

Julita sells small spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles, as well as small industrial supplies. Her store is not large but since it is located on one of the city’s busy streets she is always busy attending to customers. She laments that she can’t have quality time with her children anymore, so she has hired two assistants to tend to customers. Julita now earns a net income of close to P300,000.00 a month.

Her loans from the cooperative and profits earned from her business have helped her to expand her store. She was also able to buy a family vehicle. In the future, she hopes to be able to establish another store in a different location. Julita is now teaching her children the value of hard work at a young age, as she wants them to inherit her business skills.

Julita is currently applying for a loan in the amount of P50,000.00 for the expansion of her business.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical missions in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Vecinos Unidos 1,2, &3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group. Vecinos Unidos (Neighbors United). Her story is representative of both her group members and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently moved from the Haiti to the DR) clients. Her group is based in the Samana peninsuL. where both running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and three children. 

Maria is excited to take her first loan from Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to improve her business, selling used clothing. She has over two years experience and believes that there is a market for her new inventory. She hopes to use the profits from this business to purchase an inverter (to deal with the long periods of blackout), home appliances and a computer for her children. She recognizes that all of these goals will take time but as she develops her business, she hopes to accomplish all of these goals including her long-term goal of having her own vehicle and a better home.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Mrs. San Choem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who live in Rumcheck village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan group. Mrs. San C. has been selected by the members as the village bank president, and they all will use the loan for different purposes. 

She is a weaver. She also is a pig breeder. Since her both business are going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more silk materials and to buy more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her business. Her husband, Mr. So R., is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a laborer. Mrs. San C. is 49 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more silk materials and to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es: El banco comunal " Nuevo Amanecer " esta representado por el señor Samir y conformado por 13 miembros D. socias  muy trabajadoras que van cumpliendo su tercer ciclo con expectativas D. lograr más ingresos y demostrando ganas D. salir adelante con honestidad, responsabilidad y trabajo. Las socias tienen diversas actividades como la venta D.  venta D. pan, salteñas, cosméticos, verduras, comida, tienda D. abarrotes, ropa y empanadas. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que es alta en el mercado en el cual trabajan pero las socias tienen la esperanza D. contar siempre  con clientes fieles y a los que les gusta su trabajo para que puedan obtener el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. su familia. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. mercaría en mayor cantidad para surtir sus tiendas, insumos para las socias que venden comida y para herramientas que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos para poderles dar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer Communal Bank, represented by Mr. Samir, is comprised of 13 group members who are very hard-working. The group is currently in its third cycle, with the hopes of obtaining greater profits. They have demonstrated the desire to get ahead through honesty, responsibility and work. The group members run different businesses, such as selling bread, salteñas (meat-filled pastries), cosmetics, vegetables, fast food, provisions, clothing or empanadas. Competition is strong in the market where they work, but the group members can count on their faithful customers who love their work so that they can earn the income needed to sustain their families. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise in bulk so that they can restock their shops, purchase supplies for fast food sales, and purchase the work tools that they need to improve their earnings so that they can offer their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ngumbi

texts.en:
Ngumbi M. is a married father of six living in Bamenda, Cameroon.

Ngumbi M. is a passionate individual who has been working with GHAPE since 2005. To date, Ngumbi has accepted three loans and has successfully repaid his debt in all three instances. He has also faithfully supported his lending group when needed.

Having recently experienced the passing of both his father and mother, Ngumbi has had some significant unexpected expenses. His livestock have been a necessary source of income in order to provide for his family. Ngumbi is currently requesting a small loan to assist with the purchase of pigs, chickens and feed for each. He is also familiar with the necessary medications required to keep livestock healthy. Part of his loan would be put towards ensuring his livestock remain in good health. Ngumbi considers that he will continue to do very well in the sales of livestock because he has several loyal customers and significant experience in the raising of animals.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase livestock, feed and animal medications

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Mrs. Patria C., 48 years of age, married but separated from her husband, is a resident of Sumirap, Tangub City. She is currently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store along the National Highway.

Patria has two children and both are now of school age. Being separated from her husband is not easy for her but she faced life’s challenge together with her live-in partner who is a driver.

For seven years, Patria was able to sustain her business and now she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,500 a month. She joined Paglaum MPC two years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

With a good credit record, Patria was able to obtain multiple loans. Now, she is given the privilege of obtaining her 4th loan in the amount of P25,000 with a project proposal of purchasing a secondhand motor cab to be attached to their newly acquired motorcycle to make it a passenger cab for hire. The remainder of the loan will be used to add to the capital of her sari-sari store business.

The future income will be used for Patria’s loan repayments and as savings for the future, especially for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motor cab and to purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en: Gantugs is a 34 year old divorced mother of two children who lives in a house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her two children, 14 and 10, both attend a local secondary school while Gantugs runs a machinery part retail business out of a shipping container in the local market. She began her business in 2000 with working capital of 3,000,000 tugrugs, and since then she has grown her business operations and established herself in the business community. Her working capital now exceeds 10,000,000 tugrugs, and she credits part of her success to her accounting training. She says, “I want to have a warm, safe working environment as well as save up money for my children’s education.” Gantugs is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrugs loan in order to purchase machinery parts from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase machinery parts.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily J. is from the village of Unidos. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2003, Emily joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Emily is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her twelfth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is a simple woman who has simple dreams in life. 

As a mother and a wife, she wishes to remain healthy and live longer so that she can continue to take care of her husband and children, as well as her grandchildren in the future.  She hopes to grow her tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar) for hire business with the loan she is requesting now from ASHI, Kiva field partner in the Philippines.  

In addition to her other sources of income, such as providing laundry services (hand washing) and selling food, Yolanda envisions that the profits from her tricycle-for-hire business will help her see her two children achieve their own dreams in life. Her elder child, a 25-year-old high school graduate, and her 51-year-old husband will manage the tricycle since now they are now unemployed.  Her younger child is accumulating large amount of expenses in school, since she is 20 years old and in her fourth year college. To be able to sustain her daughter's education until graduation, which they expect soon, and to change the kind of life they are experiencing now, Yolanda’s husband and son must help her earn an income. 

Through loans she can requests through ASHI, Yolanda is very much hopeful that someday she will make it happen.

loans.use: To purchase a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for a transportation-for-hire business.

loans.name: Esther Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra. Esther del S. C. C. es empleada en una institución local en el Municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito el que va a utilizar en la compra de un terreno para construcción futura de una casa.

Ella empezó a trabajar por la necesidad de tener un ingreso fijo mensualmente y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella tiene aproximadamente unos 3 años de trabajar en dicha institución de lunes a viernes desde las  8 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, cabe señalar que antes de trabajar ella se dedicaba a sus estudios en secundaria.

Ella espera que con compra de este terreno en un futuro se le facilite aun más la construcción de su propia casa y darle un hogar justo y digno a su familia ya que ese un uno de sus principales objetivos al estar trabajando. Ella es una mujer casada y con un niño que aun no esta en edad escolar y vive con su esposo en casa de sus suegros.

Este es el primer crédito que ella solicita en Ceprodel y espera que dicho financiamiento le beneficie positivamente ya  que su principal objetivo es la construcción de su casa de habitación y quiere empezar por la compra de dicho terreno ya que por cuenta propia no se podría por que los ingresos familiares son muy bajo.
texts.en:
Esther del S. C. C. is employed by a local institution in the city of Condega. She is requesting funds to buy a lot for the future building of her home. She began to work because she needed a secure, monthly income and to improve her living conditions. She has been working for the aforementioned institution for about 3 years from Monday-Friday from 8am until 5pm. It's worth mentioning that prior to starting to work she was in high school. She hopes that the purchase of this lot will make building her house in the future easier and will give her family a just and proper place to live since this is one of her main goals in working. She is married and has a son, who is still too young for school; she lives with her husband in the house of her in-laws. This is her first loan with Ceprodel and she hopes to benefit greatly from it since her main objective is building her house and she wants to start to purchase the lot because her family income is insufficient to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor R., age 44, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She has a business of selling palm sugar, earning approximately US $3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. She has been doing this business since 2008. Her husband is a skillful blacksmith, earning an income of US $2 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since R. started this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand her business. R. is requesting a loan of US $1000 to purchase more palm sugar. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more palm sugar for resale

loans.name: Wiñay Muju Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Wiñay Muju” esta representado por el señor Primitivo y conformado por 10 socios de los cuales 3 son hombres y resto son mujeres es un grupo muy unido y trabajador como lo ha demostrado en su anterior ciclo demostrando siempre responsabilidad en sus pagos y unidad en su grupo. El presidente del banco comunal tiene dos líneas de taxi trufi en los cuales trabaja todo el día de lunes a sábado, el es padre de familia con tres hijos que cuida solo ya que es divorciado, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable ya que da lo mejor para sus hijos, el crédito esta destinado a la reparación de uno de sus taxis que va fallando y el lo tenerlo trabajando representa un plato menos en la casa, la persona que mas colabora con don primitivo es su madre que lo ayuda con el cuidado de sus hijos. El resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de  comida, zapatos, rellenos y productos de belleza, refrescos. Dentro del ámbito competitivo es alto  por lo que ponen toda la dedicación para tener buenos resultados. El crédito esta destinado a innovar sus negocios y en algunos casos incrementar su mercadería, insumos y a la reparación de sus herramientas de trabajo para obtener mejores ingresos para el sustento de sus familias y el bienestar de sus hijos que son la motivación mas grande para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The “Wiñay Muju” communal bank is represented by Primitivo and is made up of 10 members, 3 of whom are men and 7 are women. It is a very unified and hard-working group as was demonstrated in their previous loan cycle where they always demonstrated responsibility and group unity with their payments. The group president has two trufi taxi routes (taxis that travel routes and pick up several passengers that share the ride) that he works in daily from Monday through Saturday. He is a divorced, father of three children for whom he is the sole caretaker. He is a very hard-working, responsible person who does the best for his children. He will use the funds to service one of his vehicles because it is breaking down and, not having it in working order, translates to one less full dinner plate at home. The person who helps Primitivo the most is his mother, who cares for the children. The rest of the members are involved in various commercial activities, like: sale of food, shoes, beauty products, beverages. They all have high competition to face so they put great effort into their work in order to obtain good results. The funds will be used to innovate and, in some cases, to increase stock merchandise and ingredients; some will repair work tools in order to obtain better income for the support of their families and the wellbeing of their children, who are the motivating force behind their wanting to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Homero

texts.es: El joven Homero Gómez es soltero y vive solo en su hogar, el labora para una empresa de noticias y publicaciones diarias, desde hace 5 años, y esta tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su casa para mayor seguridad, ya que por razones de trabajo su casa esta sola en el transcurso del día.
texts.en:
Young Homero Gómez is single and lives alone in his home. For the past five years, he has worked for a news and daily publications company. He is applying for a loan so that he can build a fence in front of his house to improve his security, since, because he is away at work during the day, his house is empty and vulnerable for most of the day.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de una barda en el frente de su casa

loans.name: Memounatou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, en 2003 elle a commencé le commerce de céréales, elle exerce son commerce près du marché local d’agoè logopé, elle s’approvisionne au marché d’Anié. Voulant gonfler son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 3 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de mil et 2 sacs d’haricot.
texts.en:
This lady is married and mother to three children. In 2003 she began selling cereals and she does this near the local market in Agoè Iogopé. She gets her supplies at the market in Anié. As she would like to boost her stock, she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy three bags of corn, two bags of millet and two bags of beans.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Alfredo Tomas

texts.es:
Alfredo forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene 49 años, tiene tres hijos. Su principal actividad económica es fabricar gaseosas “Embotelladora Industrial Sumac Kola” y  su actividad económica complementaria es administrar sus dos carros que hacen servicios de transportes de las ciudades de Cusco a Calca y viceversa. Ya son seis años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.

Alfredo es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Alfredo requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando insumos como por ejemplo saborizantes.
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Alfredo is part of the Sacred Valley communal bank. He is 49 years old and has three children. His main business as the sumac cola industrial bottler is to make soda. He also runs two taxis that go between Cusco and Calca. He's been at this work for six years, and it's going very well. Alfredo is a responsible and entrepreneurial person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead and help his family. Alfredo needs this loan for working capital to buy ingredients such as flavorings. He is very grateful for the opportunity he has through this Kiva partner and promises to make his payments on time, according to his payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soda flavorings
